tuv.seg: "<c1>#</c1>" can be customized with core.commentChar.
"<c1>#</c1>" 可以通过 core.commentChar 自定义。
"<c4>**/foo/bar</c4>" matches file or directory "<c5>bar</c5>" anywhere that is directly under directory "<c6>foo</c6>".
"<c4>**/foo/bar</c4>" 匹配任何位置的，直接位于目录 "<c6>foo</c6>" 下的文件或目录 "<c5>bar</c5>" 。
"Secure Hash Algorithm 1"; a cryptographic hash function.
"安全散列算法1";加密哈希函数。
"git diff A...B" is equivalent to "git diff $(git-merge-base A B) B".
"git diff A...B" 等价于 "git diff $(git-merge-base A B) B".
"ignore" by default.
默认为"ignore"。

(There is no option to remove a file only from the working tree and yet keep it in the index; use <c1>/bin/rm</c1> if you want to do that.) The files being removed have to be identical to the tip of the branch, and no updates to their contents can be staged in the index, though that default behavior can be overridden with the <c2>-f</c2> option.
(没有选项能只从工作树中删除文件，并将其保留在索引中;如果要这样做，请使用 <c1>/bin/rm</c1> 。)要删除的文件必须与分支尖端相同，并且在索引中不能对其内容进行暂存，尽管可以使用 <c2>-f</c2> 选项覆盖默认行为。

<a0>Individual Developer (Standalone)</a0> commands are essential for anybody who makes a commit, even for somebody who works alone.
<a0>个人开发人员（独立）</a0> 命令对于任何作提交的人，即使是单独工作的人也是至关重要的。

<a0>Repositories and Branches</a0> and <a1>Exploring Git history</a1> explain how to fetch and study a project using git—​read these chapters to learn how to build and test a particular version of a software project, search for regressions, and so on.
<a0>仓库和分支</a0> 和 <a1>探索 Git 历史</a1> 解释如何使用 git 来获取和学习一个项目，阅读这些章节以了解如何构建和测试软件项目的特定版本，搜索回归等等。
<a0>Repository Administration</a0> commands are for system administrators who are responsible for the care and feeding of Git repositories.
<a0>仓库管理</a0> 命令用于负责 Git 仓库的 care 和 feeding 的系统管理员。

<a0>git-add[1]</a0> to manage the index file.
<a0>git-add[1]</a0> 来管理索引文件。
<a0>git-am[1]</a0> to apply patches e-mailed in from your contributors.
<a0>git-am[1]</a0> 应用您的贡献者发送的补丁。
<a0>git-checkout[1]</a0> and <a1>git-branch[1]</a1> to switch branches.
<a0>git-checkout[1]</a0> 和 <a1>git-branch[1]</a1> 切换分支。
<a0>git-clone[1]</a0> from the upstream to prime your local repository.
<a0>git-clone[1]</a0> 从上游填充您的本地存储库。
<a0>git-commit[1]</a0> to advance the current branch.
<a0>git-commit[1]</a0> 推进当前分支。
<a0>git-diff[1]</a0> and <a1>git-status[1]</a1> to see what you are in the middle of doing.
<a0>git-diff[1]</a0> 和 <a1>git-status[1]</a1> ，看看你在做什么。
<a0>git-format-patch[1]</a0> to prepare and send suggested alternative to contributors.
<a0>git-format-patch[1]</a0> 准备并发送建议替代给贡献者。
<a0>git-format-patch[1]</a0> to prepare e-mail submission, if you adopt Linux kernel-style public forum workflow.
如果采用 Linux 内核风格的公共论坛工作流程，则需要 <a0>git-format-patch[1]</a0> 来准备电子邮件提交。
<a0>git-init[1]</a0> to create a new repository.
<a0>git-init[1]</a0> 来创建一个新的存储库。
<a0>git-log[1]</a0> to see what happened.
<a0>git-log[1]</a0> 看看发生了什么。
<a0>git-merge[1]</a0> to merge between local branches.
<a0>git-merge[1]</a0> 在本地分支之间合并。
<a0>git-pull[1]</a0> and <a1>git-fetch[1]</a1> from "origin" to keep up-to-date with the upstream.
从 "origin" 的 <a0>git-pull[1]</a0> 和 <a1>git-fetch[1]</a1> 保持最新的上游。
<a0>git-pull[1]</a0> to merge from your trusted lieutenants.
<a0>git-pull[1]</a0> 从你信任的副官合并。
<a0>git-push[1]</a0> to publish the bleeding edge.
<a0>git-push[1]</a0> 发布 bleeding edge.
<a0>git-push[1]</a0> to shared repository, if you adopt CVS style shared repository workflow.
如果采用 CVS 样式共享仓库工作流， <a0>git-push[1]</a0> 共享仓库。
<a0>git-rebase[1]</a0> to maintain topic branches.
<a0>git-rebase[1]</a0> 维护主题分支。
<a0>git-request-pull[1]</a0> to create a summary of changes for your upstream to pull.
<a0>git-request-pull[1]</a0> 来创建您上游要拉取的更改的摘要。
<a0>git-reset[1]</a0> and <a1>git-checkout[1]</a1> (with pathname parameters) to undo changes.
<a0>git-reset[1]</a0> 和 <a1>git-checkout[1]</a1> (使用路径名参数)撤消更改。
<a0>git-revert[1]</a0> to undo botched commits.
<a0>git-revert[1]</a0> 来撤销拙劣的提交。
<a0>git-send-email[1]</a0> to send your e-mail submission without corruption by your MUA.
<a0>git-send-email[1]</a0> 发送您的电子邮件提交而不会被您的 MUA 篡改。

<c0>$GIT_SSH_COMMAND</c0> takes precedence over <c1>$GIT_SSH</c1>, and is interpreted by the shell, which allows additional arguments to be included.
<c0>$GIT_SSH_COMMAND</c0> 优先于 <c1>$GIT_SSH</c1>, 并且由 shell 解析，允许包括额外的参数。
<c0>--contains <commit></c0> is used to find all branches which will need special attention if <commit> were to be rebased or amended, since those branches contain the specified <commit>.
<c0>--contains <commit></c0> 用于查找所有需要特别注意的分支，如果<commit>被重新修改或修改，因为这些分支包含指定的<commit>。
<c0>--merged</c0> is used to find all branches which can be safely deleted, since those branches are fully contained by HEAD.
<c0>--merged</c0> 用于查找可以安全删除的所有分支，因为这些分支是由 HEAD 完全包含的。
<c0>--no-contains <commit></c0> is the inverse of that, i.e. branches that don’t contain the specified <commit>.
<c0>--no-contains <commit></c0> 是相反的，即不包含指定的<commit>的分支。
<c0>--no-merged</c0> is used to find branches which are candidates for merging into HEAD, since those branches are not fully contained by HEAD.
<c0>--no-merged</c0> 用于查找候选的合并到 HEAD 中的分支，因为这些分支未被 HEAD 完全包含。
<c0>git mergetool</c0> creates <c1>*.orig</c1> backup files while resolving merges.
在解决合并时， <c0>git mergetool</c0> 创建 <c1>*.orig</c1> 备份文件。
<c0>git pull</c0> fetches from <c1>origin</c1> by default and merges into the current branch.
<c0>git pull</c0> 默认从 <c1>origin</c1> 提取，并合并到当前分支中。
<c0>git rm</c0> normally outputs one line (in the form of an <c1>rm</c1> command) for each file removed.
<c0>git rm</c0> 通常为删除的每个文件输出一行(以 <c1>rm</c1> 命令的形式)。
<c0>git rm</c0> will not remove a file from just your working directory.
<c0>git rm</c0> 不会从您的工作目录中移除文件。
<c1>--branch</c1> can also take tags and detaches the HEAD at that commit in the resulting repository.
<c1>--branch</c1> 也可以在生成的存储库中的标签和分离 HEAD。
<c2>$GIT_SSH</c2> on the other hand must be just the path to a program (which can be a wrapper shell script, if additional arguments are needed).
另一方面，<c2>$GIT_SSH</c2> 只能是程序的地址（如果需要额外的参数，则可以是一个 shell 的包装脚本）。
<c2><time zone offset></c2> is a positive or negative offset from UTC.
<c2><time zone offset></c2> 是与 UTC 的正或负偏移量。
<c2>git reflog show</c2> is an alias for <c3>git log -g --abbrev-commit --pretty=oneline</c3>; see <a4>git-log[1]</a4> for more information.
<c2>git reflog show</c2> 是 <c3>git log -g --abbrev-commit --pretty=oneline</c3> 的一个别名; 详见 <a4>git-log[1]</a4> 。
<c2>stdout-is-tty</c2> should be either "true" or "false", and is taken into account when configuration says "auto".
<c2>stdout-is-tty</c2> 应为“true”或“false”，并在配置为“auto”时考虑。
<c4>GIT_EXTERNAL_DIFF</c4> should not worry about unlinking the temporary file --- it is removed when <c5>GIT_EXTERNAL_DIFF</c5> exits.
<c4>GIT_EXTERNAL_DIFF</c4> 不应担心取消临时文件的链接---当 <c5>GIT_EXTERNAL_DIFF</c5> 退出时，它将被移除。

<e0>git checkout</e0> with <paths> or <c1>--patch</c1> is used to restore modified or deleted paths to their original contents from the index or replace paths with the contents from a named <tree-ish> (most often a commit-ish).
<e0>git checkout</e0> 带 <paths> 或 <c1>--patch</c1> 用于从索引中的将修改或删除的文件恢复到其原始内容，或者使用指定的<tree-ish>(最常见的是 commit-ish)替换文件内容。

<e0>git config</e0> will ensure that the output is "true" or "false"
<e0>git config</e0> 将确保输出为“true”或“false”
<e0>git config</e0> will ensure that the output is a simple decimal number.
<e0>git config</e0> 将确保输出是一个简单的十进制数。
<e0>git config</e0> will ensure that the output matches the format of either --bool or --int, as described above.
<e0>git config</e0> 将确保输出与 --bool 或 --int 的格式匹配，如上所述。
<e0>git fetch</e0> can fetch from either a single named repository or URL, or from several repositories at once if <group> is given and there is a remotes.<group> entry in the configuration file.
<e0>git fetch</e0> 可以从单个命名的仓库或 URL 中抓取，也可以从多个仓库中抓取，如果给出了<group>，并且配置文件中有一个 remotes.<group> 条目。

<e0>git merge-base</e0> finds best common ancestor(s) between two commits to use in a three-way merge.
<e0>git merge-base</e0> 在两个提交之间找到最佳的共同祖先，以便在三向合并中使用。

<e0>git mergetool</e0> [--tool=<tool>] [-y | --[no-]prompt] [<file>…​]

<e0>git svn</e0> is a simple conduit for changesets between Subversion and Git.
<e0>git svn</e0> 是用于 Subversion 和 Git 之间的更改的简单管道。
<e0>git-config</e0> will expand leading <e1>~</e1> to the value of <e2>$HOME</e2>, and <e3>~user</e3> to the home directory for the specified user.
<e0>git-config</e0> 将 <e1>~</e1> 开头扩展为 <e2>$HOME</e2> ，将 <e3>~user</e3> 的值扩展到指定用户的主目录。

<e1>^<n></e1> means the <n>th parent (i.e. <e2><rev>^</e2> is equivalent to <e3><rev>^1</e3>).
<e1>^<n></e1> 表示第 n 个父对象(即 <e2><rev>^</e2> 等同于 <e3><rev>^1</e3> )。
<e1>git merge --abort</e1> will abort the merge process and try to reconstruct the pre-merge state.
<e1>git merge --abort</e1> 将中止合并进程，并尝试重构合并前状态。

<refspec> can name an arbitrary remote ref (for example, the name of a tag) or even a collection of refs with corresponding remote-tracking branches (e.g., refs/heads/*:refs/remotes/origin/*), but usually it is the name of a branch in the remote repository.
<refspec>可以指定任意的远程引用(例如，标签的名称)，甚至可以使用相应的远程跟踪分支的引用集合(例如，refs/heads/*:refs/remotes/origin/*)，但是通常它是远程存储库中的分支的名称。
<repository> should be the name of a remote repository as passed to <a0>git-fetch[1]</a0>.
<repository>应该是传递给 <a0>git-fetch[1]</a0> 的远程仓库的名称。
<s0>Check your version of git by running<br1>
<s0>通过运行检查您的 git 版本<br1>
<s0>NOTE:</s0> The latter form is just a short-hand of <c1>git checkout topic</c1> followed by <c2>git rebase master</c2>.
<s0>NOTE:</s0> 后一种形式只是 <c1>git checkout topic</c1> ，后跟 <c2>git rebase master</c2> 的快捷方式。
<s0>NOTE</s0>: see the NOTE for the <c1>--shared</c1> option, and also the <c2>--dissociate</c2> option.
<s0>注意</s0> ：请参阅 <c1>--shared</c1> 选项的注释，以及 <c2>--dissociate</c2> 选项。
<s0>Warning</s0>: Running <e1>git merge</e1> with non-trivial uncommitted changes is discouraged: while possible, it may leave you in a state that is hard to back out of in the case of a conflict.
<s0>警告</s0> ：带有非琐碎的未提交的更改，运行 <e1>git merge</e1> 是不鼓励的：它可能会使您因冲突处于难以返回的状态。
<s2><e3>git config</e3> will only ever change one file at a time</s2>.
<s2><e3>git config</e3> 一次只会更改一个文件</s2>。

A 1-based counter incremented by one for every path.
一个基于1的计数器为每个路径增加一个计数器。
A <a0>commit object</a0> or an <a1>object</a1> that can be recursively dereferenced to a commit object.
一个<a0>commit object</a0> 或 <a1>object</a1> ，可以递归地取消引用（译注：不应该是引用到么）到提交对象。
A <a0>named reference</a0> to the <a1>commit</a1> at the tip of a <a2>branch</a2>.
<a2>branch</a2> 尖端的 <a1>commit</a1> 的 <a0>named reference</a0> 。
A <a0>working tree</a0> is clean, if it corresponds to the <a1>revision</a1> referenced by the current <a2>head</a2>.
如果当前 <a2>head</a2> 对应于引用的 <a1>revision</a1> ，则 <a0>working tree</a0> 是干净的。
A <a0>working tree</a0> is said to be "dirty" if it contains modifications which have not been <a1>committed</a1> to the current <a2>branch</a2>.
如果 <a0>working tree</a0> 包含尚未进行 <a1>committed</a1> 到当前 <a2>branch</a2> 的更改，则称为 "dirty"。
A <c0>gitattributes</c0> file is a simple text file that gives <c1>attributes</c1> to pathnames.
一个 <c0>gitattributes</c0> 文件是将 <c1>attributes</c1> 赋予路径名的简单文本文件。
A <c0>gitignore</c0> file specifies intentionally untracked files that Git should ignore.
一个 <c0>gitignore</c0> 文件指定了 Git 应该有意忽略的未跟踪文件。
A CVS server emulator for Git
用于 Git 的 CVS 服务器仿真器
A Git project normally consists of a working directory with a ".git" subdirectory at the top level.
Git 项目通常由顶层的".git"子目录的工作目录组成。
A GnuPG signed tag object will be created when <c0>-s</c0> or <c1>-u <keyid></c1> is used.
当使用 <c0>-s</c0> 或 <c1>-u <keyid></c1> 时，将创建一个 GnuPG 签名的标签对象。
A birds-eye view of Git’s source code
Git 源代码的鸟瞰图
A blank line matches no files, so it can serve as a separator for readability.
空白行不匹配任何文件，因此它可以作为可读性的分隔符。
A command that takes a <commit-ish> argument ultimately wants to operate on a <commit> object but automatically dereferences <tag> objects that point at a <commit>.
使用<commit-ish>参数的命令最终需要在<commit>对象上操作，但会自动解析指向<commit>的<tag>对象。
A command that takes a <tree-ish> argument ultimately wants to operate on a <tree> object but automatically dereferences <commit> and <tag> objects that point at a <tree>.
使用<tree-ish>参数的命令最终需要在<tree>对象上操作，但是会自动解析指向<tree>的<commit>和<tag>对象。
A developer working as a participant in a group project needs to learn how to communicate with others, and uses these commands in addition to the ones needed by a standalone developer.
作为组织项目参与者的开发人员需要了解如何与他人进行沟通，并且除了独立开发人员所需的命令外，还使用这些命令。

A dumb server that does not do on-the-fly pack generations must have some auxiliary information files in $GIT_DIR/info and $GIT_OBJECT_DIRECTORY/info directories to help clients discover what references and packs the server has.
一个不做即时封装代码的哑服务器必须在 $GIT_DIR/info 和 $GIT_OBJECT_DIRECTORY/info 目录中有一些辅助信息文件，以帮助客户端发现服务器具有哪些引用和包。

A fairly central person acting as the integrator in a group project receives changes made by others, reviews and integrates them and publishes the result for others to use, using these commands in addition to the ones needed by participants.
在集体项目中作为集成者的相当重要的人员接到他人做出的改变，对其进行评估和整合，并将结果发布给其他人使用，除了参与者需要的命令之外还使用这些命令。

A file can be reverted back, only in the index but not in the working tree, to that of the last commit with <c1>git reset HEAD -- <file></c1>, which effectively reverts <e2>git add</e2> and prevents the changes to this file from participating in the next commit.
一个文件只能在索引中被还原，而不是在工作树中，使用 <c1>git reset HEAD -- <file></c1> 还原为上一次提交，这有效地恢复了<e2>git add</e2>，并阻止对此文件的更改参与下一次提交。
A formatted and hyperlinked copy of the latest Git documentation can be viewed at <c0>https://git.github.io/htmldocs/git.html</c0>.
可以在 <c0>https://git.github.io/htmldocs/git.html</c0> 查看最新 Git 文档的格式化和超链接副本。
A fourth object type, the tag, is provided for this purpose.
为此目的提供了第四个对象类型，tag（标签）。
A handy way to push the current branch to the same name on the remote.
将当前分支推送到远程上相同名称的方便方法。
A leading "<c0>**</c0>" followed by a slash means match in all directories.
开头的 "<c0>**</c0>" 后跟斜杠表示在所有目录中匹配。

A leading directory name (e.g. <c1>dir</c1> to remove <c2>dir/file1</c2> and <c3>dir/file2</c3>) can be given to remove all files in the directory, and recursively all sub-directories, but this requires the <c4>-r</c4> option to be explicitly given.
可以提供目录名称(例如 <c1>dir</c1> 删除 <c2>dir/file1</c2> 和 <c3>dir/file2</c3> )，以删除目录中的所有文件，也可以递归所有子目录，但这需要明确给出 <c4>-r</c4> 选项。
A leading slash matches the beginning of the pathname.
开头的斜杠与路径名的开头匹配。
A line starting with # serves as a comment.
以 # 开头的行作为注释。
A name referring to a list of repositories as the value of remotes.<group> in the configuration file.
在配置文件中通过 remotes.<group> 的值配置的，一组仓库的引用。
A number controlling the amount of output shown by the recursive merge strategy.
一个数字，用于控制递归合并策略显示的输出量。
A pathspec that begins with a colon <c0>:</c0> has special meaning.
以冒号 <c0>:</c0> 开头的 pathspec 有特殊的含义。
A pathspec with only a colon means "there is no pathspec".
一个只有一个冒号的 pathspec 意味着 "没有 pathspec"。
A portable graphical interface to Git
Git 的便携式图形界面
A project normally includes such <c2>.gitignore</c2> files in its repository, containing patterns for files generated as part of the project build.
项目通常在其存储库中包含这样的 <c2>.gitignore</c2> 文件，其中包含作为项目构建一部分生成的文件的模式。
A range of commits could also be removed with rebase.
一系列提交也可以用 rebase 删除。
A really simple TCP Git daemon that normally listens on port "DEFAULT_GIT_PORT" aka 9418.
一个非常简单的 TCP Git 守护程序，通常监听端口 "DEFAULT_GIT_PORT" 即 9418。
A really simple server for Git repositories
一个非常简单的 Git 仓库服务器

A ref followed by the suffix <e0>@</e0> with a date specification enclosed in a brace pair (e.g. <e1>{yesterday}</e1>, <e2>{1 month 2 weeks 3 days 1 hour 1 second ago}</e2> or <e3>{1979-02-26 18:30:00}</e3>) specifies the value of the ref at a prior point in time.
引用后跟 <e0>@</e0> 及用括号括起来的日期格式 (如 <e1>{yesterday}</e1>, <e2>{1 month 2 weeks 3 days 1 hour 1 second ago}</e2> or <e3>{1979-02-26 18:30:00}</e3>) 指定在先前时间点的引用值。
A ref followed by the suffix <e0>@</e0> with an ordinal specification enclosed in a brace pair (e.g. <e1>{1}</e1>, <e2>{15}</e2>) specifies the n-th prior value of that ref.
引用后跟 <e0>@</e0> 及包含在大括号中的序号(例如 <e1>{1}</e1> ， <e2>{15}</e2> )，指定该引用的前 n 值。
A ref may contain the SHA-1 name of an object or the name of another ref.
一个引用可以包含对象的 SHA-1 名称或另一个引用的名称。
A reflog shows the local "history" of a ref.
reflog 显示一个引用的本地 "历史"。
A repository administrator uses the following tools to set up and maintain access to the repository by developers.
仓库管理员使用以下工具来设置和维护开发人员对仓库的访问。
A revision parameter <e0><rev></e0> typically, but not necessarily, names a commit object.
修订参数 <e0><rev></e0> 通常但不一定指定一个提交对象。
A sample output looks like this:
示例输出如下所示：

A scripted Porcelain command can use set_reflog_action helper function in <c0>git-sh-setup</c0> to set its name to this variable when it is invoked as the top level command by the end user, to be recorded in the body of the reflog.
脚本化的高级命令可以在 <c0>git-sh-setup</c0> 中使用 set_reflog_action 帮助器函数将其名称设置为该变量，作为最终用户作为顶层命令调用，将其记录在 reflog 内。
A simple script to set up <c0>gitweb</c0> and a web server for browsing the local repository.
用于设置 <c0>gitweb</c0> 的简单脚本和用于浏览本地存储库的 Web 服务器。
A slash followed by two consecutive asterisks then a slash matches zero or more directories.
一个斜杠后跟两个连续的星号，然后一个斜杠匹配零个或多个目录。
A special ref named <c2>HEAD</c2> contains the name of the currently checked-out branch.
名为 <c2>HEAD</c2> 的特殊引用包含当前签出的分支的名称。
A standalone individual developer does not exchange patches with other people, and works alone in a single repository, using the following commands.
独立的个人开发人员不会与其他人交换补丁，并且在单个仓库中单独工作，使用以下命令
A stash is by default listed as "WIP on <e5>branchname</e5> …​", but you can give a more descriptive message on the command line when you create one.
默认情况下，储藏保存列表为"WIP on <e5>branchname</e5> …​"，但是您可以在创建时在命令行上给出更详细的描述性消息。
A suffix <e0>^</e0> to a revision parameter means the first parent of that commit object.
修订参数的后缀 <e0>^</e0> 表示该提交对象的第一个父对象。
A suffix <e0>~<n></e0> to a revision parameter means the commit object that is the <n>th generation ancestor of the named commit object, following only the first parents.
修订参数的后缀 <e0>~<n></e0> 表示指定提交对象的第 n 代祖先对象，跟随其第一个父对象。
A symbolic ref name.
符号引用名称。
A trailing "<c0>/**</c0>" matches everything inside.
尾随的 "<c0>/**</c0>" 匹配内部所有内容。
A typical integrator’s Git day.
一个典型的集成者的 Git 日常。
A web browser will be used for that purpose.
网络浏览器将用于此目的。
Abort the rebase operation and reset HEAD to the original branch.
中止 rebase 操作并将 HEAD 重置到原始分支。
Abort the rebase operation but HEAD is not reset back to the original branch.
中止 rebase 操作，但 HEAD 不会重置回原始分支。

关于

将 "glob" 魔术添加到所有路径。

添加 "icase" 魔术到所有路径规则。
Add "literal" magic to all pathspec.
为所有路径规则添加 "字面的" 魔术。
Add Signed-off-by line by the committer at the end of the commit log message.
在提交日志消息结束时由提交者添加签名。
Add a new remote, fetch, and check out a branch from it
添加一个新的远程，抓取，并从中检出一个分支
Add a tag reference in <c0>refs/tags/</c0>, unless <c1>-d/-l/-v</c1> is given to delete, list or verify tags.
在 <c0>refs/tags/</c0> 中添加一个标签引用，除非给出了删除，列出或验证标签的 <c1>-d/-l/-v</c1> 。
Add all existing files to the index.
将所有现有文件添加到索引。
Add file contents to the index
将文件内容添加到索引
Add modified contents in the working tree interactively to the index.
将工作树中的修改内容交互地添加到索引。
Add or inspect object notes
添加或检查对象注释
Added content is represented by lines beginning with "+".
添加的内容由以"+"开头的行表示。
Additionally, "[PATCH]" will be stripped from the commit description.
另外， "[PATCH]" 将从提交描述中删除。
Adds a new line to the option without altering any existing values.
在选项中添加新行，而不更改任何现有值。
Adds a remote named <name> for the repository at <url>.
在 <url> 中的仓库添加名为 <name> 的远程。
Adds content from all <c0>*.txt</c0> files under <c1>Documentation</c1> directory and its subdirectories:
从 <c1>Documentation</c1> 目录及其子目录中的所有 <c0>*.txt</c0> 文件中添加内容：

Advanced branch management
高级分支管理

After a merge (initiated by <e0>git merge</e0> or <e1>git pull</e1>) stops because of conflicts, cleanly merged paths are already staged to be committed for you, and paths that conflicted are left in unmerged state.
合并后(由 <e0>git merge</e0> 或 <e1>git pull</e1> 发起)由于冲突而停止，干净合并的路径已经被暂存为要为您提交，并且冲突的文件不再有未合并状态。
After building the state to be committed incrementally with these commands, <c3>git commit</c3> (without any pathname parameter) is used to record what has been staged so far.
在使用这些命令构建状态增量后，使用 <c3>git commit</c3> (没有任何路径名参数)来记录到目前为止已暂存的内容。
After choosing the path, it presents the diff between the index and the working tree file and asks you if you want to stage the change of each hunk.
选择路径后，它会显示索引和工作树文件之间的差异，并询问您是否要对每个 hunk 进行更改。
After deciding the fate for all hunks, if there is any hunk that was chosen, the index is updated with the selected hunks.
在决定所有块的命运之后，如果选择了任何块，索引将随选定的块更新。
After making the selection, answer with an empty line to stage the contents of working tree files for selected paths in the index.
进行选择后，用空行回答，对索引中所选路径的工作树文件的内容进行暂存。
After resolving conflicts and staging the result, <c0>git ls-files -u</c0> would stop mentioning the conflicted path.
解决冲突和暂存结果后， <c0>git ls-files -u</c0> 将停止提及冲突的路径。
After resolving the conflict manually and updating the index with the desired resolution, you can continue the rebasing process with
手动解决冲突并使用所需的解决更新索引后，您可以继续 rebasing 过程：
After running <c0>git reset <paths></c0> to update the index entry, you can use <a1>git-checkout[1]</a1> to check the contents out of the index to the working tree.
运行 <c0>git reset <paths></c0> 更新索引条目后，可以使用 <a1>git-checkout[1]</a1> 检查索引中的内容到工作树。

After running this <c0>git push</c0> on the <c1>satellite</c1> machine, you would ssh into the <c2>mothership</c2> and run <c3>git merge</c3> there to complete the emulation of <c4>git pull</c4> that were run on <c5>mothership</c5> to pull changes made on <c6>satellite</c6>.
在 <c1>satellite</c1> 机器上运行 <c0>git push</c0> 后，您将进入 <c2>mothership</c2> 并运行 <c3>git merge</c3> 完成在 <c5>mothership</c5> 上运行的 <c4>git pull</c4> 的仿真，以拉取 <c6>satellite</c6> 上的更改。
After staging changes to many files, you can alter the order the changes are recorded in, by giving pathnames to <c0>git commit</c0>.
在更改许多文件之后，您可以通过将路径名指定为 <c0>git commit</c0> 来更改记录更改的顺序。
After that, the easiest way to record all removals, additions, and modifications in the working tree is:
之后，在工作树中记录所有删除，添加和修改的最简单方法是：
After the above sequence, if you do:
经过以上顺序，如果你这样做：

After the clone, a plain <c0>git fetch</c0> without arguments will update all the remote-tracking branches, and a <c1>git pull</c1> without arguments will in addition merge the remote master branch into the current master branch, if any (this is untrue when "--single-branch" is given; see below).
克隆之后，没有参数的普通 <c0>git fetch</c0> 将更新所有远程跟踪分支，而没有参数的 <c1>git pull</c1> 将额外地将远程主分支合并到当前主分支（如果有的话）（当给出 "--single-branch" 时，这是不真实的;见下文）。
After the editor was closed, adjust the hunk headers and apply the patch to the index.
编辑器关闭后，调整 hunk 标题并将补丁应用于索引。
After this three-way merge, the local modifications are <e0>not</e0> registered in your index file, so <c1>git diff</c1> would show you what changes you made since the tip of the new branch.
在这种三路合并之后，本地的修改 <e0>没有</e0> 在您的索引文件中注册，所以 <c1>git diff</c1> 将显示您从新分支的提示之后所做的更改。
After working in the wrong branch, switching to the correct branch would be done using:
在错误的分支工作后，切换到正确的分支将使用：
After you mastered the basic concepts, you can come back to this page to learn what commands Git offers.
掌握基本概念后，您可以回到本页，了解 Git 提供的命令。
All changes made by commits in the current branch but that are not in <upstream> are saved to a temporary area.
在当前分支中但不在 <upstream> 中的提交产生所有更改，都将保存到临时区域。
All objects are named by the SHA-1 hash of their contents, normally written as a string of 40 hex digits.
所有对象都由其内容的 SHA-1 哈希命名，通常以40位数字的字符串形式写入。
All of these also allow you to omit the refspec from the command line because they each contain a refspec which git will use by default.
所有这些还允许您从命令行中省略 refspec，因为它们各自包含默认情况下将使用 git 的 refspec。
All remote-tracking branches and configuration settings for the remote are removed.
所有远程跟踪分支和远程的配置设置都将被删除。
All remote-tracking branches and configuration settings for the remote are updated.
所有远程跟踪分支和远程的配置设置都会更新。
All submodule paths must be unique within the .gitmodules file.
所有子模块路径在 .gitmodules 文件中必须是唯一的。
All writing options will per default write to the repository specific configuration file.
所有写入选项将默认写入仓库特定的配置文件。
Allow adding otherwise ignored files.
允许添加其他忽略的文件。
Allow recursive removal when a leading directory name is given.
当给出开头目录名时允许递归删除。
Allowing web browsing of a repository
允许网页浏览仓库

Also a leading directory name (e.g. <c1>dir</c1> to add <c2>dir/file1</c2> and <c3>dir/file2</c3>) can be given to update the index to match the current state of the directory as a whole (e.g. specifying <c4>dir</c4> will record not just a file <c5>dir/file1</c5> modified in the working tree, a file <c6>dir/file2</c6> added to the working tree, but also a file <c7>dir/file3</c7> removed from the working tree.

还可以给出一个以目录开头的名称（例如 <c1>dir</c1> 来添加 <c2>dir/file1</c2> 和 <c3>dir/file2</c3> ）来更新索引以匹配当前目录作为一个整体的状态（例如指定 <c4>dir</c4> 将不仅记录在工作树中修改的文件 <c5>dir/file1</c5> ，文件 <c6>dir/file2</c6> 添加到工作树中，还从工作树中删除了一个文件 <c7>dir/file3</c7> 。
Also called "global" configuration file.
也称为"全局"配置文件。
Also see "<a3>dirty</a3>".
另请参阅 "<a3>dirty</a3>"。
Also the branch heads at the remote are copied directly to corresponding local branch heads, without mapping them to <c6>refs/remotes/origin/</c6>.
远端的分支头也直接复制到相应的本地分支头，而不将它们映射到 <c6>refs/remotes/origin/</c6> 。
Also when you are satisfied with the filtered result, press ENTER (empty) back to the main menu.
此外，当您对筛选结果感到满意时，请按 ENTER (empty) 返回主菜单。
Also you can say ranges.
你也可以说范围。
Also, a variable defined without <c4>= <value></c4> is taken as true.
另外，没有 <c4>= <value></c4> 定义的变量被认为是 true 。
Also, when <c0>--force-with-lease</c0> option is used, the command refuses to update a remote ref whose current value does not match what is expected.
此外，当使用 <c0>--force-with-lease</c0> 选项时，该命令拒绝更新当前值与预期不匹配的远程引用。
Alternate terms
替代术语
Alternately you could <e0>rsync</e0> the changes into the working tree.
或者，您可以 <e0>rsync</e0> 更改到工作树。
Alternatively, if the variable is set to an absolute path (starting with a <e0>/</e0> character), Git will interpret this as a file path and will try to write the trace messages into it.
或者，如果变量设置为绝对路径(以 <e0>/</e0> 字符开头)，则 Git 会将其解释为文件路径，并尝试将跟踪消息写入其中。
Alternatively, using <a2>git-checkout[1]</a2> and specifying a commit, you can copy the contents of a path out of a commit to the index and to the working tree in one go.
或者，使用 <a2>git-checkout[1]</a2> 并指定提交，您可以一次性将索引的内容从提交中复制到索引和工作树。
Alternatively, you can undo the <e0>git rebase</e0> with
或者，您可以撤消 <e0>git rebase</e0>：
Although Git includes its own porcelain layer, its low-level commands are sufficient to support development of alternative porcelains.
虽然 Git 包含自己的高层命令，但其低级命令足以支持替代高级命令的开发。
An alternate participant submission mechanism is using the <c0>git request-pull</c0> or pull-request mechanisms (e.g as used on GitHub (www.github.com) to notify your upstream of your contribution.
可选的参与者提交机制是使用 <c0>git request-pull</c0> 或 pull-request 机制（例如，在 GitHub（www.github.com）上使用）通知您的上游关于您的贡献。
An empty string as search expression matches all lines.
一个空字符串作为搜索表达式匹配所有行。
An entry for the path is placed in the index with no content.
路径的条目被放置在没有内容的索引中。
An error happens when a source is neither existing nor controlled by Git, or when it would overwrite an existing file unless <c0>-f</c0> is given.
当源既不存在也不受 Git 控制时，或者当覆盖现有文件时，除非给出了 <c0>-f</c0> ，否则会发生错误。
An example is to ask for a "tree" with <object> being a commit object that contains it, or to ask for a "blob" with <object> being a tag object that points at it.
一个例子是要求一个 "树"，其中 <object> 是它包含的一个提交对象，或者要求一个 "blob"，其中 <object> 是指向它的标签对象。
An example:
一个例子：
An initial <c4>HEAD</c4> file that references the HEAD of the master branch is also created.
还会创建引用主分支的 HEAD 的初始 <c4>HEAD</c4> 文件。
An object to treat as the head of an unreachability trace.
作为不可达性跟踪头的对象。
An optional prefix "<c0>!</c0>" which negates the pattern; any matching file excluded by a previous pattern will become included again.
一个可选的前缀 "<c0>!</c0>" 用于否定模式;任何由先前模式排除的匹配文件将再次被包含。
An optional value suffix of <e1>k</e1>, <e2>m</e2>, or <e3>g</e3> in the config file will cause the value to be multiplied by 1024, 1048576, or 1073741824 prior to output.
配置文件中的可选值后缀为 <e1>k</e1> ， <e2>m</e2> 或 <e3>g</e3> 将导致该值乘以1024,1048576或1073741824。
An sub-area lieutenant for a repository will act both as a participant and as an integrator.
仓库的一个副区域副官将同时作为参与者和集成者。
Ancillary Commands
辅助命令
Annotate file lines with commit information
使用提交信息注释文件行
Annotated tags are meant for release while lightweight tags are meant for private or temporary object labels.
注释标签用于发布，而轻量级标签用于私有或临时对象标签。
Annotates each line in the given file with information from the revision which last modified the line.
注释给定文件中的每一行，用最后修改那行的修订版本的信息。
Another example of --onto option is to rebase part of a branch.
--onto 选项的另一个例子是变其分支的部分分支。
Another example:
另一个例子：
Another option is to bypass the commit that caused the merge failure with <c1>git rebase --skip</c1>.
另一个选择是使用 <c1>git rebase --skip</c1> 跳过导致合并失败的提交。
Any Git command accepting any <object> can also use the following symbolic notation:
任何接受任何<object>的 Git 命令也可以使用以下符号表示法：
Any changes to tracked files in the working tree since <commit> are discarded.
自 <commit> 以来，工作树中跟踪的文件的任何更改都将被丢弃。
Any single-valued variable set in this file will be overwritten by whatever is in <c1>~/.gitconfig</c1>.
此文件中设置的任何单值变量将被 <c1>~/.gitconfig</c1> 中的任何内容覆盖。
Any valid <refspec> (like the ones in the examples below) can be configured as the default for <c2>git push origin</c2>.
任何有效的<refspec>(如下面的例子中的那些)可以被配置为 <c2>git push origin</c2> 的默认值。
Append ref names and object names of fetched refs to the existing contents of <c0>.git/FETCH_HEAD</c0>.
将引用的引用名称和对象名称附加到 <c0>.git/FETCH_HEAD</c0> 的现有内容中。
Appendix A: Git Quick Reference
附录 A：Git 快速参考
Appendix B: Notes and todo list for this manual
附录B：本手册的备注和待办清单
Applies a quilt patchset onto the current branch
将 quilt 补丁集应用到当前分支上
Apply a patch to files and/or to the index
对文件和/或索引应用补丁
Apply a series of patches from a mailbox
从邮箱应用一系列补丁
Apply the change introduced by the commit at the tip of the master branch and create a new commit with this change.
应用 master 分支尖端的提交引入的改变，并通过此更改创建新的提交。
Apply the changes introduced by all commits on the master branch that touched README to the working tree and index, so the result can be inspected and made into a single new commit if suitable.
将 master 分支中所有有关 README 的提交引入的修改，应用到工作树和索引上，对结果进行检查并将其转换为单个新的提交。
Apply the changes introduced by all commits that are ancestors of maint or next, but not master or any of its ancestors.
应用所有作为 maint 或 next 的祖先的提交，但不是 master 或其祖先的提交引入的更改。
Apply the changes introduced by all commits that are ancestors of master but not of HEAD to produce new commits.
应用 master 分支所有的祖先，除了 HEAD ，引入的更改来生成新的提交。
Apply the changes introduced by some existing commits
应用一些现有提交引入的更改
Apply the changes introduced by the fifth and third last commits pointed to by master and create 2 new commits with these changes.
应用由 master 指向的第五和第三个提交引入的更改，并用这些更改创建两个新的提交。

Apply to the working tree and the index the changes introduced by the second last commit pointed to by master and by the last commit pointed to by next, but do not create any commit with these changes.
将由 master 指向的倒数第二个提交 和 next 指向的最后一个提交，引入的更改应用到工作树和索引，但是不要使用这些更改来创建任何提交。
Arbitrary expressions cannot be used here, an actual ref must be named.
任意表达式不能在这里使用，必须指定实际的 ref 。
As a convenience, <c5>--track</c5> without <c6>-b</c6> implies branch creation; see the description of <c7>--track</c7> below.
为方便起见，没有 <c6>-b</c6> 的 <c5>--track</c5> 意味着分支创建;请参阅下面的 <c7>--track</c7> 的说明。
As a further special case, you may use <c0>"A...B"</c0> as a shortcut for the merge base of <c1>A</c1> and <c2>B</c2> if there is exactly one merge base.
作为另一个特殊情况，您可以使用 <c0>"A...B"</c0> 作为 <c1>A</c1> 和 <c2>B</c2> 的合并基的快捷方式，如果只有一个合并基。
As a special case, the <c0>"@{-N}"</c0> syntax for the N-th last branch/commit checks out branches (instead of detaching).
作为特殊情况，<c0>"@{-N}"</c0> 语法检出第 N 个最后的分支/提交为分支(而不是分离)。
As a special case, you may use "A...B" as a shortcut for the merge base of A and B if there is exactly one merge base.
作为特殊情况，如果只有一个合并基础，则可以使用"A ... B"作为 A 和 B 的合并基础的快捷方式。

默认为 <c1>off</c1> 当给定特定文件(例如，使用 <c2>--file</c2> ， <c3>--global</c3> 等)时，当搜索所有配置文件时为 <c4>on</c4> 。
Defaults to HEAD.
默认为 HEAD。
Defaults to on, but can be used to override configuration variable commit.status.
默认为 on，但可用于覆盖配置变量 commit.status。
Defaults to the configured upstream for the current branch.

Displays paths that have differences between the index file and the current HEAD commit, paths that have differences between the working tree and the index file, and paths in the working tree that are not tracked by Git (and are not ignored by <a0>gitignore[5]</a0>).
显示索引和当前 HEAD 提交之间有差异的文件，在工作树和索引之间有差异的文件，以及工作树中未被 Git 跟踪的路径（并且不被 <a0>gitignore[5]</a0> 忽略）。
Displays references available in a local repository along with the associated commit IDs.
显示本地仓库中可用的引用以及关联的提交 ID。
Do <s0>not</s0> do this if you have already given these commits to somebody else.
如果您已经向其他人提交了这些提交，请 <s0>不要</s0> 执行。
Do <s1>not</s1> use this option unless you have read <a2>git-rebase[1]</a2> carefully.
除非您仔细阅读 <a2>git-rebase[1]</a2> ，否则请 <s1>不要</s1> 使用此选项。
Do everything except actually send the updates.
做所有事情，除了实际发送更新。
Do not always take them literally; you should value good reasons for your actions higher than manpages such as this one.
不要总是把它们从字面上看;你应该重视你的行为比这个手册页面更好的理由。
Do not change the message at all.
完全不要更改消息。
Do not create a commit, but show a list of paths that are to be committed, paths with local changes that will be left uncommitted and paths that are untracked.
不要创建提交，而是显示要提交的路径的列表，具有未被提交的本地更改的路径和未被跟踪的路径。
Do not include the output of <a0>git-status[1]</a0> in the commit message template when using an editor to prepare the default commit message.
当使用编辑器准备默认提交消息时，不要在提交消息模板中包含 <a0>git-status[1]</a0> 的输出。
Do not interpret any more arguments as options.
不要将任何更多的参数解释为选项。
Do not pipe Git output into a pager.
不要将 Git 输出管道传输到 pager。
Do not use replacement refs to replace Git objects.
不要使用替换参考来替换 Git 对象。
Do nothing; only show what would happen
什么也不做;只显示会发生什么

Does not affect the reporting of progress status to the standard error stream.
不影响标准错误流的进度状态报告。

根本没有触及索引文件或工作树(但是将头重置为<commit>，就像所有模式一样)。

实际上不会移除任何文件。

实际上没有移除任何东西，只是显示将要做什么。
Don’t add the file(s), but only refresh their stat() information in the index.
不要添加文件，而只能在索引中刷新其 stat() 信息。
Don’t use the standard ignore rules read from .gitignore (per directory) and $GIT_DIR/info/exclude, but do still use the ignore rules given with <c0>-e</c0> options.
不要使用从 .gitignore(每个目录)和 $GIT_DIR/info/exclude 读取的标准忽略规则，但仍然使用由 <c0>-e</c0> 选项给出的忽略规则。

Enables a curl full trace dump of all incoming and outgoing data, including descriptive information, of the git transport protocol.
启用 git 传输协议的所有传入和传出数据（包括描述性信息）的卷曲完整跟踪转储。
Enables general trace messages, e.g. alias expansion, built-in command execution and external command execution.
启用常规跟踪消息，例如 别名扩展，内置命令执行和外部命令执行。
Enables performance related trace messages, e.g. total execution time of each Git command.
启用与性能相关的跟踪消息，例如 每个Git命令的总执行时间。
Enables trace messages for all accesses to any packs.
启用对任何包的所有访问的跟踪消息。
Enables trace messages for all packets coming in or out of a given program.
启用给定程序进出的所有数据包的跟踪消息。
Enables trace messages printing the .git, working tree and current working directory after Git has completed its setup phase.
在 Git 完成设置阶段后，启用跟踪消息打印.git，工作树和当前工作目录。
Enables trace messages that can help debugging fetching / cloning of shallow repositories.
启用可帮助调试获取/克隆浅库的跟踪消息。
Enables tracing of packfiles sent or received by a given program.
启用跟踪给定程序发送或接收的包文件。

For example, "/*.c" matches "cat-file.c" but not "mozilla-sha1/sha1.c".
例如，"/*.c" 匹配 "cat-file.c" 但不匹配 "mozilla-sha1/sha1.c"。
For example, "<c0>a/**/b</c0>" matches "<c1>a/b</c1>", "<c2>a/x/b</c2>", "<c3>a/x/y/b</c3>" and so on.
For example, "<c1>**/foo</c1>" matches file or directory "<c2>foo</c2>" anywhere, the same as pattern "<c3>foo</c3>".
例如，"<c1>**/foo</c1>" 与任何地方的文件或目录 "<c2>foo</c2>" 匹配，与模式“ <c3>foo</c3> ”相同。
For example, "<c1>abc/**</c1>" matches all files inside directory "<c2>abc</c2>", relative to the location of the <c3>.gitignore</c3> file, with infinite depth.
例如，"<c1>abc/**</c1>" 匹配目录 "<c2>abc</c2>" 内的所有文件，相对于 <c3>.gitignore</c3> 文件的位置，无限深度。
For example, "<c1>abc/**</c1>" matches all files inside directory "abc", relative to the location of the <c2>.gitignore</c2> file, with infinite depth.
例如，"<c1>abc/**</c1>" 匹配目录 "abc" 内的所有文件，相对于 <c2>.gitignore</c2> 文件的位置，具有无限深度。
For example, "Documentation/*.html" matches "Documentation/git.html" but not "Documentation/ppc/ppc.html" or "tools/perf/Documentation/perf.html".
例如， "Documentation/*.html" 匹配 "Documentation/git.html" ，但不匹配 "Documentation/ppc/ppc.html" 或 "tools/perf/Documentation/perf.html".
For example, <a0>git-format-patch[1]</a0> turns a commit into email, and it uses the title on the Subject line and the rest of the commit in the body.
例如， <a0>git-format-patch[1]</a0> 将提交转换为电子邮件，它使用主题行上的标题和身体中的其他提交。
For example, <c0>HEAD@{2}</c0> means "where HEAD used to be two moves ago", <c1>master@{one.week.ago}</c1> means "where master used to point to one week ago in this local repository", and so on.
例如，<c0>HEAD@{2}</c0> 表示 "HEAD 两个移动以前"， <c1>master@{one.week.ago}</c1> 表示 "master 一个星期前在这个本地的仓库的指向"，等等。
For example, <c0>git commit --amend --no-edit</c0> amends a commit without changing its commit message.
例如， <c0>git commit --amend --no-edit</c0> 修改提交而不更改其提交消息。
For example, Documentation/*.jpg will match all .jpg files in the Documentation subtree, including Documentation/chapter_1/figure_1.jpg.
例如，Documentation/*.jpg 将匹配文档子树中的所有 .jpg 文件，包括 Documentation/chapter_1/figure_1.jpg 。

For example, running <c1>GIT_LITERAL_PATHSPECS=1 git log -- '*.c'</c1> will search for commits that touch the path <c2>*.c</c2>, not any paths that the glob <c3>*.c</c3> matches.
例如，运行 <c1>GIT_LITERAL_PATHSPECS=1 git log -- '*.c'</c1> 将搜索匹配路径 <c2>*.c</c2> 的提交，而不是 glob <c3>*.c</c3> 匹配的路径。

对于普通的 blobs，它显示了普通的内容。

For reading options: read only from system-wide <c0>$(prefix)/etc/gitconfig</c0> rather than from all available files.

For reading options: read only from the repository <c0>.git/config</c0> rather than from all available files.

For tags, it shows the tag message and the referenced objects.
对于标签，它显示标签消息和引用对象。
For this reason, some git commands for naming objects (like <c0>git describe</c0>) will ignore lightweight tags by default.
为此，一些用于命名对象的 git 命令(如 <c0>git describe</c0> )将默认忽略轻量级标签。
For trees, it shows the names (equivalent to <e0>git ls-tree</e0> with --name-only).
对于树，它显示名称(相当于 <e0>git ls-tree</e0> 带有 --name-only )。

For writing options: write to global <c0>~/.gitconfig</c0> file rather than the repository <c1>.git/config</c1>, write to <c2>$XDG_CONFIG_HOME/git/config</c2> file if this file exists and the <c3>~/.gitconfig</c3> file doesn’t.

For writing options: write to system-wide <c0>$(prefix)/etc/gitconfig</c0> rather than the repository <c1>.git/config</c1>.

For writing options: write to the repository <c0>.git/config</c0> file.

Git doesn’t list excluded directories for performance reasons, so any patterns on contained files have no effect, no matter where they are defined.
出于性能原因，Git 不会列出已排除的目录，因此任何包含文件的模式都不起作用，无论它们在何处被定义。
Git internal format
Git 内部格式
Git is a fast distributed revision control system.
Git 是一个快速分布式版本控制系统。
Git is a fast, scalable, distributed revision control system with an unusually rich command set that provides both high-level operations and full access to internals.
Git 是一个快速，可扩展的分布式版本控制系统，具有非常丰富的命令集，可提供高级操作和完全访问内部部件。
Git is a member of <a0>Software Freedom Conservancy</a0>
Git 是 <a0>Software Freedom Conservancy</a0> 的成员
Git is to some extent character encoding agnostic.
Git 在某种程度上字符编码是不可知的。
Git sets this variable automatically when performing destructive operations like <a1>git-prune[1]</a1>.
执行诸如 <a1>git-prune[1]</a1> 的破坏性操作时，Git 会自动设置此变量。
Git supports ssh, git, http, and https protocols (in addition, ftp, and ftps can be used for fetching, but this is inefficient and deprecated; do not use it).
Git 支持 ssh，git，http 和 https 协议(此外，ftp 和 ftps 可以用于抓取，但这是低效和不推荐的;不要使用它)。
Git tracks content not files
Git 跟踪内容而不是文件
Git treats the pattern as a shell glob suitable for consumption by fnmatch(3) with the FNM_PATHNAME flag: wildcards in the pattern will not match a / in the pathname.
Git 将模式视为适合 fnmatch(3) 使用 FNM_PATHNAME 标志的 shell glob：模式中的通配符与路径名中的/不匹配。
Git users can broadly be grouped into four categories for the purposes of describing here a small set of useful command for everyday Git.
Git 用户可以广泛地分为四类，以便在此描述每天 Git 的一小组有用的命令。
Git uses a simple text format to store customizations that are per repository and are per user.
Git 使用简单的文本格式来存储每个仓库和每个用户的自定义配置。
Git was started by Linus Torvalds, and is currently maintained by Junio C Hamano.
Git 由 Linus Torvalds 启动，目前由 Junio C Hamano 维护。

Identifier Terminology

If $XDG_CONFIG_HOME is either not set or empty, $HOME/.config/git/ignore is used instead.
如果 $XDG_CONFIG_HOME/git/ignore 未设置或为空，则使用 $HOME/.config/git/ignore 。
If $XDG_CONFIG_HOME is not set or empty, <c0>$HOME/.config/git/config</c0> will be used.
如果$ XDG_CONFIG_HOME 未设置或为空，则将使用 <c0>$HOME/.config/git/config</c0> 。
If <branch> is not found but there does exist a tracking branch in exactly one remote (call it <remote>) with a matching name, treat as equivalent to
如果没有找到<branch>，但确切存在一个跟踪分支在一个远程(称之为<remote>)与一个匹配的名称，被视为等同于
If <branch> is specified, <e0>git rebase</e0> will perform an automatic <c1>git checkout <branch></c1> before doing anything else.
如果指定了<branch>，则在执行其他任何操作之前， <e0>git rebase</e0> 将自动执行 <c1>git checkout <branch></c1> 。
If <branch> was provided when the rebase operation was started, then HEAD will be reset to <branch>.
如果在 rebase 操作启动时提供了<branch>，则 HEAD 将被重置为<branch>。
If <c0>--list</c0> is given, or if there are no non-option arguments, existing branches are listed; the current branch will be highlighted with an asterisk.
如果给出了 <c0>--list</c0> ，或者如果没有非选项参数，则列出现有的分支;当前分支将以星号突出显示。
If <c0>-B</c0> is given, <new_branch> is created if it doesn’t exist; otherwise, it is reset.
如果给出了 <c0>-B</c0> ，若不存在 <new_branch> 将被创建;否则，它被重置。
If <c0>-N</c0> is specified, removed paths are marked as intent-to-add (see <a1>git-add[1]</a1>).
如果指定了 <c0>-N</c0> ，则删除的路径被标记为意图添加(参见 <a1>git-add[1]</a1> )。
If <c0>-m <msg></c0> or <c1>-F <file></c1> is given and <c2>-a</c2>, <c3>-s</c3>, and <c4>-u <keyid></c4> are absent, <c5>-a</c5> is implied.
如果给出了 <c0>-m <msg></c0> 或 <c1>-F <file></c1> ，并且 <c2>-a</c2> ， <c3>-s</c3> 和 <c4>-u <keyid></c4> 不存在， <c5>-a</c5> 是隐含的。
If <c0>GIT_DIR</c0> environment is not set, it is set to the current working directory.
如果 <c0>GIT_DIR</c0> 环境未设置，则将其设置为当前工作目录。

If <c0>git commit</c0> exits due to an error before creating a commit, any commit message that has been provided by the user (e.g., in an editor session) will be available in this file, but will be overwritten by the next invocation of <c1>git commit</c1>.
如果 <c0>git commit</c0> 在创建提交之前由于错误而退出，则由用户提供的任何提交消息(例如，在编辑器会话中)将在此文件中可用，但下一次调用 <c1>git commit</c1> 将被覆盖。
If <c1>-v</c1> is specified twice, then also show the changes in the working tree that have not yet been staged (i.e., like the output of <c2>git diff</c2>).
如果指定了 <c1>-v</c1> 两次，那么还会显示工作树中尚未暂存的更改(即，像 <c2>git diff</c2> 的输出)。
If <c3><count></c3> is given, stop after showing that many refs.
如果给出了 <c3><count></c3> ，则在显示许多引用后停止。
If <c3>stdout-is-tty</c3> is missing, then checks the standard output of the command itself, and exits with status 0 if color is to be used, or exits with status 1 otherwise.
如果缺少 <c3>stdout-is-tty</c3> ，则检查命令本身的标准输出，如果要使用颜色则退出状态0，否则退出状态1。
If <c4>master</c4> did not exist remotely, it would be created.
如果 <c4>master</c4> 在远程不存在，那么它将被创建。
If <commit> on one side is omitted, it will have the same effect as using HEAD instead.
如果忽略一方面的 <commit>，则与使用 HEAD 的效果相同。
If <mode> is omitted, defaults to "--mixed".
如果省略<mode>，则默认为"--mixed"。
If <newbranch> exists, -M must be used to force the rename to happen.
如果 <newbranch> 存在，则必须使用 -M 强制重命名。
If <oldbranch> had a corresponding reflog, it is renamed to match <newbranch>, and a reflog entry is created to remember the branch renaming.
如果<oldbranch>具有相应的 reflog，则将其重命名为匹配<newbranch>，并创建一个 reflog 条目来记住分支重命名。
If <prefix> is specified it is prepended to the filenames in the archive.
如果指定了<prefix>，那么它将作为存档文件中的文件名。

If <upstream> is not specified, the upstream configured in branch.<name>.remote and branch.<name>.merge options will be used (see <a0>git-config[1]</a0> for details) and the <c1>--fork-point</c1> option is assumed.
如果未指定 <upstream>，则配置在 branch.<name>.remote 和 branch.<name>.merge 选项(详见 <a0>git-config[1]</a0> ) 中的 upstream 将被使用，并假定 <c1>--fork-point</c1> 选项。
If GIT_DIR environment is not set, it is set to the current working directory.
如果 GIT_DIR 环境未设置，则将其设置为当前工作目录。
If HEAD does not exist (e.g. unborn branches) and <commit> is not given, it shows all staged changes.
如果 HEAD 不存在(例如未出生的分支)，并且未提供<commit>，则显示所有暂存更改。
If a <c3><pattern></c3> is given, it is used as a shell wildcard to restrict the output to matching branches.
如果给出了一个 <c3><pattern></c3> ，它将被用作一个 shell 通配符，将输出限制为匹配的分支。
If a Git command is named this option will bring up the manual page for that command.
如果指定一个 Git 命令，此选项将显示该命令的手册页。
If a command, or a guide, is given, a manual page for that command or guide is brought up.
如果给出了命令或指南，则会给出该命令或指南的手册页。
If a file that is different between <commit> and HEAD has local changes, reset is aborted.
如果在<commit>和 HEAD 之间不同的文件有本地更改，则重置将中止。
If a file that is different between <commit> and the index has unstaged changes, reset is aborted.
如果<commit>与索引之间的文件有不同的更改，则重置将中止。

If all you really want to do is to remove from the index the files that are no longer present in the working tree (perhaps because your working tree is dirty so that you cannot use <c0>git commit -a</c0>), use the following command:
如果您真正想要做的是将不再存在于工作树中的文件从索引中移除(可能是因为您的工作树脏了，因此您不能使用 <c0>git commit -a</c0> )，使用以下命令：
If an untracked directory is managed by a different Git repository, it is not removed by default.
如果未跟踪的目录由不同的 Git 存储库管理，则默认情况下不会删除它。
If any ignored files were explicitly specified on the command line, <c1>git add</c1> will fail with a list of ignored files.
如果在命令行上明确指定了任何被忽略的文件，那么 <c1>git add</c1> 将会失败并列出被忽略的文件。
If any optional <c0><path>...</c0> arguments are given, only those paths are affected.
如果给出任何可选的 <c0><path>...</c0> 参数，则只会影响这些路径。

If either <c1>--textconv</c1> or <c2>--filters</c2> was specified, the input is expected to list the object names followed by the path name, separated by a single white space, so that the appropriate drivers can be determined.
如果指定 <c1>--textconv</c1> 或 <c2>--filters</c2> ，则输入需要列出对象名称，后跟路径名称，以单个空格分隔，以便可以确定适当的驱动程序。
If either of these environment variables is set then <e0>git fetch</e0> and <e1>git push</e1> will use the specified command instead of <e2>ssh</e2> when they need to connect to a remote system.
如果这些环境变量中的任何一个被设置，那么当需要连接到某个环境变量时， <e0>git fetch</e0> 和 <e1>git push</e1> 将使用指定的命令而不是 <e2>ssh</e2> 。

If fetching to a <e0>shallow</e0> repository created by <c1>git clone</c1> with <c2>--depth=<depth></c2> option (see <a3>git-clone[1]</a3>), deepen or shorten the history to the specified number of commits.
如果抓取一个通过 <c2>--depth=<depth></c2> 选项创建的 <e0>shallow</e0> 仓库(见 <a3>git-clone[1]</a3> )，将历史加深或缩短到指定数量的提交。
If history is linear and HEAD is an ancestor of next, update the working tree and advance the HEAD pointer to match next.
如果历史是线性的，HEAD 是 next 的祖先，则更新工作树，然后将 HEAD 指针前进以匹配到 next 。
If it is set to an empty string or to the value "cat", Git will not launch a pager.
如果设置为空字符串或值"cat"，Git 将不会启动 pager。
If multiple <c0>-m</c0> options are given, their values are concatenated as separate paragraphs.
如果给出了多个 <c0>-m</c0> 选项，则它们的值将连接为单独的段落。
If multiple patterns are given, a branch is shown if it matches any of the patterns.
如果给出多个模式，如果匹配任何模式，则显示分支。
If no <file> names are specified, <e0>git mergetool</e0> will run the merge tool program on every file with merge conflicts.
如果没有指定<file>名称，则 <e0>git mergetool</e0> 将在具有合并冲突的每个文件上运行合并工具程序。

If no <pathspec> is given when <c0>-A</c0> option is used, all files in the entire working tree are updated (old versions of Git used to limit the update to the current directory and its subdirectories).
如果在使用 <c0>-A</c0> 选项时未指定<pathspec>，则会更新整个工作树中的所有文件(旧版本的 Git 用于限制更新到当前目录及其子目录)。

If no <pathspec> is given when <c0>-u</c0> option is used, all tracked files in the entire working tree are updated (old versions of Git used to limit the update to the current directory and its subdirectories).
如果在使用 <c0>-u</c0> 选项时未指定<pathspec>，则会更新整个工作树中的所有跟踪文件(用于限制更新到当前目录及其子目录的 Git 旧版本)。
If no format is given, implies the <c2>--porcelain</c2> output format.
如果没有格式，则表示 <c2>--porcelain</c2> 输出格式。
If no further options are given, all reading options will read all of these files that are available.
如果没有进一步的选项，所有阅读选项将会读取所有可用的文件。
If no number is given to <c0>-n</c0>, only the first line is printed.
如果没有数字被赋予 <c0>-n</c0> ，则只打印第一行。
If no objects are given, <e0>git fsck</e0> defaults to using the index file, all SHA-1 references in <c1>refs</c1> namespace, and all reflogs (unless --no-reflogs is given) as heads.
如果没有给出任何对象，则 <e0>git fsck</e0> 默认使用索引文件， <c1>refs</c1> 命名空间中的所有 SHA-1 引用和所有 reflogs (除非--no-reflogs 被给出)作为头。
If no path is given, <e0>git</e0> will print the current setting and then exit.
如果没有给出路径， <e0>git</e0> 将打印当前设置，然后退出。
If no paths are given, <e0>git checkout</e0> will also update <c1>HEAD</c1> to set the specified branch as the current branch.
如果没有给出路径，则 <e0>git checkout</e0> 也会更新 <c1>HEAD</c1> ，将指定的分支设置为当前分支。

If no revisions are passed on the command line and either standard input is not a terminal or there is no current branch, <e0>git shortlog</e0> will output a summary of the log read from standard input, without reference to the current repository.
如果在命令行上没有传递任何修订版本，并且标准输入不是终端或没有当前分支，则 <e0>git shortlog</e0> 将输出从标准输入读取的日志的摘要，而不引用当前库。
If no type specifier is passed, no checks or transformations are performed on the value.
如果没有类型说明符传递，则不会对该值执行检查或转换。
If none of these config variables is set, the <e2>git web{litdd}browse</e2> helper script (called by <e3>git help</e3>) will pick a suitable default.
如果没有设置这些配置变量，则 <e2>git web{litdd}browse</e2> 帮助脚本(由 <e3>git help</e3> 调用)将选择合适的默认值。
If not set explicitly with <c0>--file</c0>, there are four files where <e1>git config</e1> will search for configuration options:
如果没有使用 <c0>--file</c0> 显式设置，<e1>git config</e1> 将在四个文件中搜索配置选项：
If not specified, the default of <c0>$GIT_DIR/index</c0> is used.
如果未指定，则使用默认值 <c0>$GIT_DIR/index</c0> 。
If not specified, the index will be used.
如果未指定，将使用索引。
If one of <c0>-a</c0>, <c1>-s</c1>, or <c2>-u <keyid></c2> is passed, the command creates a <e3>tag</e3> object, and requires a tag message.
如果传递 <c0>-a</c0> ， <c1>-s</c1> 或 <c2>-u <keyid></c2> 之一，则该命令将创建一个 <e3>tag</e3> 对象，并且需要一个标签消息。
If one or more <file> parameters are given, the merge tool program will be run to resolve differences on each file (skipping those without conflicts).
如果给出一个或多个<file>参数，则将运行合并工具程序来解决每个文件的差异(跳过那些没有冲突的文件)。
If set to "error", print the warnings and stop the rebase.
如果设置为"error"，请打印警告并停止 rebase。
If set to "ignore", no checking is done.
如果设置为"ignore"，则不进行任何检查。
If set to "warn", print warnings about removed commits in interactive mode.
如果设置为"warn"，则以交互模式打印关于删除的提交的警告。
If set to <c0>1</c0>, include broken or badly named refs when iterating over lists of refs.
如果设置为 <c0>1</c0> ，则在迭代引用列表时包括损坏的或命名错误的引用。

If set to a colon-separated list of protocols, behave as if <c0>protocol.allow</c0> is set to <c1>never</c1>, and each of the listed protocols has <c2>protocol.<name>.allow</c2> set to <c3>always</c3> (overriding any existing configuration).
如果设置为冒号分隔的协议列表，就像 <c0>protocol.allow</c0> 设置为<c1>never</c1>一样，每个列出的协议都有 <c2>protocol.<name>.allow</c2> 设置为 <c3>always</c3> (覆盖任何已存在的设置).
If set to true enable <c0>--autosquash</c0> option by default.
如果设置为 true，则默认启用 <c0>--autosquash</c0> 选项。
If set to true enable <c0>--autostash</c0> option by default.
如果设置为 true，则默认启用 <c0>--autostash</c0> 选项。
If set, it is a list of directories that Git should not chdir up into while looking for a repository directory (useful for excluding slow-loading network directories).
如果设置，它是 Git 在查找仓库目录时不应该进入的目录列表(用于排除缓慢加载的网络目录)。
If some files could not be added because of errors indexing them, do not abort the operation, but continue adding the others.
如果某些文件因为索引错误而无法添加，则不要中止操作，而是继续添加其他文件。
If specified twice, show in addition the unified diff between what would be committed and the worktree files, i.e. the unstaged changes to tracked files.
如果指定两次，则另外显示将提交的内容与工作树文件之间的统一差异，即对跟踪文件的未更改的更改。
If the --onto option is not specified, the starting point is <upstream>.
如果未指定--onto 选项，则起始点为<upstream>。
If the <c0>$GIT_DIR</c0> environment variable is set then it specifies a path to use instead of <c1>./.git</c1> for the base of the repository.
如果设置了 <c0>$GIT_DIR</c0> 环境变量，那么它将为存储库的基础指定使用的路径而不是 <c1>./.git</c1> 。
If the <c0>GIT_DIR</c0> environment variable is set then it specifies a path to use instead of the default <c1>.git</c1> for the base of the repository.
如果设置了 <c0>GIT_DIR</c0> 环境变量，那么它将为仓库的基础指定一个使用的路径而不是缺省的 <c1>.git</c1> 。
If the <commit> argument is missing it defaults to <c4>HEAD</c4> (i.e. the tip of the current branch).
如果缺少<commit>参数，则默认为 <c4>HEAD</c4> (即当前分支的尖端)。
If the Git configuration variable clean.requireForce is not set to false, <e0>git clean</e0> will refuse to delete files or directories unless given -f, -n or -i.
如果 Git 配置变量 clean.requireForce 未设置为 false，则除非 -f，-n 或 -i，否则 <e0>git clean</e0> 将拒绝删除文件或目录。
If the HEAD at the remote did not point at any branch when <c2>--single-branch</c2> clone was made, no remote-tracking branch is created.
如果远程的 HEAD 在 <c2>--single-branch</c2> 克隆时没有指向任何分支，则不会创建远程跟踪分支。
If the branch currently has a reflog then the reflog will also be deleted.
如果分支目前有一个 reflog，那么 reflog 也将被删除。
If the commit is a merge, and if the pretty-format is not <e0>oneline</e0>, <e1>email</e1> or <e2>raw</e2>, an additional line is inserted before the <e3>Author:</e3> line.
如果提交是合并的，并且如果美化格式不是 <e0>oneline</e0> ， <e1>email</e1> 或 <e2>raw</e2> ，则在<e3>Author:</e3>行之前会有额外的行。
If the configuration is missing, it defaults to <e2>origin</e2>.
如果配置丢失，则默认为 <e2>origin</e2> 。
If the global or the system-wide configuration file are not available they will be ignored.
如果全局或全系统配置文件不可用，它们将被忽略。
If the number of loose objects exceeds the value of the <c0>gc.auto</c0> configuration variable, then all loose objects are combined into a single pack using <c1>git repack -d -l</c1>.
如果松散对象的数量超过了 <c0>gc.auto</c0> 配置变量的值，则使用 <c1>git repack -d -l</c1> 将所有松散的对象组合成单个包。

If the number of packs exceeds the value of <c0>gc.autoPackLimit</c0>, then existing packs (except those marked with a <c1>.keep</c1> file) are consolidated into a single pack by using the <c2>-A</c2> option of <e3>git repack</e3>.
如果包数超过了 <c0>gc.autoPackLimit</c0> 的值，那么现有的包(除了标有 <c1>.keep</c1> 文件的包)被合并成一个包，使用 <e3>git repack</e3> 的 <c2>-A</c2> 选项。

If the object storage directory is specified via the <c0>$GIT_OBJECT_DIRECTORY</c0> environment variable then the sha1 directories are created underneath - otherwise the default <c1>$GIT_DIR/objects</c1> directory is used.
如果通过 <c0>$GIT_OBJECT_DIRECTORY</c0> 环境变量指定了对象存储目录，那么将在下面创建 sha1目录，否则将使用默认的 <c1>$GIT_DIR/objects</c1> 目录。
If the object storage directory is specified via this environment variable then the sha1 directories are created underneath - otherwise the default <c0>$GIT_DIR/objects</c0> directory is used.
如果通过此环境变量指定了对象存储目录，那么将在下面创建 sha1 目录，否则将使用默认的 <c0>$GIT_DIR/objects</c0> 目录。
If the option <c0>--all</c0> or <c1>-a</c1> is given then all available commands are printed.
如果给出选项 <c0>--all</c0> 或 <c1>-a</c1> ，则打印所有可用的命令。
If the option <c0>--all</c0> or <c1>-a</c1> is given, all available commands are printed on the standard output.
如果给出选项 <c0>--all</c0> 或 <c1>-a</c1> ，则所有可用的命令都将打印在标准输出上。
If the option <c0>--guide</c0> or <c1>-g</c1> is given, a list of the useful Git guides is also printed on the standard output.
如果给出了选项 <c0>--guide</c0> 或 <c1>-g</c1> ，那么在标准输出上也会列出有用的 Git 指南。

If the pattern does not contain a slash <e0>/</e0>, Git treats it as a shell glob pattern and checks for a match against the pathname relative to the location of the <c1>.gitignore</c1> file (relative to the toplevel of the work tree if not from a <c2>.gitignore</c2> file).
如果模式不包含斜杠 <e0>/</e0> ，Git 将其视为 shell glob 模式，并检查相对于 <c1>.gitignore</c1> 文件的位置的匹配(如果不是来自 <c2>.gitignore</c2> 文件，则相对于工作树的顶级)。
If the pattern ends with a slash, it is removed for the purpose of the following description, but it would only find a match with a directory.
如果模式以斜杠结尾，则为了以下描述的目的，它将被移除，但只能找到目录的匹配。
If the reference repository is on the local machine, automatically setup <c0>.git/objects/info/alternates</c0> to obtain objects from the reference repository.
如果参考仓库在本地机器上，自动设置 <c0>.git/objects/info/alternates</c0> 以从参考存储库获取对象。
If the repository configuration file is not available or readable, <e0>git config</e0> will exit with a non-zero error code.
如果仓库配置文件不可用或不可读，则 <e0>git config</e0> 将以非零错误代码退出。
If the repository is specified as a URL, then this flag is ignored (and we never use the local optimizations).
如果仓库被指定为 URL，则该标志将被忽略(我们从不使用本地优化)。
If the repository is specified as a local path (e.g., <c0>/path/to/repo</c0>), this is the default, and --local is essentially a no-op.
如果仓库被指定为本地路径(例如， <c0>/path/to/repo</c0> )，则这是默认值，而 --local 本质上是无操作的。
If the second number in a range is omitted, all remaining items are selected.
如果省略范围中的第二个数字，则选择所有剩余的项目。
If the second number in a range is omitted, all remaining patches are taken.
如果省略了范围中的第二个数字，则将采取所有剩余的补丁。
If the tag is not annotated, the commit message is displayed instead.
如果标记未注释，则会显示提交消息。
If the tag points to the commit, then only the tag is shown.
如果有标签指向提交，则只显示该标签。
If the upstream branch already contains a change you have made (e.g., because you mailed a patch which was applied upstream), then that commit will be skipped.
如果上游分支已经包含您所做的更改(例如，因为邮寄了上游应用的补丁)，那么该提交将被跳过。
If the user exits the editor without editing the message, the commit is aborted.
如果用户退出编辑器而不编辑消息，则提交将中止。

If the variable is set to an integer value greater than 2 and lower than 10 (strictly) then Git will interpret this value as an open file descriptor and will try to write the trace messages into this file descriptor.
如果变量设置为大于2且小于10(严格)的整数值，则 Git 将将此值解释为打开的文件描述符，并尝试将跟踪消息写入此文件描述符。
If there is a remote-tracking branch corresponding to the upstream branch and the upstream branch was rebased since last fetched, the rebase uses that information to avoid rebasing non-local changes.
如果存在与上游分支相对应的远程跟踪分支，并且上次分支自上次提取以来执行过变基，则变基使用该信息来避免变基非本地的更改。
If this environment variable is not set, Git will choose buffered or record-oriented flushing based on whether stdout appears to be redirected to a file or not.
如果未设置此环境变量，则 Git 将根据是否将 stdout 显示为重定向到文件来选择缓冲或基于记录的刷新。

If this environment variable is set to "1", then commands such as <e0>git blame</e0> (in incremental mode), <e1>git rev-list</e1>, <e2>git log</e2>, <e3>git check-attr</e3> and <e4>git check-ignore</e4> will force a flush of the output stream after each record have been flushed.
如果此环境变量设置为"1"，那么诸如 <e0>git blame</e0> (增量模式), <e1>git rev-list</e1>, <e2>git log</e2>, <e3>git check-attr</e3> and <e4>git check-ignore</e4> 将在每个记录被刷新后强制刷新输出流。
If this environment variable is set to <c0>0</c0>, git will not prompt on the terminal (e.g., when asking for HTTP authentication).
如果此环境变量设置为 <c0>0</c0> ，git 将不会在终端上提示(例如，在要求 HTTP 认证时)。
If this environment variable is set, it overrides Git’s autodetection whether <c0>GIT_SSH</c0>/<c1>GIT_SSH_COMMAND</c1>/<c2>core.sshCommand</c2> refer to OpenSSH, plink or tortoiseplink.
如果设置了此环境变量，它将覆盖 Git 的自动检测，无论<c0> GIT_SSH </c0> / <c1> GIT_SSH_COMMAND </c1> / <c2> core.sshCommand </c2>是指 OpenSSH，plink 或 tortoiseplink。

If this environment variable is set, then Git commands which need to acquire passwords or passphrases (e.g. for HTTP or IMAP authentication) will call this program with a suitable prompt as command-line argument and read the password from its STDOUT.
如果设置了此环境变量，则需要获取密码或密码(例如 HTTP 或 IMAP 认证)的 Git 命令将使用合适的提示将该程序称为命令行参数，并从其 STDOUT 读取密码。
If this option is omitted, the current HEAD will be used instead.
如果省略此选项，将使用当前 HEAD。
If this option is specified together with <c1>--amend</c1>, then no paths need to be specified, which can be used to amend the last commit without committing changes that have already been staged.
如果此选项与 <c1>--amend</c1> 一起指定，则不需要指定任何路径，可以用于修改上一次提交而不提交已经暂存的更改。
If this variable is set to "0", the output of these commands will be done using completely buffered I/O.
如果此变量设置为"0"，则这些命令的输出将使用完全缓冲的 I/O 完成。
If this variable is set to "1", "2" or "true" (comparison is case insensitive), trace messages will be printed to stderr.
如果此变量设置为“1”，“2”或“true”(比较不区分大小写)，跟踪消息将打印到 stderr 。
If this variable is set to a path, non-worktree files that are normally in $GIT_DIR will be taken from this path instead.
如果将此变量设置为路径，则通常在$GIT_DIR 中的非工作树文件将从该路径中取出。
If used together with <c2>--allow-empty</c2> paths are also not required, and an empty commit will be created.
如果与 <c2>--allow-empty</c2> 路径一起使用也不是必需的，并且将创建一个空提交。

如果我们有以下情况：
If you are creating a branch that you want to checkout immediately, it is easier to use the git checkout command with its <c0>-b</c0> option to create a branch and check it out with a single command.
如果要创建立即 checkout 的分支，则使用 <c0>-b</c0> 选项来使用 git checkout 命令，可以用单个命令更容易创建分支并检出它。
If you are currently not on any branch or if the current branch does not have a configured upstream, the rebase will abort.
如果您当前不在任何分支上，或者如果当前分支没有配置上游，则 rebase 将中止。

If you are instead primarily interested in using Git to fetch a project, for example, to test the latest version, you may prefer to start with the first two chapters of <a0>The Git User’s Manual</a0>.
如果您主要感兴趣的是使用 Git 获取项目，例如，要测试最新版本，您可能更喜欢从 <a0>The Git User’s Manual</a0> 的前两章开始。
If you do not supply this argument, the command reads from the standard input.
如果不提供此参数，则该命令从标准输入读取。
If you have a clone of git.git itself, the output of <a0>git-shortlog[1]</a0> and <a1>git-blame[1]</a1> can show you the authors for specific parts of the project.
如果您有 git.git 本身的克隆，则 <a0>git-shortlog[1]</a0> 和 <a1>git-blame[1]</a1> 的输出可以显示作者的特定部分。
If you have an unfortunate branch that is named <c0>hello.c</c0>, this step would be confused as an instruction to switch to that branch.
如果你有一个不幸的分支，名为 <c0>hello.c</c0> ，这个步骤将被混淆为一个指令切换到该分支。

If you intend that your next commit should record all modifications of tracked files in the working tree and record all removals of files that have been removed from the working tree with <c0>rm</c0> (as opposed to <c1>git rm</c1>), use <c2>git commit -a</c2>, as it will automatically notice and record all removals.
如果您希望下一个提交应记录工作树中的跟踪文件的所有修改的，并记录已从工作树中删除的文件的所有删除（ <c0>rm</c0> （而不是 <c1>git rm</c1> ），使用 <c2>git commit -a</c2> ，因为它会自动注意并记录所有删除。
If you know what you’re doing and all you want is to disable this behavior permanently without further considerations, just do:
如果你知道你在做什么，而你所要做的就是永久性地禁用这个行为，不需要进一步的考虑，只要做：
If you make a commit and then find a mistake immediately after that, you can recover from it with <e0>git reset</e0>.
如果您做出提交，然后立即发现错误，您可以使用 <e0>git reset</e0> 从中恢复。
If you specify no filters, the commits will be recommitted without any changes, which would normally have no effect.
如果您不指定任何过滤器，则将重新提交提交，而不进行任何更改，通常不会有任何影响。
If you supply directories, they will be treated as Maildirs.
如果您提供目录，它们将被视为 Maildirs。
If you tried a pull which resulted in complex conflicts and would want to start over, you can recover with <e0>git reset</e0>.
如果您尝试一个拉取导致复杂的冲突，并希望重新开始，您可以使用 <e0>git reset</e0> 进行恢复。
If you want Git to expand file glob characters, you may need to shell-escape them.
如果您希望 Git 扩展文件 glob 字符，则可能需要对其进行 shell-escape。
If you want to "completely forget" a file, it does not matter when it entered history, so we also add <c4>--ignore-unmatch</c4>:
如果你想 "完全忘记" 一个文件，它何时进入历史记录不重要，那么我们还添加了 <c4>--ignore-unmatch</c4> ：
If you want to abort the operation entirely (i.e., stage nothing new in the index), simply delete all lines of the patch.
如果要完全中止操作(即索引中没有新功能)，只需删除补丁的所有行。
If you want to check out <e0>all</e0> C source files out of the index, you can say
如果你想从索引中检出 <e0>全部</e0> C 源文件，你可以说
If you want to clone submodules shallowly, also pass <c3>--shallow-submodules</c3>.
如果要轻松克隆子模块，还可以通过 <c3>--shallow-submodules</c3> 。
If you want to extract specific files as they were in another commit, you should see <a3>git-checkout[1]</a3>, specifically the <c4>git checkout <commit> -- <filename></c4> syntax.
如果要提取特定文件，因为它们在另一个提交中，您应该查看 <a3>git-checkout[1]</a3> ，特别是 <c4>git checkout <commit> -- <filename></c4> 句法。
If you want to handle the lines that do <s2>not</s2> match the regex, just prepend a single exclamation mark in front (see also <a3>EXAMPLES</a3>).
如果要处理 <s2>不</s2> 匹配正则表达式的行，只需在前面添加一个感叹号(见 <a3>EXAMPLES</a3> )。
If you want to throw away all uncommitted changes in your working directory, you should see <a1>git-reset[1]</a1>, particularly the <c2>--hard</c2> option.
如果要丢弃工作目录中的所有未提交的更改，您应该查看 <a1>git-reset[1]</a1> ，特别是 <c2>--hard</c2> 选项。
If you want to undo a commit other than the latest on a branch, <a0>git-revert[1]</a0> is your friend.
如果你想撤销一个分支上最新的提交，那么你的朋友就是 <a0>git-revert[1]</a0> 。
If you want to update or unset an option which can occur on multiple lines, a POSIX regexp <c1>value_regex</c1> needs to be given.
如果要更新或取消设置可能出现多行的选项，则需要给出 POSIX 正则表达式 <c1>value_regex</c1> 。
If you work with other people, you will need commands listed in the <a0>Individual Developer (Participant)</a0> section as well.
如果您与其他人合作，您还需要在 <a0>个人开发人员（参与者）</a0> 部分中列出的命令。
Ignored files reached by directory recursion or filename globbing performed by Git (quote your globs before the shell) will be silently ignored.
由 Git(在 shell 之前引用 globs)执行的目录递归或文件名 globbing 所达到的忽略文件将被忽略。
Ignoring files
忽略文件
Imitate <e0>git clone</e0> but track only selected branches
模仿 <e0>git clone</e0> ，但只跟踪所选的分支
Implies <c0>--dry-run</c0>.
暗示 <c0>--dry-run</c0> 。
Implies <c1>--dry-run</c1>.
暗示 <c1>--dry-run</c1> 。
Implies <c1>--single-branch</c1> unless <c2>--no-single-branch</c2> is given to fetch the histories near the tips of all branches.
隐含 <c1>--single-branch</c1> ，除非 <c2>--no-single-branch</c2> 被提供以获取所有分支提示附近的历史记录。

将 Arch 仓库导入 Git
Import from and submit to Perforce repositories
从 Perforce 仓库导入及提交给 Perforce 仓库
Importing a new project
导入新项目

将修补程序导入项目
In Git’s context, synonym for <a0>object name</a0>.
在 Git 的上下文中， <a0>object name</a0> 的同义词。
In a non-bare repository, this is the branch that will be checked out.
在非裸库中，这是将被检出的分支。
In a normal, non-corrupted repository, this does nothing.
在正常的，未损坏的仓库中，这不做任何事情。
In addition to the names of files that have been changed, also show the textual changes that are staged to be committed (i.e., like the output of <c0>git diff --cached</c0>).
除了已更改的文件的名称之外，还会显示已暂存要提交的文本更改(例如，如 <c0>git diff --cached</c0> 的输出)。
In addition to those found in .gitignore (per directory) and $GIT_DIR/info/exclude, also consider these patterns to be in the set of the ignore rules in effect.
除了在 .gitignore(每个目录)和 $GIT_DIR/info/exclude 中找到的那些外，还将这些模式视为有效的忽略规则的集合。
In addition, some Git commands (such as <a0>git-show[1]</a0>) also take revision parameters which denote other objects than commits, e.g. blobs ("files") or trees ("directories of files").
另外，一些 Git 命令(例如 <a0>git-show[1]</a0> )也采用修订参数，这些参数表示除提交外的其他对象，例如。 blob("文件 ")或树(" 文件目录")。
In addition, the date part is accepted in the following formats: <c0>YYYY.MM.DD</c0>, <c1>MM/DD/YYYY</c1> and <c2>DD.MM.YYYY</c2>.
此外，日期部分以以下格式被接受： <c0>YYYY.MM.DD</c0> ， <c1>MM/DD/YYYY</c1> 和 <c2>DD.MM.YYYY</c2> 。
In addition, there are a number of optional keys:
另外还有一些可选的键：
In all cases, the new modification will appear reverted in the working tree.
在所有情况下，新修改将在工作树中显示为还原。
In case <old> and <new> are the same, and <old> is a file under <c0>$GIT_DIR/remotes</c0> or <c1>$GIT_DIR/branches</c1>, the remote is converted to the configuration file format.
如果<old>和<new>相同，<old>是 <c0>$GIT_DIR/remotes</c0> 或 <c1>$GIT_DIR/branches</c1> 下的文件，则将远程转换为配置文件格式。
In case of conflict, <e0>git rebase</e0> will stop at the first problematic commit and leave conflict markers in the tree.
如果发生冲突，<e0>git rebase</e0> 将在第一个有问题的提交时停止，并将冲突标记留在树中。
In combination with <c2>-d</c2> (or <c3>--delete</c3>), allow deleting the branch irrespective of its merged status.
与 <c2>-d</c2> (或 <c3>--delete</c3> )组合，允许删除分支，而不管其合并状态如何。
In combination with <c4>-m</c4> (or <c5>--move</c5>), allow renaming the branch even if the new branch name already exists.
与 <c4>-m</c4> (或 <c5>--move</c5> )组合使用时，即使新的分支名称已经存在，也允许重命名分支。

In fact, <c0>git bisect</c0> can be used to find the commit that changed <s1>any</s1> property of your project; e.g., the commit that fixed a bug, or the commit that caused a benchmark’s performance to improve.
实际上，可以使用 <c0>git bisect</c0> 找到改变项目的 <s1>任何</s1> 属性的提交;例如，修复错误的提交或导致基准测试的性能提高的提交。

实际上，命令拒绝运行给定的路径名​​(但请参阅 <c2>-i</c2> 选项)。
In general, URLs contain information about the transport protocol, the address of the remote server, and the path to the repository.
通常，URL 包含有关传输协议，远程服务器的地址以及仓库的路径的信息。
In general, the interrogate commands do not touch the files in the working tree.
一般来说，询问命令不会触及工作树中的文件。
In general, when the prompt ends with a single <e0>></e0>, you can pick only one of the choices given and type return, like this:
通常，当提示以单个 <e0>></e0> 结尾时，您只能选择一个给定的选项并键入 return，如下所示：
In interactive mode, you can mark commits with the action "edit".
在交互模式下，您可以使用操作"edit"标记提交。
In its default mode, <c0>git pull</c0> is shorthand for <c1>git fetch</c1> followed by <c2>git merge FETCH_HEAD</c2>.
在其默认模式下， <c0>git pull</c0> 是 <c1>git fetch</c1> 后跟 <c2>git merge FETCH_HEAD</c2> 的缩写，。
In its first form, the command provides the content or the type of an object in the repository.
在其第一个形式中，命令提供存储库中对象的内容或类型。
In more detail: Your <a1>working tree</a1> is normally derived from the state of the tree referred to by HEAD.
更详细地说：你的 <a1>working tree</a1> 通常来源于 HEAD 引用的树状态。
In other words, --merge does something like a <e0>git read-tree -u -m <commit></e0>, but carries forward unmerged index entries.

In other words, <c0>foo/</c0> will match a directory <c1>foo</c1> and paths underneath it, but will not match a regular file or a symbolic link <c2>foo</c2> (this is consistent with the way how pathspec works in general in Git).
换句话说， <c0>foo/</c0> 将匹配目录 <c1>foo</c1> 和其下方的路径，但不匹配常规文件或符号链接 <c2>foo</c2> (这与路径规则在 Git 中的工作方式一致)。
In other words, any protocol not mentioned will be disallowed (i.e., this is a whitelist, not a blacklist).
换句话说，任何未提及的协议将被禁止(即，这是白名单，而不是黑名单)。
In other words, it can tell you what the 3rd last revision in <e0>this</e0> repository was, and what was the current state in <e1>this</e1> repository, yesterday 9:14pm.

在这种情况下，您可以将更改储藏起来，执行拉取，然后取消储藏，如下所示：
In the context of Git used as a synonym for <a0>object name</a0>.
在 Git 上下文中用作 <a0>object name</a0> 的同义词。
In the first and second form, copy entries from <tree-ish> to the index.
在第一和第二种形式中，将条目从<tree-ish>复制到索引。
In the first form, it renames <source>, which must exist and be either a file, symlink or directory, to <destination>.
在第一个形式中，它将重命名<source> 为<destination>，它必须存在，并且是文件，符号链接或目录。
In the last case, any format accepted by <a0>git-format-patch[1]</a0> can be passed to git send-email.
在最后一种情况下，任何由 <a0>git-format-patch[1]</a0> 接受的格式都可以传递给 git send-email。

In the long form, the leading colon <c0>:</c0> is followed by a open parenthesis <c1>(</c1>, a comma-separated list of zero or more "magic words", and a close parentheses <c2>)</c2>, and the remainder is the pattern to match against the path.
在长形式中，领先的冒号 <c0>:</c0> 之后是一个开括号 <c1>(</c1> ，以逗号分隔的零个或多个 "魔术词" 列表，并且一个闭括号<c2>）</c2>，其余的是与路径匹配的模式。
In the second form, a list of objects (separated by linefeeds) is provided on stdin, and the SHA-1, type, and size of each object is printed on stdout.
在第二种形式中，stdin 中提供了一个对象列表(以换行符分隔)，每个对象的 SHA-1，类型和大小都打印在 stdout 上。
In the second form, the last argument has to be an existing directory; the given sources will be moved into this directory.
在第二种形式中，最后一个参数必须是现有的目录;给定的源将被移动到这个目录中。

In the short form, the leading colon <c1>:</c1> is followed by zero or more "magic signature" letters (which optionally is terminated by another colon <c2>:</c2>), and the remainder is the pattern to match against the path.
在简短的形式中，领先的冒号 <c1>:</c1> 之后是零个或多个 "魔术签名" 字母(可选地由另一个冒号 <c2>:</c2> 终止)，其余的是模式匹配路径。
In the third form, set the current branch head (HEAD) to <commit>, optionally modifying index and working tree to match.
在第三种形式中，将当前分支头(HEAD)设置为<commit>，可选择修改索引和工作树进行匹配。
In this case you can use the <c2>--track</c2> or <c3>--no-track</c3> options, which will be passed to <e4>git branch</e4>.
在这种情况下，您可以使用将被传递给 <e4>git branch</e4> 的 <c2>--track</c2> 或 <c3>--no-track</c3> 选项。
In this case, the <c3>-b</c3> and <c4>--track</c4> options are meaningless and giving either of them results in an error.
在这种情况下， <c3>-b</c3> 和 <c4>--track</c4> 选项是无意义的，并且给出其中任何一个会导致错误。
Include the output of <a0>git-status[1]</a0> in the commit message template when using an editor to prepare the commit message.
使用编辑器准备提交消息时，在提交消息模板中包含 <a0>git-status[1]</a0> 的输出。
Including the equals but with an empty value (like <c4>git -c foo.bar= ...</c4>) sets <c5>foo.bar</c5> to the empty string which ` git config --bool` will convert to <c6>false</c6>.
包含等于但含有空值(如 <c4>git -c foo.bar= ...</c4> )将 <c5>foo.bar</c5> 设置为空字符串，` git config --bool` 将转换为 <c6>false</c6>。
Incorporates changes from a remote repository into the current branch.
将远程仓库中的更改合并到当前分支中。
Incorporates changes from the named commits (since the time their histories diverged from the current branch) into the current branch.
将来自指定提交的变化合并(自从他们的历史从当前分支分离)到当前分支。
Indeed, you can undo the commit, or you can add other commits.
实际上，您可以撤消提交，也可以添加其他提交。
Indicates a blob object name.

Indicates a commit object name.
表示提交对象名称。

Indicates a filename - almost always relative to the root of the tree structure <c0>GIT_INDEX_FILE</c0> describes.

Indicates a tree object name.
表示树对象名称。
Indicates a tree, commit or tag object name.
表示树，提交或标签对象名称。
Indicates that an object type is required.

表示任何类型对象的对象名称。

在 gitweb 中即时浏览您的工作仓库
Instead of comparing with the tip of "test" branch, compare with the tip of the current branch, but limit the comparison to the file "test".
与“test”分支的顶部进行比较，而不是与当前分支的顶部进行比较，但限制为文件“test”的比较。
Instead of pointing the newly created HEAD to the branch pointed to by the cloned repository’s HEAD, point to <c0><name></c0> branch instead.
不是将新创建的 HEAD 指向克隆的存储库 HEAD 指向的分支，而是指向 <c0><name></c0> 分支。

Instead of staging files after each individual change, you can tell <c0>git commit</c0> to notice the changes to the files whose contents are tracked in your working tree and do corresponding <c1>git add</c1> and <c2>git rm</c2> for you.
而不是在每次更改之后暂存文件，您可以告诉 <c0>git commit</c0> 告之在工作树中跟踪其内容的文件的更改，并且执行相应的 <c1>git add</c1> 和< c2> git rm </c2>。
Instead of the content, show the object size identified by <object>.
不显示内容，显示由 <object> 标识的对象大小。
Instead of the content, show the object type identified by <object>.
不显示内容，显示由 <object> 标识的对象类型。
Instead of using the remote name <c0>origin</c0> to keep track of the upstream repository, use <c1><name></c1>.
不要使用远程名称 <c0>origin</c0> 跟踪上游仓库，使用 <c1><name></c1> 。
Instead of using the tip of the current branch, compare with the tip of "test" branch.
不是使用当前分支的顶部，而使用"test"分支的顶部进行比较。
Instead, just show if they exist in the index and would otherwise be removed by the command.
相反，只是显示它们是否存在于索引中，否则将被命令删除。

在<tree-ish>(或索引，如果未指定)和工作树之间的差异中交互选择 hunks。

Invoking <c0>git add -e</c0> or selecting <c1>e</c1> from the interactive hunk selector will open a patch in your editor; after the editor exits, the result is applied to the index.
调用 <c0>git add -e</c0> 或从交互式 hunk 选择器中选择 <c1>e</c1> 将在编辑器中打开一个补丁;编辑器退出后，结果将应用于索引。
It allows you to create a commit with an empty commit message without using plumbing commands like <a0>git-commit-tree[1]</a0>.
它允许您使用空提交消息创建提交，而不使用管道命令，如 <a0>git-commit-tree[1]</a0> 。
It also presents the merge commit in a special format as produced by <e0>git diff-tree --cc</e0>.
它还以由 <e0>git diff-tree --cc</e0> 生成的特殊格式呈现合并提交。
It arranges <c0>git pull</c0> to fetch and store the branches of mothership machine to local <c1>remotes/origin/*</c1> remote-tracking branches.
安排 <c0>git pull</c0> 将母机分支抓取并存储到本地的 <c1>remotes/origin/*</c1> 远程跟踪分支。
It can be an absolute path or a path relative to the current working directory.
它可以是绝对路径或当前工作目录的相对路径。
It can be an absolute path or relative path to current working directory.
它可以是绝对路径或当前工作目录的相对路径。
It continues narrowing down the range until it finds the exact commit that introduced the change.
它继续缩小范围，直到找到引入更改的确切提交。
It exits with zero status if the reflog exists, and non-zero status if it does not.
如果 reflog 存在，它将退出零状态，如果不存在则为非零状态。
It is <c0><unix timestamp> <time zone offset></c0>, where <c1><unix timestamp></c1> is the number of seconds since the UNIX epoch.
它是 <c0><unix timestamp> <time zone offset></c0> ，其中 <c1><unix timestamp></c1> 是自 UNIX 历元以来的秒数。
It is a good idea not to create this file if you sometimes use older versions of Git, as support for this file was added fairly recently.
如果您有时使用旧版本的 Git，则不建议创建此文件，因为最近才添加对该文件的支持。
It is a good idea to introduce yourself to Git with your name and public email address before doing any operation.
在进行任何操作之前，将您的姓名和公共电子邮件地址介绍给 Git 是个好主意。
