Tag Object
标签对象

Tag objects (created with <c0>-a</c0>, <c1>-s</c1>, or <c2>-u</c2>) are called "annotated" tags; they contain a creation date, the tagger name and e-mail, a tagging message, and an optional GnuPG signature.
标签对象(使用 <c0>-a</c0> ， <c1>-s</c1> 或 <c2>-u</c2> 创建)被称为"annotated"标签;它们包含创建日期，标记名称和电子邮件，标记消息和可选的 GnuPG 签名。
Tags for the deepened commits are not fetched.
更深的提交的标签不会被抓取。
Take an existing commit object, and reuse the log message and the authorship information (including the timestamp) when creating the commit.
获取现有的提交对象，并在创建提交时重用日志消息和作者信息(包括时间戳)。
Take care with these alternatives as both will discard uncommitted changes in your working directory.
注意这些替代方案，因为两者都将丢弃您的工作目录中未提交的更改。
Take the commit message from the given file.
从给定的文件中获取提交消息。
Take the configuration from the given file instead of .git/config. Using the "--global" option forces this to ~/.gitconfig. Using the "--system" option forces this to $(prefix)/etc/gitconfig.
从给定的文件而不是 .git/config 中进行配置。使用“--global”选项强制这个为 ~/.gitconfig 。使用“--system”选项强制这个为 $(prefix)/etc/gitconfig。
Takes the patches given on the command line and emails them out.
取得命令行上给出补丁并发送给他们。
Tell the command to automatically stage files that have been modified and deleted, but new files you have not told Git about are not affected.
告诉命令自动对已经被修改和删除的文件进行暂存，但是你没有告诉 Git 的新文件不受影响。
Telling Git your name
告诉 git 你的名字
Temporarily setting aside work in progress
暂时搁置正在进行的工作
Terminology
术语
Testing partial commits
测试部分提交
That is, a pattern followed by an attributes list, separated by whitespaces.
也就是说，模式后跟一个属性列表，由空格分隔。
That is, instead of creating <c1><directory></c1> and placing the administrative files in <c2><directory>/.git</c2>, make the <c3><directory></c3> itself the <c4>$GIT_DIR</c4>.
也就是说，不要创建 <c1><directory></c1> 并将管理文件放在 <c2><directory>/.git</c2> 中，使 <c3><directory></c3> 本身 <c4>$GIT_DIR</c4>。
That is, this example does the same as the earlier example if there is no other change in your working tree:
也就是说，如果您的工作树中没有其他更改，则该示例与前面的示例相同：
That setting can be overridden by using the <c4>--track</c4> and <c5>--no-track</c5> options, and changed later using <c6>git branch --set-upstream-to</c6>.
可以通过使用 <c4>--track</c4> 和 <c5>--no-track</c5> 选项来覆盖该设置，稍后使用 <c6>git branch --set-upstream-to</c6>。
The "delete" subcommand deletes single entries from the reflog.
"delete" 子命令从 reflog 中删除单个条目。
The "exists" subcommand checks whether a ref has a reflog.
"exists" 子命令检查一个引用是否有 reflog。
The "expire" subcommand prunes older reflog entries.
"expire" 子命令修剪较旧的 reflog 条目。
The "humanish" part of the source repository is used if no directory is explicitly given (<c0>repo</c0> for <c1>/path/to/repo.git</c1> and <c2>foo</c2> for <c3>host.xz:foo/.git</c3>).
如果没有明确指定目录，则使用源库的"人性化"部分(<c0>repo</c0> for <c1>/path/to/repo.git</c1> and <c2>foo</c2> for <c3>host.xz:foo/.git</c3>。
The "index" holds a snapshot of the content of the working tree, and it is this snapshot that is taken as the contents of the next commit.
"index"保存工作树内容的快照，并将该快照作为下一个提交的内容。
The "magic signature" consists of ASCII symbols that are neither alphanumeric, glob, regex special characters nor colon.
"魔术签名" 由不是字母数字，glob，正则表达式特殊字符或冒号的 ASCII 符号组成。
The "remote" repository that is destination of a push operation.
作为推送操作的目标的"远程"仓库。
The "remote" repository that is the source of a fetch or pull operation.
作为抓取或拉取操作的源的"远程"仓库。
The "show" subcommand (which is also the default, in the absence of any subcommands) shows the log of the reference provided in the command-line (or <c0>HEAD</c0>, by default).
"show" 子命令(在没有任何子命令的情况下也是默认值)显示命令行中提供的引用的日志(或默认情况下为 <c0>HEAD</c0> )。

The .git directory contains, among other things, a compressed object database representing the complete history of the project, an "index" file which links that history to the current contents of the working tree, and named pointers into that history such as tags and branch heads.
.git 目录包含代表项目完整历史的压缩对象数据库，将该历史记录链接到工作树的当前内容的 "index" 文件，及指向该历史记录的命名指针，如标签和分支头。
The <a0>Git concepts chapter of the user-manual</a0> and <a1>gitcore-tutorial[7]</a1> both provide introductions to the underlying Git architecture.
<a0>Git 用户手册的概念章节</a0> 和 <a1>gitcore-tutorial[7]</a1> 都提供了基础Git架构的介绍。
The <a2>Git User’s Manual</a2> has a more in-depth introduction.
<a2> Git 用户手册</a2>有更深入的介绍。
The <c0>--dry-run</c0> option can be used to obtain a summary of what is included by any of the above for the next commit by giving the same set of parameters (options and paths).
可以使用 <c0>--dry-run</c0> 选项，并给出相同的参数集(选项和路径)，来获取通过上述任何方工包含的准备下一个提交的内容的摘要。
The <c0>--global</c0> and the <c1>--system</c1> options will limit the file used to the global or system-wide file respectively.
<c0>--global</c0> 和 <c1>--system</c1> 选项将分别限制用于全局或全系统文件的文件。

The <c0>.git/config</c0> file in each repository is used to store the configuration for that repository, and <c1>$HOME/.gitconfig</c1> is used to store a per-user configuration as fallback values for the <c2>.git/config</c2> file.
每个存储库中的 <c0>.git/config</c0> 文件用于存储该存储库的配置，并且 <c1>$HOME/.gitconfig</c1> 用于将每个用户配置存储为备用。
The <c0>.gitmodules</c0> file, located in the top-level directory of a Git working tree, is a text file with a syntax matching the requirements of <a1>git-config[1]</a1>.
位于 Git 工作树顶级目录中的 <c0>.gitmodules</c0> 文件是一个符合 <a1>git-config[1]</a1> 要求的语法的文本文件。
The <c0>CHERRY_PICK_HEAD</c0> ref is set to point at the commit that introduced the change that is difficult to apply.
<c0>CHERRY_PICK_HEAD</c0> 引用设置为指向引入了难以应用的更改的提交。
The <c0>GIT_AUTHOR_DATE</c0>, <c1>GIT_COMMITTER_DATE</c1> environment variables and the <c2>--date</c2> option support the following date formats:
<c0>GIT_AUTHOR_DATE</c0> ， <c1>GIT_COMMITTER_DATE</c1> 环境变量和 <c2>--date</c2> 选项支持以下日期格式：
The <c0>commit.template</c0> configuration variable is often used to give this option implicitly to the command.
通常使用 <c0>commit.template</c0> 配置变量将该选项隐式地提供给该命令。
The <c0>git add</c0> command will not add ignored files by default.
默认情况下， <c0>git add</c0> 命令不会添加忽略的文件。
The <c0>git status</c0> command can be used to obtain a summary of which files have changes that are staged for the next commit.
可以使用 <c0>git status</c0> 命令来获取有关哪些文件暂存用于下一次提交的摘要。
The <c0>keyid</c0> argument is optional and defaults to the committer identity; if specified, it must be stuck to the option without a space.
<c0>keyid</c0> 参数是可选的，默认为提交者标识;如果指定，则必须将其粘贴到没有空格的选项。
The <c0>pu</c0> branch will be updated even if it is does not fast-forward, because it is prefixed with a plus sign; <c1>tmp</c1> will not be.
即使没有快进， <c0>pu</c0> 分支也将被更新，因为它的前缀有一个加号; <c1>tmp</c1> 则不会。
The <c1>--namespace</c1> command-line option also sets this value.
<c1>--namespace</c1>命令行选项也会设置此值。
The <c2>--git-dir</c2> command-line option also sets this value.
<c2>--git-dir</c2> 命令行选项也会设置此值。
The <c2>GIT_CONFIG</c2> environment variable has a similar effect, but you can specify any filename you want.
环境变量 <c2>GIT_CONFIG</c2> 具有相似的效果，但您可以指定所需的任何文件名。
The <dst> tells which ref on the remote side is updated with this push.
<dst>告诉远程端的哪个引用使用这个推送进行更新。
The <e0>#</e0> and <e1>;</e1> characters begin comments to the end of line, blank lines are ignored.
<e0>#</e0> 和 <e1>;</e1> 字符开始注释到行尾，空行被忽略。
The <e0><mode></e0> can be <c1>strip</c1>, <c2>whitespace</c2>, <c3>verbatim</c3>, <c4>scissors</c4> or <c5>default</c5>.
<e0><mode></e0> 可以是 <c1>strip</c1>, <c2>whitespace</c2>, <c3>verbatim</c3>, <c4>scissors</c4> 或 <c5>default</c5>。
The <e0>format:<string></e0> format allows you to specify which information you want to show.
<e0>format:<string></e0> 格式允许您指定要显示的信息。
The <e0>man</e0> program is used by default for this purpose, but this can be overridden by other options or configuration variables.
默认情况下， <e0>man</e0> 程序用于此目的，但可以由其他选项或配置变量覆盖。
The <e0>raw</e0> format shows the entire commit exactly as stored in the commit object.
<e0>raw</e0> 格式显示完整存储在提交对象中的完整提交。
The <e1>info</e1> program will be used for that purpose.
<e1>info</e1> 程序将用于此目的。
The <e2>git add</e2> command can be used to add ignored files with the <c3>-f</c3> (force) option.
<e2>git add</e2> 命令可用于使用 <c3>-f</c3> (强制)选项添加忽略的文件。
The <file> list given to the command can be exact pathnames, file glob patterns, or leading directory names.
提供给命令的 <file> 列表可以是精确的路径名，文件 glob 模式或目录开头名称。
The <message> part is optional and gives the description along with the stashed state.
<message>部分是可选的，并给出描述以及隐藏的状态。
The <mode> must be one of the following:
<mode>必须是以下之一：
The <name> is expected in the same format as listed by <e0>git config</e0> (subkeys separated by dots).
预期 <name> 的格式与 <e0>git config</e0> (由点分隔的子项)列出的格式相同。
The <src> is often the name of the branch you would want to push, but it can be any arbitrary "SHA-1 expression", such as <c0>master~4</c0> or <c1>HEAD</c1> (see <a2>gitrevisions[7]</a2>).
<src>通常是要推送的分支的名称，但它可以是任意任意的"SHA-1表达式"，例如 <c0>master~4</c0> 或 <c1>HEAD</c1> (见 <a2>gitrevisions[7]</a2> )。
The <tree-ish> argument can be used to specify a specific tree-ish (i.e. commit, tag or tree) to update the index for the given paths before updating the working tree.
在更新工作树之前，可以使用<tree-ish>参数来指定特定的 tree-ish (即提交，标签或树)来更新给定路径的索引。
The <tree-ish>/<commit> defaults to HEAD in all forms.
所有形式的<tree-ish>/<commit>默认为 HEAD。
The Git Repository
Git 仓库
The Git configuration file contains a number of variables that affect the Git commands' behavior.
Git 配置文件包含一些影响 Git 命令行为的变量。
The Git repository browser
Git 仓库浏览器
The Object Database
对象数据库
The Workflow
工作流程

The above command copies all branches from the remote refs/heads/ namespace and stores them to the local refs/remotes/origin/ namespace, unless the branch.<name>.fetch option is used to specify a non-default refspec.
上述命令从远程 refs/heads/ 命名空间复制所有分支，并将它们存储到本地的 refs/remotes/origin/ 中，除非使用 branch.<name>.fetch 选项指定非默认的 refspec。

The action of updating all or part of the <a0>working tree</a0> with a <a1>tree object</a1> or <a2>blob</a2> from the <a3>object database</a3>, and updating the <a4>index</a4> and <a5>HEAD</a5> if the whole working tree has been pointed at a new <a6>branch</a6>.
通过 <a3>object database</a3> 中的 <a1>tree object</a1> 或 <a2>blob</a2> 更新全部或部分 <a0>working tree</a0> 的动作，并且如果整个工作树指向新的 <a6>branch</a6> ，则更新 <a4>index</a4> 和 <a5>HEAD</a5> 。
The addition will appear reverted in the working tree.
该添加将在工作树中显示为还原。
The attributes (last modified time, size, etc.) are taken from the corresponding file in the working tree.
属性(最后修改的时间，大小等)取自工作树中相应的文件。
The blob object represents the contents of the file as of the head of the current branch.
blob 对象表示当前分支头部的文件内容。
The branch must be fully merged in its upstream branch, or in <c0>HEAD</c0> if no upstream was set with <c1>--track</c1> or <c2>--set-upstream</c2>.
该分支必须在其上游分支中完全合并，或在 <c0>HEAD</c0> 没有上游设置为 <c1>--track</c1> 或 <c2>--set-upstream</c2> 。
The changes staged for <c1>hello.c</c1> and <c2>hello.h</c2> are not included in the resulting commit.
生成的提交中不包括 <c1>hello.c</c1> 和 <c2>hello.h</c2> 的更改。
The chosen hunks are applied in reverse to the index.
所选的块反向应用到索引。
The chosen hunks are then applied in reverse to the working tree (and if a <tree-ish> was specified, the index).
然后将所选择的 hunks 反向应用于工作树(并且如果指定了<tree-ish>，则为索引)。
The command <c0>git commit -a</c0> first looks at your working tree, notices that you have modified hello.c and removed goodbye.c, and performs necessary <c1>git add</c1> and <c2>git rm</c2> for you.
命令 <c0>git commit -a</c0> 首先查看你的工作树，注意你修改了 hello.c 并删除了 goodbye.c，并执行必要的 <c1>git add</c1> 和 <c2>git rm</c2>。
The command <c0>git fetch <name></c0> can then be used to create and update remote-tracking branches <name>/<branch>.
然后可以使用命令 <c0>git fetch <name></c0> 创建和更新远程跟踪分支 <name>/<branch>。
The command finds the most recent tag that is reachable from a commit.
该命令查找从提交可访问的最新标记。
The command loop shows the list of subcommands available, and gives a prompt "What now> ".
命令循环显示可用的子命令列表，并提示"What now>"。
The command removes only the paths that are known to Git.
该命令仅删除 Git 已知的路径。
The command saves your local modifications away and reverts the working directory to match the <c1>HEAD</c1> commit.
该命令保存您的本地修改，并恢复工作目录以匹配 <c1>HEAD</c1> 提交。
The command shall still exit with non-zero status.
命令仍然以非零状态退出。

The command takes options applicable to the <c0>git rev-list</c0> command to control what is shown and how, and options applicable to the <c1>git diff-*</c1> commands to control how the changes each commit introduces are shown.
该命令采用适用于 <c0>git rev-list</c0> 命令的选项来控制显示的内容以及如何以显示，使用适用于 <c1>git diff-*</c1> 命令的选项，以控制每个提交的介绍如何显示。
The command takes options applicable to the <e0>git diff-tree</e0> command to control how the changes the commit introduces are shown.
该命令采用适用于 <e0>git diff-tree</e0> 命令的选项来控制如何显示提交引入的更改。
The command takes options applicable to the <e0>git log</e0> command to control what is shown and how.
该命令采用适用于 <e0>git log</e0> 命令的选项来控制显示的内容和方法。
The command takes various subcommands, and different options depending on the subcommand:
该命令需要各种子命令，不同的选项取决于子命令：

The command will be given exactly two or four arguments: the <e3>username@host</e3> (or just <e4>host</e4>) from the URL and the shell command to execute on that remote system, optionally preceded by <c5>-p</c5> (literally) and the <e6>port</e6> from the URL when it specifies something other than the default SSH port.
该命令将被给出两个或四个参数： <e3>username@host</e3> （或只是<e4>host</e4>）从 URL 和 shell 命令在该远程系统上执行，可选地前缀为 <c5>-p</c5>（字面上）和<e6>port</e6>，当它指定不是默认 SSH 端口的URL时。
The command will only rewrite the <e0>positive</e0> refs mentioned in the command line (e.g. if you pass <e1>a..b</e1>, only <e2>b</e2> will be rewritten).
该命令只会重写命令行中提到的 <e0>positive</e0> 参数（例如，如果传递 <e1>a..b</e1> ，则只会重写 <e2>b</e2> 。
The command’s second form creates a new branch head named <branchname> which points to the current <c0>HEAD</c0>, or <start-point> if given.
命令的第二个形式创建一个名为 <branchname> 的新分支头，它指向当前的 <c0>HEAD</c0> 或<start-point>（如果给定）。
The commit message subject line is taken from the specified commit with a prefix of "squash!
提交消息主题行来自指定的提交，前缀为"squash!
The commit message will be the subject line from the specified commit with a prefix of "fixup!
提交消息将是来自指定提交的主题行，前缀为"fixup!
The commit, equivalent to what other systems call a "changeset" or "version", represents a step in the project’s history, and each parent represents an immediately preceding step.
提交等同于其他系统称为“变更集”或“版本”，表示项目历史中的一个步骤，每个父提交代表一个紧接在前的步骤。
The commits that were previously saved into the temporary area are then reapplied to the current branch, one by one, in order.
然后之前保存到临时区域的提交，将依次重新应用于当前分支。
The configuration variable <c0>add.ignoreErrors</c0> can be set to true to make this the default behaviour.
可以将配置变量 <c0>add.ignoreErrors</c0> 设置为 true，使其成为默认行为。
The configuration variable <c3>gpg.program</c3> is used to specify custom GnuPG binary.
配置变量 <c3>gpg.program</c3> 用于指定自定义 GnuPG 二进制。
The configuration variables are used by both the Git plumbing and the porcelains.
配置变量由 Git 低级命令和高级命令使用。
The construct <e0>@{-<n>}</e0> means the <n>th branch/commit checked out before the current one.
<e0>@{-<n>}</e0> 的结构意味着在当前第一个分支/提交之前检出第 n 个分支/提交。
The content to be added can be specified in several ways:
要添加的内容可以通过以下几种方式指定：
The contents from a specific side of the merge can be checked out of the index by using <c1>--ours</c1> or <c2>--theirs</c2>.
通过使用 <c1>--ours</c1> 或 <c2>--theirs</c2> ，可以从索引中检出合并特定方面的内容。
The contents of these files are also staged for the next commit on top of what have been staged before.
这些文件的内容也会暂存于之前已暂存文件的顶部，用于下一次提交。
The current <a0>branch</a0>.
当前的 <a0>branch</a0> 。
The current branch and <c0>HEAD</c0> pointer stay at the last commit successfully made.
当前分支和 <c0>HEAD</c0> 指针保持在最后一次成功的提交。
The current branch is reset to <upstream>, or <newbase> if the --onto option was supplied.
则当前分支将重置为 <upstream>，或者 <newbase> 如果提供了--onto 选项。
The default behavior of this command when no <refspec> is given can be configured by setting the <c0>push</c0> option of the remote, or the <c1>push.default</c1> configuration variable.
当没有给出 <refspec> 时，该命令的默认行为可以由远程的 <c0>push</c0> 选项或 <c1>push.default</c1> 配置变量配置。
The default can be changed by the <c0>commit.cleanup</c0> configuration variable (see <a1>git-config[1]</a1>).
默认值可以通过 <c0>commit.cleanup</c0> 配置变量来更改(参见 <a1>git-config[1]</a1> )。
The default can be changed using the status.showUntrackedFiles configuration variable documented in <a0>git-config[1]</a0>.
可以使用 <a0>git-config[1]</a0> 中记录的 status.showUntrackedFiles 配置变量来更改默认值。
The default is not to print any annotation lines.
默认情况下不打印任何注解行。
The easiest way to do so is:
最简单的方法是：

The editor used to edit the commit log message will be chosen from the <c0>GIT_EDITOR</c0> environment variable, the core.editor configuration variable, the <c1>VISUAL</c1> environment variable, or the <c2>EDITOR</c2> environment variable (in that order).
用于编辑提交日志消息的编辑器将从 <c0>GIT_EDITOR</c0> 环境变量，core.editor 配置变量， <c1>VISUAL</c1> 环境变量或 <c2>EDITOR</c2> 环境变量(按顺序)。
The entire history leading up to a commit can be vouched for by signing just that commit.
整个历史上一些重要的提交可以签名那个提交来表示。
The executable bit is only changed in the index, the files on disk are left unchanged.
可执行位只在索引中更改，磁盘上的文件保持不变。
The fast-import backend itself can import into an empty repository (one that has already been initialized by <e0>git init</e0>) or incrementally update an existing populated repository.
快速导入后端本身可以导入到一个空的存储库(已经由 <e0>git init</e0> 初始化了)或逐步更新现有的填充存储库。
The fetched objects will eventually be removed by git’s built-in housekeeping (see <a4>git-gc[1]</a4>).
获取的对象最终将被 git 的内置内务管理(请参阅 <a4>git-gc[1]</a4> )删除。

The file <c1>hello.c</c1> will also be checked out, even though it is no longer in the working tree, because the file globbing is used to match entries in the index (not in the working tree by the shell).
文件 <c1>hello.c</c1> 也将被检出，即使它不再在工作树中，因为文件 globbing 用于匹配索引中的条目（不在工作树中的 shell） ）。
The file <c3>/etc/gitconfig</c3> can be used to store a system-wide default configuration.
文件 <c3>/etc/gitconfig</c3> 可用于存储系统范围的默认配置。
The file contains one subsection per submodule, and the subsection value is the name of the submodule.
该文件每个子模块包含一个子部分，子部分值是子模块的名称。

The file parameters can point at the user’s working file (e.g. <c0>new-file</c0> in "git-diff-files"), <c1>/dev/null</c1> (e.g. <c2>old-file</c2> when a new file is added), or a temporary file (e.g. <c3>old-file</c3> in the index).
该文件参数可以指向用户的工作文件 (如 "git-diff-files" 中的<c0>new-file</c0>), <c1>/dev/null</c1> (如当新文件添另时的 <c2>old-file</c2> ), 或临时文件 (如 index 中的 <c3>old-file</c3> ).
The files are read in the order given above, with last value found taking precedence over values read earlier.
文件以上面给出的顺序读取，最后找到的值优先于先前阅读的值。
The files under <c0>.git/objects/</c0> directory are hardlinked to save space when possible.
<c0>.git/objects/</c0> 目录下的文件是硬链接的，以尽可能节省空间。
The first are what you <e1>would</e1> commit by running <c2>git commit</c2>; the second and third are what you <e3>could</e3> commit by running <e4>git add</e4> before running <c5>git commit</c5>.
第一个是您 <e1>将</e1> 通过运行 <c2>git commit</c2> 来提交，第二个和第三个你 <e3>可以</e3> 在运行 <c5>git commit</c5> 之前运行 <e4>git add</e4> 来提交。

The first command fetches the <c0>maint</c0> branch from the repository at <c1>git://git.kernel.org/pub/scm/git/git.git</c1> and the second command uses <c2>FETCH_HEAD</c2> to examine the branch with <a3>git-log[1]</a3>.
第一个命令从 <c1>git://git.kernel.org/pub/scm/git/git.git</c1> 从仓库中获取 <c0>maint</c0> 分支，第二个命令通过 <c2>FETCH_HEAD</c2> 用 <a3>git-log[1]</a3> 检查分支。
The following are all commit-ishes: a commit object, a <a2>tag object</a2> that points to a commit object, a tag object that points to a tag object that points to a commit object, etc.
以下是所有的 commit-ishes：提交对象，指向提交对象的 <a2>tag object</a2> ，指向一个，指向提交对象的标签对象的标签对象等。
The following are helper commands used by the above; end users typically do not use them directly.
以下是上述使用的辅助命令；终端用户通常不直接使用它们。

The following description divides the low-level commands into commands that manipulate objects (in the repository, index, and working tree), commands that interrogate and compare objects, and commands that move objects and references between repositories.
以下描述将低级别命令分为操纵对象命令(在仓库，索引和工作树中)，询问和比较对象的命令，以及在仓库之间移动对象和引用的命令。
The following is probably more detail than necessary for a first-time user.
以下可能比第一次使用者需要的细节更详细。
The following options affect the way the simplification is performed:
以下选项会影响简化的执行方式：
The following options select the commits to be shown:
以下选项选择要显示的提交：
The following sequence checks out the <c0>master</c0> branch, reverts the <c1>Makefile</c1> to two revisions back, deletes hello.c by mistake, and gets it back from the index.
以下顺序检出 <c0>master</c0> 分支，将 <c1>Makefile</c1> 还原两个版本，错误地删除 hello.c，并从索引中取回。
The following syntaxes may be used with them:
可以使用以下语法：
The format of a <refspec> parameter is an optional plus <c0>+</c0>, followed by the source object <src>, followed by a colon <c1>:</c1>, followed by the destination ref <dst>.
<refstec>参数的格式是可选加号 <c0>+</c0> ，后跟源对象 <src>，后跟冒号 <c1>:</c1> ，后跟目标引用 <dst>。
The fourth syntax ("<c0>git merge --continue</c0>") can only be run after the merge has resulted in conflicts.
第四个语法("<c0>git merge --continue</c0>")只能在冲突合并有结果后运行。
The full SHA-1 object name (40-byte hexadecimal string), or a leading substring that is unique within the repository.
完整的 SHA-1对象名称(40字节十六进制字符串)或仓库中唯一的前导子字符串。
The index
索引
The index and working tree are also left unchanged as a result.
因此，索引和工作树也保持不变。
The index file is initialized with a list of all paths and, for each path, a blob object and a set of attributes.
index 文件使用所有路径的列表进行初始化，对于每个路径，都使用 blob 对象和一组属性。
The index is also capable of storing multiple entries (called "stages") for a given pathname.
该 index 还能够存储给定路径名的多个条目(称为"stages")。
The index is updated after successful completion, but the change must still be committed.
索引在成功完成后更新，但仍必须提交更改。
The index may be updated with new content, and new commits may be created from the content stored in the index.
index 可以用新内容更新，并且新提交可以从存储在 index 中的内容创建。
The index may contain unmerged entries because of a previous failed merge.
索引可能包含未合并的条目，因为以前的合并失败。
The intent of this option is to pick and choose lines of the patch to apply, or even to modify the contents of lines to be staged.
此选项的目的是选择并选择要应用的补丁行，或者甚至修改要暂存的行的内容。

The interface (input, output, set of options and the semantics) to these low-level commands are meant to be a lot more stable than Porcelain level commands, because these commands are primarily for scripted use.
这些低级命令的接口(输入，输出，选项集和语义)意味着比高级命令更稳定，因为这些命令主要用于脚本使用。
The interface to Porcelain commands on the other hand are subject to change in order to improve the end user experience.
另一方面，高级指令的接口可能会发生更改，以改善最终用户体验。
The internals are documented in the <a0>Git API documentation</a0>.
内部文档记录在<a0> Git API 文档</a0>中。
The last three commits (HEAD, HEAD^, and HEAD~2) were bad and you do not want to ever see them again.
最后三个提交 (HEAD, HEAD^, 和 HEAD~2) 都不好，你不想再看到它们了。

The latest stash you created is stored in <c0>refs/stash</c0>; older stashes are found in the reflog of this reference and can be named using the usual reflog syntax (e.g. <c1>stash@{0}</c1> is the most recently created stash, <c2>stash@{1}</c2> is the one before it, <c3>stash@{2.hours.ago}</c3> is also possible).
您创建的最新的储藏存储在 <c0>refs/stash</c0> 中;在这个引用的 reflog 中可以找到较旧的储藏，并且可以使用通常的 reflog 语法来命名(例如 <c1>stash@{0}</c1> 是最近创建的储藏，<c2>stash@{1}</c2> 是之前的一个， <c3>stash@{2.hours.ago}</c3> 也是可能的)。
The list below describes some common things you may see in a patch, and which editing operations make sense on them.
下面的列表介绍了您可能在补丁中看到的一些常见问题，哪些编辑操作对它们有意义。
The list of mailbox files to read patches from.
从中读取补丁的邮箱文件列表。
The main command loop has 6 subcommands (plus help and quit).
主命令循环有6个子命令(加上帮助和退出)。
The main command loop has 6 subcommands.
主命令循环有6个子命令。

The meaning of a signoff depends on the project, but it typically certifies that committer has the rights to submit this work under the same license and agrees to a Developer Certificate of Origin (see <a0>http://developercertificate.org/</a0> for more information).
签收的含义取决于项目，但通常证明提交者有权以相同的许可证提交此作品，并同意开发者原产地证书(见 <a0>http://developercertificate.org/</a0> 更多信息)。
The merge mechanism (<c0>git merge</c0> and <c1>git pull</c1> commands) allows the backend <e2>merge strategies</e2> to be chosen with <c3>-s</c3> option.
合并机制( <c0>git merge</c0> 和 <c1>git pull</c1> 命令)允许使用 <c3>-s</c3> 选项后的 <e2>merge strategies</e2> 。
The message taken from file with <c0>-F</c0>, command line with <c1>-m</c1>, and from commit object with <c2>-C</c2> are usually used as the commit log message unmodified.
从 <c0>-F</c0> ，带有 <c1>-m</c1> 的命令行和带有 <c2>-C</c2> 的提交对象的文件中的消息通常用作提交日志消息未修改。

The mode parameter is optional (defaults to <e0>all</e0>), and is used to specify the handling of untracked files; when -u is not used, the default is <e1>normal</e1>, i.e. show untracked files and directories.
mode 参数是可选的(默认为 <e0>all</e0> )，用于指定未跟踪文件的处理;当不使用 -u 时，默认值为 <e1>normal</e1> ，即显示未跟踪的文件和目录。

The modifications stashed away by this command can be listed with <c0>git stash list</c0>, inspected with <c1>git stash show</c1>, and restored (potentially on top of a different commit) with <c2>git stash apply</c2>.
可以使用 <c0>git stash list</c0> 列出此命令储藏的修改，使用 <c1>git stash show</c1> 进行检查，并使用 <c2>git stash apply</c2> 还原（可能在不同的提交之上）。
The name is actually the section and the key separated by a dot, and the value will be escaped.
名称实际上是由点分隔的 section 和 key，值将被转义。
The name is set to the path where the submodule has been added unless it was customized with the <c0>--name</c0> option of <e1>git submodule add</e1>.
该名称设置为添加子模块的路径，除非使用 <e1>git submodule add</e1> 的 <c0>--name</c0> 选项进行自定义。
The name of a commit at which to start the new branch; see <a0>git-branch[1]</a0> for details.
启动新分支的提交的名称;详见 <a0>git-branch[1]</a0> 。
The name of a new directory to clone into.
要克隆到的新目录的名称。
The name of an existing branch to rename.
要重命名的现有分支的名称。
The name of one of the following can be used instead of a URL as <c0><repository></c0> argument:
可以使用以下名称之一替代 URL 作为 <c0><repository></c0> 参数：
The name of the branch to create or delete.
要创建或删除的分支的名称。
The name of the object to show.
要显示的对象的名称。
The name of the tag to create, delete, or describe.
要创建，删除或描述的标签的名称。
The names of objects to show.
要显示的对象的名称。
The names of refs that are fetched, together with the object names they point at, are written to <c0>.git/FETCH_HEAD</c0>.
被抓取的引用名称与它们所指向的对象名称一起写入 <c0>.git/FETCH_HEAD</c0> 。
The native transport (i.e. git:// URL) does no authentication and should be used with caution on unsecured networks.
本地传输(即 git:// URL)不进行身份验证，在不安全的网络上应谨慎使用。
The new branch head will point to this commit.
新的分支机头将指向该提交。
The new branch name must pass all checks defined by <a0>git-check-ref-format[1]</a0>.
新的分支名称必须通过由 <a0>git-check-ref-format[1]</a0> 定义的所有检查。
The new commit has the same parents and author as the current one (the <c5>--reset-author</c5> option can countermand this).
新提交与目前的提交有相同的父和作者( <c5>--reset-author</c5> 选项可以取消这个)。
The new name for an existing branch.
现有分支的新名称。
The new tag name must pass all checks defined by <a0>git-check-ref-format[1]</a0>.
新的标签名称必须通过由 <a0>git-check-ref-format[1]</a0> 定义的所有检查。
The next <e0>fetch</e0> or <e1>pull</e1> will create them again unless you configure them not to.
下一个 <e0>fetch</e0> 或 <e1>pull</e1> 将重新创建它们，除非您将它们配置为不。

The object database contains objects of three main types: blobs, which hold file data; trees, which point to blobs and other trees to build up directory hierarchies; and commits, which each reference a single tree and some number of parent commits.
对象数据库包含三种主要类型的对象：保存文件数据的 blob ; 指向 blob 和其他树来建立目录层次结构的树（tree）; 以及引用单个树和一些父提交的提交（commit）。
The object that the new tag will refer to, usually a commit.
新标签将引用的对象，通常是提交。
The ones listed near the end of this list name trees and blobs contained in a commit.
列于列表末尾附近的那些名称包含在提交中的树和 Blob。
The optional <c2>default</c2> parameter is used instead, if there is no color configured for <c3>name</c3>.
如果没有为 <c3>name</c3> ，则使用可选的 <c2>default</c2> 参数。
The optional colon that terminates the "magic signature" can be omitted if the pattern begins with a character that does not belong to "magic signature" symbol set and is not a colon.
如果模式以不属于 "魔术签名" 符号集并且不是冒号的字符开始，则可以省略终止 "魔术签名" 的可选冒号。
The optional configuration variable <c0>core.excludesFile</c0> indicates a path to a file containing patterns of file names to exclude from git-add, similar to $GIT_DIR/info/exclude.
可选配置变量 <c0>core.excludesFile</c0> 表示包含要从 git-add 中排除的文件名模式的文件的路径，类似于 $GIT_DIR/info/exclude 。
The options <c0>--contains</c0>, <c1>--no-contains</c1>, <c2>--merged</c2> and <c3>--no-merged</c3> serve four related but different purposes:
<c0>--contains</c0> ， <c1>--no-contains</c1> ， <c2>--merged</c2> 和 <c3>--no-merged</c3> 四个相关但不同的目的：

The other file, git-add{litdd}interactive.perl, has 403 lines added and 35 lines deleted if you commit what is in the index, but working tree file has further modifications (one addition and one deletion).
另一个文件，git-add{litdd}interactive.perl，如果提交了索引，则添加了403行，删除了35行，但是工作树文件进一步修改(一次添加和一次删除)。
The output format can be overridden using the optional <c0><format></c0> argument.
可以使用可选的 <c0><format></c0> 参数覆盖输出格式。
The output of this command is convenient for e-mail submission or for use with <e0>git am</e0>.
此命令的输出可方便电子邮件提交或与 <e0>git am</e0> 一起使用。
The parser accepts a space instead of the <c1>T</c1> character as well.
解析器也接受一个空格而不是 <c1>T</c1> 字符。
The path name must not end with a <c0>/</c0>.
路径名称不能以 <c0>/</c0> 结尾。
The pathspec syntax is as follows:
pathspec 语法如下：
The pattern is a shell wildcard (i.e., matched using fnmatch(3)).
该模式是一个 shell 通配符（即使用 fnmatch(3) 进行匹配）。
The placeholders are:
占位符是：
The possible options are:
可能的选择是：
The primary reason for rerunning <e1>git init</e1> is to pick up newly added templates (or to move the repository to another place if --separate-git-dir is given).
重新运行 <e1>git init</e1> 的主要原因是拾取新添加的模板(或者如果给出了--separate-git-dir，则将仓库移动到另一个位置)。
The purpose of gitignore files is to ensure that certain files not tracked by Git remain untracked.
gitignore 文件的目的是确保 Git 未跟踪的某些文件保持不跟踪。

The recorded tree is prepared as usual (including the effect of the <c0>-i</c0> and <c1>-o</c1> options and explicit pathspec), and the message from the original commit is used as the starting point, instead of an empty message, when no other message is specified from the command line via options such as <c2>-m</c2>, <c3>-F</c3>, <c4>-c</c4>, etc.
记录的树按照常规进行准备(包括 <c0>-i</c0> 和 <c1>-o</c1> 选项和显式 pathspec 的效果)，并将来自原始提交的消息用作开始点，而不是空消息，当没有通过诸如 <c2>-m</c2> ， <c3>-F</c3> ，<c4>-c</c4>等选项从命令行指定其他消息等时。
The reflog covers all recent actions, and in addition the <c1>HEAD</c1> reflog records branch switching.
reflog 涵盖了所有最近的动作，另外 <c1>HEAD</c1> reflog 记录分支切换。
The request, printed to the standard output, begins with the branch description, summarizes the changes and indicates from where they can be pulled.
打印到标准输出的该请求以分支描述开始，总结了更改并指出可以从哪里拉出。
The resulting repository starts out without any object of its own.
生成的仓库开始没有任何自己的对象。
The resulting working tree file will appear to re-add the content.
生成的工作树文件将显示为重新添加内容。
The revert only modifies the working tree and the index.
恢复只修改工作树和索引。
The same restrictions as for <branchname> apply.
适用与 <branchname> 相同的限制。
The scope of that pathspec is limited to that subtree.
该 pathspec 的范围仅限于该子树。
The second .gitignore prevents Git from ignoring <c0>arch/foo/kernel/vmlinux.lds.S</c0>.
第二个.gitignore 会阻止 Git 忽略 <c0>arch/foo/kernel/vmlinux.lds.S</c0> 。
The second syntax ("<c0>git merge --abort</c0>") can only be run after the merge has resulted in conflicts.
第二个语法("<c0>git merge --abort</c0>")只能在合并导致冲突后运行。
The section or key is invalid (ret=1),
section 或键无效(ret = 1)，
The standard email format as described by RFC 2822, for example <c0>Thu, 07 Apr 2005 22:13:13 +0200</c0>.
RFC 2822描述的标准电子邮件格式，例如 <c0>Thu, 07 Apr 2005 22:13:13 +0200</c0> 。
The standard helper program to use with git-merge-index
与 git-merge-index 一起使用的标准助手程序
The syntax is fairly flexible and permissive; whitespaces are mostly ignored.
语法是相当灵活和宽容的;空白大多被忽略。
The tables below show what happens when running:
下表显示运行时会发生什么：
The text up to the first blank line in a commit message is treated as the commit title, and that title is used throughout Git.
直到提交消息中的第一个空白行的文本被视为提交标题，并且该标题在整个 Git 中使用。
The total number of paths.
路径总数。
The tree of actual checked out files.
实际检出文件的树。

The type is required unless <c0>-t</c0> or <c1>-p</c1> is used to find the object type, or <c2>-s</c2> is used to find the object size, or <c3>--textconv</c3> or <c4>--filters</c4> is used (which imply type "blob").
type 是必需的，除非 <c0>-t</c0> 或 <c1>-p</c1> 用于查找对象类型，或者 <c2>-s</c2> 用于查找对象大小，或 <c3>--textconv</c3> 或 <c4>--filters</c4> (这意味着类型为 "blob")。

The type specifier can be either <c0>--int</c0> or <c1>--bool</c1>, to make <e2>git config</e2> ensure that the variable(s) are of the given type and convert the value to the canonical form (simple decimal number for int, a "true" or "false" string for bool), or <c3>--path</c3>, which does some path expansion (see <c4>--path</c4> below).
类型说明符可以是 <c0>--int</c0> 或 <c1>--bool</c1> ，以使 <e2>git config</e2> 确保变量是给定的类型并将该值转换为规范形式（简单十进制数为 int，“true”或“false”字符串为bool）或 <c3>--path</c3> ，表示一些路径扩展（参见下面的 <c4>--path</c4>）。

The underlying Git plumbing tools, such as <e0>git ls-files</e0> and <e1>git read-tree</e1>, read <c2>gitignore</c2> patterns specified by command-line options, or from files specified by command-line options.
底层的 Git 管道工具，例如 <e0>git ls-files</e0> 和 <e1>git read-tree</e1> ，读取命令行选项指定的 <c2>gitignore</c2> 模式，或从命令行选项指定的文件读取。
The value for a variable that takes a color is a list of colors (at most two, one for foreground and one for background) and attributes (as many as you want), separated by spaces.
获取颜色的变量的值是颜色列表(最多两个，一个用于前台，另一个用于背景)和属性(尽可能多的)，以空格分隔。
The value for many variables that specify various sizes can be suffixed with <c0>k</c0>, <c1>M</c1>,…​ to mean "scale the number by 1024", "by 1024x1024", etc.
指定各种大小的许多变量的值，可以后缀为 <c0>k</c0> ， <c1>M</c1> ，...表示“将数字缩放1024”，“1024×1024”等等。
The value given will override values from configuration files.
给定的值将覆盖配置文件中的值。
The variable names are case-insensitive, allow only alphanumeric characters and <c0>-</c0>, and must start with an alphabetic character.
变量名称不区分大小写，仅允许字母数字字符和 <c0>-</c0> ，并且必须以字母字符开头。
The variables are divided into sections, wherein the fully qualified variable name of the variable itself is the last dot-separated segment and the section name is everything before the last dot.
变量分为几个部分，其中变量本身的完全限定变量名称是最后一个点分隔的段，段名称是最后一个点之前的所有内容。
The web browser can be specified using the configuration variable <c0>help.browser</c0>, or <c1>web.browser</c1> if the former is not set.
该 Web 浏览器可以使用配置的变量 <c0>help.browser</c0> 指定，如果前者未设置，也可以使用 <c1>web.browser</c1> 指定。
The working directory must match the index.
工作目录必须与索引匹配。
The working tree files will include a description of the conflict bracketed by the usual conflict markers <c1><<<<<<<</c1> and <c2>>>>>>>></c2>.
工作树文件将包括由通常的冲突标记 <c1><<<<<<<</c1> 和 <c2>>>>>>>></c2> 括起来的冲突说明。
The working tree normally contains the contents of the <a0>HEAD</a0> commit’s tree, plus any local changes that you have made but not yet committed.
工作树通常包含 <a0>HEAD</a0> 提交树的内容，以及您所做但尚未提交的任何本地更改。
The “--” is necessary to avoid confusion with the <s1>branch</s1> named <e2>gitk</e2>
“--”是必要的，以避免与名为 <e2>gitk</e2> 的 <s1>branch</s1> 混淆

Then "<c0>git merge topic</c0>" will replay the changes made on the <c1>topic</c1> branch since it diverged from <c2>master</c2> (i.e., <c3>E</c3>) until its current commit (<c4>C</c4>) on top of <c5>master</c5>, and record the result in a new commit along with the names of the two parent commits and a log message from the user describing the changes.
"<c0>git merge topic</c0>"将在<c5>master</c5> 之上重播 <c1>topic</c1> 分支上所做的更改，从它与 <c2>master</c2> 分离(即 <c3>E</c3> )，直到它的当前提交( <c4>C</c4> )，并将结果记录在一个新的提交中，有两个父提交的名称和一个用户描述更改的日志消息。
Then <c0>git bisect</c0> picks a commit between those two endpoints and asks you whether the selected commit is "good" or "bad".
然后 <c0>git bisect</c0> 在这两个端点之间选择一个提交，并询问所选提交是“good”还是“bad”。
There are also more complex operations that can be performed.
还可以执行更复杂的操作。
There are also several operations which should be avoided entirely, as they will make the patch impossible to apply:
还有几个操作应该完全避免，因为它们会使补丁变得不可行：

There are several built-in formats, and you can define additional formats by setting a pretty.<name> config option to either another format name, or a <e0>format:</e0> string, as described below (see <a1>git-config[1]</a1>).
有几种内置格式，您可以通过 pretty.<name> 配置选项设置为另一种格式名称或 <e0>format:</e0> 字符串来定义其他格式，如下所述(参见 <a1>git-config[1]</a1>)。
There is no option for <c0>git rm</c0> to remove from the index only the paths that have disappeared from the filesystem.
<c0>git rm</c0> 没有选项可以从索引中移除已从文件系统中消失的路径。
Therefore:
因此：
These are internal helper commands used by other commands; end users typically do not use them directly.
这些是其他命令使用的内部帮助命令；终端用户通常不直接使用它们。
These are safe to remove once a file has been merged and its <c2>git mergetool</c2> session has completed.
一旦文件合并且其 <c2>git mergetool</c2> 会话已完成，这些可以安全地移除。
These commands are to interact with foreign SCM and with other people via patch over e-mail.
这些命令是通过电子邮件补丁与外部 SCM 和其他人进行交互。
These environment variables apply to <e0>all</e0> core Git commands.
这些环境变量适用于<e0>全部</e0>核心 Git 命令。
These options are mostly targeted for packing of Git repositories.
这些选项主要用于打包 Git 存储库。
These patterns match relative to the location of the <c1>.gitignore</c1> file.
相对于 <c1>.gitignore</c1> 文件的位置相匹配的模式。
These stages are used to hold the various unmerged version of a file when a merge is in progress.
这些 stages 用于在合并进行时保存文件的各种未合并版本。
This <a0>open sourced</a0> site is <a1>hosted on GitHub.</a1><br2>
该 <a0>开源</a0> 网站 <a1>在 GitHub 拖管。</a1><br2>
This adds, modifies, and removes index entries to match the working tree.
这将添加，修改和删除索引条目以匹配工作树。
This allows for secure parsing of the output without getting confused e.g. by values that contain line breaks.
这允许输出包含换行符的值时安全解析，而不会变得混淆。
This allows removing all untracked files, including build products.
这允许删除所有未跟踪的文件，包括构建产品。
This also renews the author timestamp.
这也更新了作者的时间戳。
This behavior may be changed via the global <c3>branch.autoSetupMerge</c3> configuration flag.
此行为可能会通过全局 <c3>branch.autoSetupMerge</c3> 配置标志来更改。
This can also be controlled by setting the <c0>GIT_DIR</c0> environment variable.
这也可以通过设置 <c0>GIT_DIR</c0> 环境变量来控制。
This can also be controlled by setting the GIT_EXEC_PATH environment variable.
这也可以通过设置 GIT_EXEC_PATH 环境变量来控制。

This can also be controlled by setting the GIT_WORK_TREE environment variable and the core.worktree configuration variable (see core.worktree in <a0>git-config[1]</a0> for a more detailed discussion).
这也可以通过设置 GIT_WORK_TREE 环境变量和 core.worktree 配置变量来控制(参见 <a0>git-config[1]</a0> 中的 core.worktree 进行更详细的讨论)。
This can also be controlled by the <c0>--work-tree</c0> command-line option and the core.worktree configuration variable.
这也可以由 <c0>--work-tree</c0> 命令行选项和 core.worktree 配置变量控制。
This can be quicker and more flexible than using the interactive hunk selector.
这可以比使用交互式 hunk 选择器更快更灵活。
This can be used (possibly in conjunction with <e1>git reset</e1>) to create a pristine working directory to test a clean build.
这可以用来(可能与 <e1>git reset</e1> 一起使用)创建一个原始的工作目录来测试一个干净的构建。
This can be used to split a commit into two:
这可以用来将提交分为两个：
This can be used when you want to include further changes to the merge, or want to write your own merge commit message.
当您想要对合并进行进一步更改时，或者想要自己编写合并提交消息，可以使用此选项。
This can help with debugging object negotiation or other protocol issues.
这可以帮助调试对象协商或其他协议问题。
This can, for example, be useful to remove all build products.
例如，这可以用于移除所有构建产品。
This command applies the patch but does not create a commit.
此命令应用补丁，但不创建提交。
This command can be performed multiple times before a commit.
该命令可以在提交之前多次执行。
This command can run <c0>commit-msg</c0>, <c1>prepare-commit-msg</c1>, <c2>pre-commit</c2>, <c3>post-commit</c3> and <c4>post-rewrite</c4> hooks.
该命令可以运行 <c0>commit-msg</c0> ， <c1>prepare-commit-msg</c1> ， <c2>pre-commit</c2> ， <c3>post-commit</c3> 和 <c4>post-rewrite</c4> 钩子。
This command creates an empty Git repository - basically a <c0>.git</c0> directory with subdirectories for <c1>objects</c1>, <c2>refs/heads</c2>, <c3>refs/tags</c3>, and template files.
此命令创建一个空的 Git 仓库 - 基本上是一个 <c0>.git</c0> 目录，其目录包含 <c1>objects</c1> ， <c2>refs/heads</c2> ，<c3>refs/tags </c3>和模板文件。
This command generates such auxiliary files.
此命令生成这样的辅助文件。
This command is used by <e0>git pull</e0> to incorporate changes from another repository and can be used by hand to merge changes from one branch into another.
该命令由 <e0>git pull</e0> 用于包含来自另一个仓库的更改，可以手动使用将一个分支的更改合并到另一个分支。
This command manages the information recorded in the reflogs.
该命令管理在 reflog 中记录的信息。

This command provides support for <e0>git fetch</e0> and <e1>git pull</e1> to operate by packaging objects and references in an archive at the originating machine, then importing those into another repository using <e2>git fetch</e2> and <e3>git pull</e3> after moving the archive by some means (e.g., by sneakernet).
该命令提供对 <e0>git fetch</e0> 和 <e1>git pull</e1> 的支持，通过在原始机器上打包对象和引用到一个存档中，然后通过某种方式移动存档后（如通过 sneakernet），使用 <e2>git fetch</e2> 和 <e3>git pull</e3> 导入到另一个仓库。
This command updates the index using the current content found in the working tree, to prepare the content staged for the next commit.
此命令使用工作树中找到的当前内容更新索引，以为下一次提交准备暂存的内容。
This command uses a binary search algorithm to find which commit in your project’s history introduced a bug.
该命令使用二分查找算法来查找项目历史记录中提交的错误。
This command will fail with non-zero status upon error.
该命令将以非零的错误状态码失败。
This counts the number of unpacked object files and disk space consumed by them, to help you decide when it is a good time to repack.
这将计算未打包对象文件的数量和它们消耗的磁盘空间，以帮助您决定什么时候重新打包。
This default behavior can be changed by using the --tags or --no-tags options or by configuring remote.<name>.tagOpt.
可以使用--tags 或--no-tags 选项或配置 remote.<name>.tagOpt 来更改此默认行为。

This default configuration is achieved by creating references to the remote branch heads under <c0>refs/remotes/origin</c0> and by initializing <c1>remote.origin.url</c1> and <c2>remote.origin.fetch</c2> configuration variables.
默认配置的实现通过在 <c0>refs/remotes/origin</c0> 下创建对远程分支头的引用，并通过初始化 <c1>remote.origin.url</c1> 和 <c2>remote.origin.fetch</c2> 配置变量。
This diff will not be a part of the commit message.
此差异不会是提交消息的一部分。
This document attempts to write down and motivate some of the workflow elements used for <c0>git.git</c0> itself.
本文档尝试写下并激励用于 <c0>git.git</c0> 本身的某些工作流元素。
This effectively runs <c0>add --interactive</c0>, but bypasses the initial command menu and directly jumps to the <c1>patch</c1> subcommand.
这有效地运行 <c0>add --interactive</c0> ，但绕过初始命令菜单，直接跳转到 <c1>patch</c1> 子命令。
This environment allows the specification of an alternate index file.
此环境变量允许指定备用索引文件。
This environment variable allows the specification of an index version for new repositories.
该环境变量允许为新的仓库指定索引版本。
This environment variable can be set to true to tell Git not to stop at filesystem boundaries.
该环境变量可以设置为 true，以告知 Git 不要在文件系统边界停止。

This environment variable can be used along with <c1>$HOME</c1> and <c2>$XDG_CONFIG_HOME</c2> to create a predictable environment for a picky script, or you can set it temporarily to avoid using a buggy <c3>/etc/gitconfig</c3> file while waiting for someone with sufficient permissions to fix it.
这个环境变量可以与 <c1>$HOME</c1> 和 <c2>$XDG_CONFIG_HOME</c2> 一起使用，为挑选脚本创建一个可预测的环境，也可以临时设置，以避免使用错误的 <c3>/etc/gitconfig</c3> 。
This environment variable overrides <c0>$EDITOR</c0> and <c1>$VISUAL</c1>.
此环境变量覆盖 <c0>$EDITOR</c0> 和 <c1>$VISUAL</c1> 。
This environment variable overrides <c0>$PAGER</c0>.
此环境变量覆盖 <c0>$PAGER</c0> 。
This file contains the commit message of a commit in progress.
此文件包含正在进行的提交的提交消息。
This flag disables these checks, and can cause the remote repository to lose commits; use it with care.
此标志禁用这些检查，并可能导致远程仓库丢失提交;小心使用它。
This flag forces progress status even if the standard error stream is not directed to a terminal.
即使标准错误流未指向终端，该标志也强制进行状态。
This form is convenient to push the current branch without thinking about its local name.
这种形式方便地推送当前的分支，而不考虑其本地名称。
This form is only needed to create a new branch or tag in the remote repository when the local name and the remote name are different; otherwise, the ref name on its own will work.
此形式仅用于，当本地名称和远程名称不同时，在远程仓库中创建新的分支或标签;否则，自己的引用名称将工作。
This form is to compare the given two paths on the filesystem.
该形式是比较文件系统上给定的两个路径。
This form is to view the changes on the branch containing and up to the second <commit>, starting at a common ancestor of both <commit>.
此形式是查看包含并直到第二个<commit> 的分支上的更改，从 <commit> 的共同祖先开始。
This form is to view the changes you have in your working tree relative to the named <commit>.
该形式是查看您在工作树中的改变相对于指定的 <commit> 所做的更改。
This form is to view the changes you made relative to the index (staging area for the next commit).
该形式是查看您对索引(下一次提交的暂存区)所做的更改。
This form is to view the changes you staged for the next commit relative to the named <commit>.
该形式用于查看暂存的用于下一次提交的相对于指定的 <commit> 的更改。
This form is to view the differences between the raw contents of two blob objects.
此表单是查看两个 blob 对象的原始内容之间的差异。
This form resets the current branch head to <commit> and possibly updates the index (resetting it to the tree of <commit>) and the working tree depending on <mode>.
该形式将当前分支头重置到 <commit>，并根据 <mode> 可能更新索引(将其重置为 <commit> 树)和工作树。
This form resets the index entries for all <paths> to their state at <tree-ish>.
该形式将所有 <paths> 的索引条目重置为其 <tree-ish> 的状态。
This form should not be combined with other pathspec.
此形式不应与其他路径组合。
This gives the user a chance to review the difference before adding modified contents to the index.
这样可以让用户在将修改后的内容添加到索引之前查看差异。
This has a very similar UI to <e0>update</e0> and <e1>revert</e1>, and lets you add untracked paths to the index.
这与 <e0>update</e0> 和 <e1>revert</e1> 具有非常相似的界面，并允许您将未追溯路径添加到索引。
This has a very similar UI to <e0>update</e0>, and the staged information for selected paths are reverted to that of the HEAD version.
这与 <e0>update</e0> 具有非常相似的界面，所选路径的暂存信息将恢复为 HEAD 版本。
This has no effect when a message is given by other means, e.g. with the <c1>-m</c1> or <c2>-F</c2> options.
当通过其他方式给出消息时，这不起作用。如使用 <c1>-m</c1> 或 <c2>-F</c2> 选项。
This has the exact same effect as <c0>git reset --hard <upstream></c0> (or <newbase>).
这具有与 <c0>git reset --hard <upstream></c0> (或<newbase>)完全相同的效果。
This implies <c0>--bare</c0>.
这意味着 <c0>--bare</c0> 。
This information may be used by scripts or other git commands, such as <a1>git-pull[1]</a1>.
该信息可以由脚本或其他 git 命令使用，例如 <a1>git-pull[1]</a1> 。
This is a potentially <e0>dangerous</e0> mode of operation.
这是潜在的 <e0>危险</e0> 操作模式。
This is a shorthand for "--pretty=oneline --abbrev-commit" used together.
这是一起使用的 "--pretty=oneline --abbrev-commit" 的缩写。
This is designed to be as compact as possible.
这被设计为尽可能紧凑。
This is equivalent to running "git branch" with "-f"; see <a0>git-branch[1]</a0> for details.
这相当于运行“git branch”与“-f”;详见 <a0>git-branch[1]</a0> 。
This is equivalent to setting the <c0>GIT_GLOB_PATHSPECS</c0> environment variable to <c1>1</c1>.
这相当于将 <c0>GIT_GLOB_PATHSPECS</c0> 环境变量设置为 <c1>1</c1> 。
This is equivalent to setting the <c0>GIT_ICASE_PATHSPECS</c0> environment variable to <c1>1</c1>.
这相当于将 <c0>GIT_ICASE_PATHSPECS</c0> 环境变量设置为 <c1>1</c1> 。
This is equivalent to setting the <c0>GIT_LITERAL_PATHSPECS</c0> environment variable to <c1>1</c1>.
这相当于将 <c0>GIT_LITERAL_PATHSPECS</c0> 环境变量设置为 <c1>1</c1> 。
This is equivalent to setting the <c0>GIT_NOGLOB_PATHSPECS</c0> environment variable to <c1>1</c1>.
这相当于将 <c0>GIT_NOGLOB_PATHSPECS</c0> 环境变量设置为 <c1>1</c1> 。
This is intended to be useful for scripts.
这是为脚本有用的。
This is similar to doing curl <c0>--trace-ascii</c0> on the command line.
这类似于在命令行上执行 curl <c0>--trace-ascii</c0> 。
This is synonymous to the previous form.
这是上一个形式的同义词。
This is the default action.
这是默认动作。
This is the default behavior.
这是默认行为。
This is the default mode of operation of <e0>git commit</e0> if any paths are given on the command line, in which case this option can be omitted.
如果在命令行中给出了任何路径，这是 <e0>git commit</e0> 的默认操作模式，在这种情况下可以省略此选项。
This is the default.
这是默认的。
This is the most basic form of the command.
这是命令的最基本形式。
This is the same as providing <e0>^$</e0> as the value_regex in <c1>--replace-all</c1>.
这与在 <c1>--replace-all</c1> 中提供 <e0>^$</e0> 作为 value_regex 相同。

This is the same set of commits that would be shown by <c0>git log <upstream>..HEAD</c0>; or by <c1>git log 'fork_point'..HEAD</c1>, if <c2>--fork-point</c2> is active (see the description on <c3>--fork-point</c3> below); or by <c4>git log HEAD</c4>, if the <c5>--root</c5> option is specified.
这组提交由 <c0>git log <upstream>..HEAD</c0> 显示的相同;或者由 <c1>git log 'fork_point' ..HEAD</c1> ，如果激活 <c2>--fork-point</c2>(请参阅下面的 <c3>--fork-point</c3>);或者由 <c4>git log HEAD</c4> ，如果指定了 <c5>--root</c5> 选项。
This is the transactional equivalent of
这是等价的事务

This is to emulate <c0>git fetch</c0> run on the <c1>mothership</c1> using <c2>git push</c2> that is run in the opposite direction in order to integrate the work done on <c3>satellite</c3>, and is often necessary when you can only make connection in one way (i.e. satellite can ssh into mothership but mothership cannot initiate connection to satellite because the latter is behind a firewall or does not run sshd).

这是模仿 <c1>mothership</c1> 上运行的 <c0>git fetch</c0> ，在相反的方向使用 <c2>git push</c2> 以整合 <c3>satellite</c3> 上的工作，通常在你只能完成单向连接时是必须的。(即 satellite 可以 ssh 到 mothership ，但 mothership 无法启动连接到 satellite ，因为后者的防火墙或未运行 sshd).
This is to view the changes between two arbitrary <commit>.
这是查看两个任意的<commit>之间的变化。
This is typically not used directly by end users — instead, see <a2>git-gc[1]</a2>.
这通常不会被最终用户直接使用 - 而是参见 <a2>git-gc[1]</a2> 。
This is used by <e0>git cvsimport</e0> to update the index without modifying files in the work tree.
这由 <e0>git cvsimport</e0> 用于更新索引，而不修改工作树中的文件。
This is useful for, among other things, showing the unstaged content of such files with <c0>git diff</c0> and committing them with <c1>git commit -a</c1>.
这对于使用 <c0>git diff</c0> 显示这些文件的未分页内容以及使用 <c1>git commit -a</c1> 提交它们非常有用。
This is useful if F and G were flawed in some way, or should not be part of topicA.
如果 F 和 G 以某种方式有缺陷，或者不应该是 topicA 的一部分，这是有用的。
This is useful to restrict recursive submodule initialization from an untrusted repository or for programs which feed potentially-untrusted URLS to git commands.
这对从不受信任的仓库或将可能不受信任的 URLS 提供给 git 命令的程序来限制递归子模块初始化是有用的。
This is useful when topicB does not depend on topicA.
当 topicB 不依赖于 topicA 时，这是有用的。
This is usually not what you want unless you are concluding a conflicted merge.
这通常不是你想要的，除非你正结束冲突的合并。
This leaves a copy of <c0>next</c0> temporarily in FETCH_HEAD, but does not update any remote-tracking branches.
这将在 FETCH_HEAD 中临时留下 <c0>next</c0> 的副本，但不会更新任何远程跟踪分支。
This leaves all your changed files "Changes to be committed", as <e0>git status</e0> would put it.
这将保留所有更改后的文件为"要进行的更改"，如 <e0>git status</e0> 所示。
This lets you choose one path out of a <e0>status</e0> like selection.
这允许您从一个 <e0>status</e0> 中像选择一样选择一个补丁。
This lets you quit without do cleaning.
在没有做清洁的情况下退出。
This lets you review what will be committed (i.e. between HEAD and index).
这可以让您查看将要提交的内容(即 HEAD 和索引之间)。
This line begins with "Merge: " and the sha1s of ancestral commits are printed, separated by spaces.
该行以"Merge："开始，以空格分隔显示祖先提交的 sha1s 。
This makes a commit that records the modification to <c0>Makefile</c0>.
这做一个提交记录 <c0>Makefile</c0> 的修改。
This makes sense only when following a strict policy of merging all topic branches when staying on a single integration branch.
只有当遵守在一个整合分支上合并所有主题分支的严格策略时，这才有意义。
This manual is designed to be readable by someone with basic UNIX command-line skills, but no previous knowledge of Git.
本手册的目的是让具有基本 UNIX 命令行技能，但没有的 Git 知识的人员可读。
This manual page describes only the most frequently used options.
本手册页仅介绍最常用的选项。
This may be desirable if you are trying to make a back-up of your repository.
如果您想要备份存储库，这可能是可取的。
This may be either an absolute URL ready to be passed to <a0>git-clone[1]</a0> or (if it begins with ./ or ../) a location relative to the superproject’s origin repository.
这可能是一个绝对的 URL，可以传递给 <a0>git-clone[1]</a0> 或(如果以./或../开头)相对于超项目的原始存储库的位置。
This may be helpful for troubleshooting some pack-related performance problems.
这可能有助于排除某些与包相关的性能问题。
This may be useful to rebuild everything from scratch, but keep manually created files.
这可能用于从头开始重建，但保留手动创建的文件。
This means that <c0>git reset -p</c0> is the opposite of <c1>git add -p</c1>, i.e. you can use it to selectively reset hunks.
这意味着 <c0>git reset -p</c0> 与 <c1>git add -p</c1> 相反，即可以使用它来选择性地重置 hunks。
This means that <c0>git reset <paths></c0> is the opposite of <c1>git add <paths></c1>.
这意味着 <c0>git reset <paths></c0> 与 <c1>git add <paths></c1> 相反。
This means that you can use <c0>git checkout -p</c0> to selectively discard edits from your current working tree.
这意味着您可以使用 <c0>git checkout -p</c0> 选择性地丢弃当前工作树中的编辑。
This mechanism can be used by projects that want to guide participants with some hints on what to write in the message in what order.
这个机制可以被那些想要引导参与者的项目用于以什么顺序在消息中写什么的一些提示。
This merges the file listing in the directory cache index with the actual working directory list, and shows different combinations of the two.
这将目录缓存索引中的文件列表与实际工作目录列表合并，并显示了两者的不同组合。
This obviously implies the <c5>-n</c5> because there is nowhere to check out the working tree.
这显然意味着 <c5>-n</c5> ，因为没有办法检出工作树。

This option affects options that expect path name like <c0>--git-dir</c0> and <c1>--work-tree</c1> in that their interpretations of the path names would be made relative to the working directory caused by the <c2>-C</c2> option.
该选项影响期望路径名称的选项，像 <c0>--git-dir</c0> 和 <c1>--work-tree</c1>，因为他们对路径名称的解释将相对于由 <c2>-C</c2> 选项指定的工作目录。
This option bypasses the pre-commit and commit-msg hooks.
此选项绕过预提交和提交 msg 钩子。
This option bypasses the safety, and is primarily for use by foreign SCM interface scripts.
此选项绕过安全性，主要由外部 SCM 接口脚本使用。

This option can also be used when cloning locally from a repository that already borrows objects from another repository—​the new repository will borrow objects from the same repository, and this option can be used to stop the borrowing.
当从已经从另一个存储库借用对象的存储库本地克隆时，也可以使用此选项 - 新存储库将从同一存储库中借用对象，并且此选项可用于停止借用。
This option can be specified multiple times.
此选项可以多次指定。
This option can be used to override --no-commit.
此选项可用于覆盖--no-commit。
This option can be used to separate command-line options from the list of files, (useful when filenames might be mistaken for command-line options).
该选项可用于从文件列表中分离命令行选项(当文件名可能被误认为是命令行选项时很有用)。
This option can only be used together with --dry-run.
此选项只能与 --dry-run 一起使用。
This option determines how the supplied commit message should be cleaned up before committing.
此选项确定在提交之前如何清理提供的提交消息。
This option has no effect when setting the value (but you can use <e4>git config bla ~/</e4> from the command line to let your shell do the expansion).
此选项在设置值时无效(但您可以使用命令行中的 <e4>git config bla ~/</e4> 来让您的 shell 进行扩展)。
This option is a no-op when no <pathspec> is used.
当不使用 <pathspec> 时，此选项是无操作的。
This option is implicitly supplied if any other list-like option such as <c0>--contains</c0> is provided.
如果提供了任何其他类似列表的选项（如 <c0>--contains</c0> ），则会隐式提供此选项。
This option is primarily to help users who are used to older versions of Git, whose "git add <pathspec>…​" was a synonym for "git add --no-all <pathspec>…​", i.e. ignored removed files.
此选项主要用于帮助用户使用旧版 Git，其“git add <pathspec> ...”是“git add --no-all <pathspec> ...”的同义词，即忽略删除的文件。
This option lets you further edit the message taken from these sources.
此选项可让您进一步编辑从这些来源获取的消息。
This option may be used to override a value set in the <c1>help.format</c1> configuration variable.
此选项可用于覆盖 <c1>help.format</c1> 配置变量中设置的值。
This option overrides any given command or guide name.
此选项将覆盖任何给定的命令或指南名称。
This option overrides setting the <c1>GIT_CURL_VERBOSE</c1> environment variable.
此选项将覆盖设置 <c1>GIT_CURL_VERBOSE</c1> 环境变量。
This option suppresses that output.
此选项禁止该输出。
This option will suppress the warning (e.g., if you are manually performing operations on submodules).
此选项将抑制警告(例如，如果您手动对子模块执行操作)。
This overrides the <c1>pager.<cmd></c1> configuration options (see the "Configuration Mechanism" section below).
这将覆盖 <c1>pager.<cmd></c1> 配置选项(请参阅下面的"配置机制"部分)。
This page can be displayed with <e0>git help help</e0> or <c1>git help --help</c1>
可以使用 <e0>git help help</e0> 或 <c1>git help --help</c1> 显示此页面。
This parameter can be either a URL (see the section <a0>GIT URLS</a0> below) or the name of a remote (see the section <a1>REMOTES</a1> below).
此参数可以是 URL(请参见下面的 <a0>GIT URLS</a0> 部分)或远程名称(请参阅下面的 <a1>REMOTES</a1> 部分)。
This program is usually not what the end user wants to run directly.
这个程序通常不是最终用户想要直接运行的。
This removes as well as modifies index entries to match the working tree, but adds no new files.
这将删除以及修改索引条目以匹配工作树，但不会添加新文件。
This replaces all lines matching the key (and optionally the value_regex).
这将替换匹配键(和可选的 value_regex)的所有行。
This requires your working tree to be clean (no modifications from the HEAD commit).
这要求您的工作树清洁(与 HEAD 提交没有修改)。
This section can also be used by those who respond to <c0>git request-pull</c0> or pull-request on GitHub (www.github.com) to integrate the work of others into their history.
这个部分也可以由那些在 GitHub(www.github.com)上回应 <c0>git request-pull</c0> 或 pull-request 的用户将其他人的工作整合到他们的历史中。
This should be a colon-separated list of absolute paths.
这应该是一个冒号分隔的绝对路径列表。
This should not be confused with <c0>git branch -l <branchname></c0>, which creates a branch named <c1><branchname></c1> with a reflog.
这不应该与 <c0>git branch -l <branchname></c0> 混淆，后者创建一个名为 <c1><branchname></c1> 的分支与 reflog。

This shows the change between HEAD and index (i.e. what will be committed if you say <c0>git commit</c0>), and between index and working tree files (i.e. what you could stage further before <c1>git commit</c1> using <c2>git add</c2>) for each path.
这显示了 HEAD 和索引之间的变化(即，如果你说的是 <c0>git commit</c0> )以及索引和工作树文件之间的转换(也就是你可以在 <c1>git commit</c1> 使用 <c2>git add</c2> )。
This shows the files and directories to be deleted and issues an "Input ignore patterns>>" prompt.
这将显示要删除的文件和目录，并发出 "Input ignore patterns>>" 提示。
This shows the files and directories to be deleted and issues an "Select items to delete>>" prompt.
这将显示要删除的文件和目录，并发出 "Select items to delete>>" 提示。
This shows the status information and issues an "Update>>" prompt.
这将显示状态信息并发出"更新>>"提示。
This step and the next one could be combined into a single step with "checkout -b my2.6.14 v2.6.14".
此步骤和下一步可以组合成一个单一的步骤与"checkout -b my2.6.14 v2.6.14"。
This subcommand is also typically not used directly by end users.
此子命令通常也不直接由最终用户使用。
This takes precedence over any "-U" or "--unified" option value passed on the Git diff command line.
这优先于 Git diff 命令行上传递的任何“-U”或“--unified”选项值。
This tutorial explains how to import a new project into Git, make changes to it, and share changes with other developers.
本教程将介绍如何将新项目导入 Git，对其进行更改，并与其他开发人员共享更改。

This updates (or creates, as necessary) branches <c0>pu</c0> and <c1>tmp</c1> in the local repository by fetching from the branches (respectively) <c2>pu</c2> and <c3>maint</c3> from the remote repository.
更新（或者创建，如果需要的话）本地仓库中的 <c0>pu</c0> 和 <c1>tmp</c1> 分支，通地（分别地）抓取远程仓库的 <c2>pu</c2> 和 <c3>maint</c3> 分支。

该变量的优先级低于其他路径变量，例如 GIT_INDEX_FILE，GIT_OBJECT_DIRECTORY ...

该变量覆盖用于相同目的的配置设置 <c3>ssh.variant</c3> 。
This variable specifies a ":" separated (on Windows ";" separated) list of Git object directories which can be used to search for Git objects.
此变量指定可以用于搜索 Git 对象的 Git 对象目录列表，用的“:”分隔(在 Windows 用 “;”分隔)。
This will start to clean, and you must confirm one by one in order to delete items.
这将开始清理，您必须逐个确认才能删除项目。
Those filters can modify each tree (e.g. removing a file or running a perl rewrite on all files) or information about each commit.

Though not required, it’s a good idea to begin the commit message with a single short (less than 50 character) line summarizing the change, followed by a blank line and then a more thorough description.
虽然不是必需的，但是最好用一个简短(小于50个字符)的行来总结更改，然后是空行，然后是更彻底的描述开始提交消息。
Thus after making any changes to the working tree, and before running the commit command, you must use the <c0>add</c0> command to add any new or modified files to the index.
因此，在对工作树进行任何更改后，在运行 commit 命令之前，必须使用 <c0>add</c0> 命令将任何新的或修改的文件添加到索引。
Thus you may instead want to use <c1>rm -f filename</c1> as the script.
因此，您可能希望使用 <c1>rm -f filename</c1> 作为脚本。

Thus, given two directories <c0>d</c0> and <c1>d2</c1>, there is a difference between using <c2>git rm 'd*'</c2> and <c3>git rm 'd/*'</c3>, as the former will also remove all of directory <c4>d2</c4>.
因此，给定两个目录 <c0>d</c0> 和 <c1>d2</c1> ，使用 <c2>git rm 'd*' </c2> 和 <c3>git rm 'd/*' </c3> 有区别，因为前者也会移除 <c4>d2</c4> 的所有目录。
Time and date specified by the ISO 8601 standard, for example <c0>2005-04-07T22:13:13</c0>.
To <a0>merge</a0> more than two <a1>branches</a1>.
<a0>merge</a0> 两个以上的 <a1>branches</a1> 。

要检出原始的 <branch> 并移除 .git/rebase-apply 工作文件，请改用命令 <c2>git rebase --abort</c2> 。

要显示 <a0>git[1]</a0> 手册页，请使用 <c1>git help git</c1> 。

To prepare for working on <branch>, switch to it by updating the index and the files in the working tree, and by pointing HEAD at the branch.
要准备在<branch>上工作，通过更新索引和工作树中的文件，并将 HEAD 指向分支，来切换到它。

要移除选项，输入请使用前缀 <c0>-</c0> 像这样：

To support this more general usage, the terms "old" and "new" can be used in place of "good" and "bad", or you can choose your own terms.

更新索引不仅工作树具有与 <pathspec> 匹配的文件，而且索引已经具有条目的位置。

安全地更新存储在 ref 中的对象名
Update the origin repository’s master branch with the dev branch, allowing non-fast-forward updates.
使用 dev 分支更新 origin 存储库的 master 分支，允许非快速更新。

更新从您克隆的仓库的远程跟踪分支，然后将其中的一个分支合并到当前分支中：

使用本地引用更新远程引用，同时发送完成给定引用所需的对象。

Use -f option twice if you really want to remove such a directory.
如果您真的要移除这样的目录，请使用 -f 选项两次。
Use <a0>git-am[1]</a0> to create commits from patches generated by <a1>git-format-patch[1]</a1> and/or received by email.
使用 <a0>git-am[1]</a0> 创建由 <a1>git-format-patch[1]</a1> 生成的补丁和/或通过电子邮件接收的修补程序。
Use <c0>-r</c0> together with <c1>-d</c1> to delete remote-tracking branches.
将 <c0>-r</c0> 与 <c1>-d</c1> 一起使用来删除远程跟踪分支。
Use <c0>git mergetool</c0> to run one of several merge utilities to resolve merge conflicts.
使用 <c0>git mergetool</c0> 运行多个合并实用程序之一来解决合并冲突。
Use <c0>git stash</c0> when you want to record the current state of the working directory and the index, but want to go back to a clean working directory.
当要记录工作目录和索引的当前状态，但是要返回到干净的工作目录时，请使用 <c0>git stash</c0> 。
Use <e0>-</e0> to read the message from the standard input.
使用 <e0>-</e0> 从标准输入读取消息。
Use a tarball as a starting point for a new repository.
使用 tarball 作为新存储库的起点。
Use binary search to find the commit that introduced a bug
使用二分法来查找引入错误的提交
Use newline instead as a delimiter between key and value.
使用换行符作为键和值之间的分隔符。
Use the given <msg> as the commit message.
使用给定的 <msg> 作为提交消息。
Use the given config file instead of the one specified by GIT_CONFIG.
使用给定的配置文件，而不是 GIT_CONFIG 指定的配置文件。
Use the interactive patch selection interface to chose which changes to commit.
使用交互式补丁选择界面选择要提交的更改。
Use the selected commit message without launching an editor.
使用所选的提交信息而不启动编辑器。

Use the source ref that matches <c0>master</c0> (e.g. <c1>refs/heads/master</c1>) to update the ref that matches <c2>satellite/master</c2> (most probably <c3>refs/remotes/satellite/master</c3>) in the <c4>mothership</c4> repository; do the same for <c5>dev</c5> and <c6>satellite/dev</c6>.

使用与 <c0>master</c0> 匹配的源引用(例如 <c1>refs/heads/master</c1> )，更新 <c4>mothership</c4> 仓库中与 <c2>satellite/master</c2> 匹配的引用(最可能<c3>refs/remotes/satellite/master</c3>)，<c5>dev</c5> 和 <c6>satellite/dev</c6> 也一样。
Use this option to unstage and remove paths only from the index.

使用 Git 进行协作
Using an already existing repository as an alternate will require fewer objects to be copied from the repository being cloned, reducing network and local storage costs.
将已存在的存储库用作备用数据库将需要从要克隆的存储库复制的对象较少，从而降低网络和本地存储成本。

使用交互式 rebases

Using more options generally further limits the output (e.g. <c0>--since=<date1></c0> limits to commits newer than <c1><date1></c1>, and using it with <c2>--grep=<pattern></c2> further limits to commits whose log message has a line that matches <c3><pattern></c3>), unless otherwise noted.
使用更多选项通常进一步限制输出(例如 <c0>--since=<date1></c0> 限制提交比 <c1><date1></c1> 更新，并使用 <c2>--grep=<pattern></c2> 进一步限制其日志消息具有与 <c3><pattern></c3> 匹配的行)，除非另有说明。
Using refspecs explicitly:
明确使用 refspecs：

使用 “git add -A”

使用 “git commit -a”
Usually it is easier to configure any desired options through your personal <c0>.ssh/config</c0> file.
通常，通过您的个人 <c0>.ssh/config</c0> 文件配置任何所需选项更容易。
Usually recording a commit that has the exact same tree as its sole parent commit is a mistake, and the command prevents you from making such a commit.
通常记录与其唯一的父提交完全相同的树的提交是一个错误，并且该命令阻止您进行这样的提交。
Usually, the command refuses to update a remote ref that is not an ancestor of the local ref used to overwrite it.
通常，如果远程引用不是本地引用的祖先，该命令拒绝更新远程引用。

验证打包的 Git 归档文件

Values of many variables are treated as a simple string, but there are variables that take values of specific types and there are rules as to how to spell them.

各种命令从配置文件读取并相应地调整其操作。
Various ways to check your working tree
检查你的工作树的各种方式
Verifies the connectivity and validity of the objects in the database
校验数据库中对象的连接性和有效性
Verifies the connectivity and validity of the objects in the database.
验证数据库中对象的连接性和有效性。

我们可以使用以下命令实现：
We divide Git into high level ("porcelain") commands and low level ("plumbing") commands.
我们将 Git 分为高级(“porcelain”)命令和低级(“plumbing”)命令。
We formulate a set of <e0>rules</e0> for quick reference, while the prose tries to motivate each of them.
我们制定一组 <e0>rules</e0> ，以便快速参考，而散文则试图激励他们。
We separate the porcelain commands into the main commands and some ancillary user utilities.
我们将高级命令分为主要命令和一些辅助用户工具。
We want our tree to look like this:
我们希望我们的树看起来像这样：
We want to make <e0>topic</e0> forked from branch <e1>master</e1>; for example, because the functionality on which <e2>topic</e2> depends was merged into the more stable <e3>master</e3> branch.
我们希望让 <e0>topic</e0> 分支派生于 <e1>master</e1> 分支 ;例如，因为 <e2>topic</e2> 所依赖的功能被合并到更稳定的 <e3>master</e3> 分支中。
