What to do when a push fails
推动失败时该怎么办
What you chose are then highlighted with <e0>*</e0>, like this:
然后用 <e0>*</e0> 突出显示您所选择的内容，如下所示：

When "git-diff-index", "git-diff-tree", or "git-diff-files" are run with a <c0>-p</c0> option, "git diff" without the <c1>--raw</c1> option, or "git log" with the "-p" option, they do not produce the output described above; instead they produce a patch file.
当使用 <c0>-p</c0> 选项运行“git-diff-index”，“git-diff-tree”或“git-diff-files”时，“git diff”不带 <c1>--raw</c1> 选项或“git log”与“-p”选项，它们不产生上述输出;而是产生补丁文件。
When <c0>interactive</c0>, enable the interactive mode of rebase.
当 <c0>interactive</c0> 时，启用 rebase 的交互模式。
When <c2>-u <keyid></c2> is not used, the committer identity for the current user is used to find the GnuPG key for signing.
当不使用 <c2>-u <keyid></c2> 时，当前用户的提交者身份用于查找用于签名的 GnuPG 密钥。
When <c3>--cached</c3> is given, the staged content has to match either the tip of the branch or the file on disk, allowing the file to be removed from just the index.
当给出 <c3>--cached</c3> 时，暂存内容必须与分支尖端或磁盘上的文件相匹配，从而仅将该文件从索引中删除。
When <e0>=<format></e0> part is omitted, it defaults to <e1>medium</e1>.
当 <e0>=<format></e0> 部分省略时，默认为 <e1>medium</e1> 。
When <e10><format></e10> is none of the above, and has <e11>%placeholder</e11> in it, it acts as if <e12>--pretty=tformat:<format></e12> were given.
当 <e10><format></e10> 不是上述内容，并且其中有 <e11>%placeholder</e11> 时，它的行为就好像 <e12>--pretty=tformat:<format></e12> 被给予。
When <path> arguments are present, compares only paths matching those patterns.
当存在 <path> 参数时，只比较匹配这些模式的路径。
When <paths> or <c0>--patch</c0> are given, <e1>git checkout</e1> does <s2>not</s2> switch branches.
给出<paths>或 <c0>--patch</c0> 时， <e1>git checkout</e1> <s2>不</s2> 切换分支。
When <type> is not specified, it defaults to "blob".
当未指定 <type> 时，它默认为 "blob"。
When EOF is received on standard input, fast import writes out updated branch and tag refs, fully updating the current repository with the newly imported data.
当在标准输入上接收到 EOF 时，快速导入会写入更新的分支和标签引用，使用新导入的数据完全更新当前仓库。

When a local branch is started off a remote-tracking branch, Git sets up the branch (specifically the <c0>branch.<name>.remote</c0> and <c1>branch.<name>.merge</c1> configuration entries) so that <e2>git pull</e2> will appropriately merge from the remote-tracking branch.
当本地分支从远程跟踪分支启动时，Git 设置分支(具体为 <c0>branch.<name>.remote</c0> 和 <c1>branch.<name>.merge</c1> 配置条目)，以便 <e2>git pull</e2> 将适当地从远程跟踪分支合并。
When a merge conflict happens during switching branches with the <c0>-m</c0> option, you would see something like this:
当使用 <c0>-m</c0> 选项切换分支时发生合并冲突时，您会看到如下：

When a ref is updated, reflog entries are created to keep track of the reason why the ref was updated (which is typically the name of the high-level command that updated the ref), in addition to the old and new values of the ref.
当 ref 被更新时，创建 reflog 条目以跟踪 ref 被更新的原因(通常是更新 ref 的高级命令的名称)，以及 ref 的旧的和新的值。
When a variable is said to take a boolean value, many synonyms are accepted for <e0>true</e0> and <e1>false</e1>; these are all case-insensitive.
当一个变量被认为是一个布尔值时，很多同义词被接受为 <e0>true</e0> 和 <e1>false</e1> ;这些都是不区分大小写的。
When accepting a new code drop for a vendor branch, you probably want to record both the removal of paths and additions of new paths as well as modifications of existing paths.
当为供应商分支接受新的代码 drop 时，您可能需要记录路径的删除和新路径的添加以及现有路径的修改。
When converting value to the canonical form using <c0>--bool</c0> type specifier, <e1>git config</e1> will ensure that the output is "true" or "false" (spelled in lowercase).
当使用 <c0>--bool</c0> 类型说明符将值转换为规范形式时， <e1>git config</e1> 将确保输出为“true”或“false”(拼写为小写)。

When deciding whether to ignore a path, Git normally checks <c1>gitignore</c1> patterns from multiple sources, with the following order of precedence, from highest to lowest (within one level of precedence, the last matching pattern decides the outcome):
在决定是否忽略路径时，Git 通常从多个来源检查 <c1>gitignore</c1> 模式，从以下优先顺序，从最高到最低(在一个优先级中，最后一个匹配模式决定结果) ：
When doing a dry-run, give the output in a porcelain-ready format.
做 dry-run 时，给出一个高级准备格式的输出。
When doing a dry-run, give the output in the long-format.
做 dry-run 时，以长格式输出。
When doing a dry-run, give the output in the short-format.
做 dry-run 时，以短格式输出。
When editing the commit message, start the editor with the contents in the given file.
编辑提交信息时，使用给定文件中的内容启动编辑器。
When false, merge the current branch into the upstream branch.
当为 false 时，将当前分支合并到上游分支。
When files are given on the command line, the command commits the contents of the named files, without recording the changes already staged.
当命令行给出文件时，该命令将提交指定文件的内容，而不记录已经暂存的更改。
When first created, objects are stored in individual files, but for efficiency may later be compressed together into "pack files".
当第一次创建时，对象存储在单个文件中，但是为了更效率可以稍后压缩成"包文件"。

When given a two-part name section.key, the value for section.<url>.key whose <url> part matches the best to the given URL is returned (if no such key exists, the value for section.key is used as a fallback).
当给出两部分名称 section.key 时，返回 <url> 部分与给定 URL 匹配最佳的<url>.key（如果没有这样的键，则使用 section.key 的值）。
When given just the section as name, do so for all the keys in the section and list them.
当给出该部分作为名称时，对于该部分中的所有键执行此操作，并列出它们。
When given, and the repository to clone from is accessed via ssh, this specifies a non-default path for the command run on the other end.
给定时，通过 ssh 访问要克隆的仓库，这指定了另一端运行的命令的非默认路径。
When giving multiple pattern expressions combined with <c0>--or</c0>, this flag is specified to limit the match to files that have lines to match all of them.
当给出由 <c0>--or</c0> 组合的多个正则表达式时，指定该标志用于限制匹配的文件为，有行匹配所有的正则（译注：不一定要在同一行）。
When inventing new variables for use in your own tool, make sure their names do not conflict with those that are used by Git itself and other popular tools, and describe them in your documentation.
当在您自己的工具中使用新变量时，请确保其名称与 Git 本身和其他流行工具使用的名称不冲突，并在文档中进行描述。
When it is not obvious how to apply a change, the following happens:
如果不明白如何应用变更，则会发生以下情况：
When multiple <c1>-C</c1> options are given, each subsequent non-absolute <c2>-C <path></c2> is interpreted relative to the preceding <c3>-C <path></c3>.
当给出多个 <c1>-C</c1> 选项时，相对于前面的 <c3>-C <path></c3> 解释每个后续非绝对的 <c2>-C <path></c2> 。
When multiple values are taken then all values of a key from all files will be used.
当采用多个值时，将使用所有文件中的所有值的所有值。

When neither the command-line nor the configuration specify what to push, the default behavior is used, which corresponds to the <c0>simple</c0> value for <c1>push.default</c1>: the current branch is pushed to the corresponding upstream branch, but as a safety measure, the push is aborted if the upstream branch does not have the same name as the local one.
当命令行和配置都不指定要推送的内容时，使用默认行为，这对应于 <c1>push.default</c1> 的 <c0>simple</c0> 值：当前分支被推送到相应的上游分支，但是作为安全措施，如果上游分支不具有与本地分支相同的名称，则推送被中止。
When no <c0><stash></c0> is given, it removes the latest one.
当没有给出 <c0><stash></c0> 时，它会删除最新的。
When no remote is specified, by default the <c0>origin</c0> remote will be used, unless there’s an upstream branch configured for the current branch.
当没有指定远程时，默认情况下，将使用 <c0>origin</c0> remote，除非为当前分支配置了上游分支。
When pathnames are given, the command makes a commit that only records the changes made to the named paths:
当给定路径名时，该命令进行提交，该记录仅记录对指定路径所做的更改：

When reading, the values are read from the system, global and repository local configuration files by default, and options <c0>--system</c0>, <c1>--global</c1>, <c2>--local</c2> and <c3>--file <filename></c3> can be used to tell the command to read from only that location (see <a4>FILES</a4>).
读取时，默认情况下，从系统，全局和仓库本地配置文件读取值，并且选项 <c0>--system</c0> ， <c1>--global</c1> ， <c2>--local</c2> 和 <c3>--file <filename></c3> 可用于告知命令只从该位置读取(请参阅 <a4>FILES</a4> )。
When rebase exits <c3>topic</c3> will remain the checked-out branch.
当 rebase 退出 <c3>topic</c3> 将仍然是检出的分支。
When recording your own work, the contents of modified files in your working tree are temporarily stored to a staging area called the "index" with <e0>git add</e0>.
记录自己的工作时，使用 <e0>git add</e0> 工作树中修改后的文件的内容将暂存到的名为"index"的暂存区域。

When run in a directory that does not have ".git" repository directory, Git tries to find such a directory in the parent directories to find the top of the working tree, but by default it does not cross filesystem boundaries.
当在没有".git"仓库目录的目录中运行时，Git 尝试在父目录中找到这样一个目录，以找到工作树的顶部，但默认情况下不跨越文件系统边界。
When running from a subdirectory in a repository, patched paths outside the directory are ignored.
从仓库的子目录运行时，目录之外的补丁将被忽略。
When set to preserve, rebase with the <c0>--preserve-merges</c0> option passed to <c1>git rebase</c1> so that locally created merge commits will not be flattened.
当设置为保留时，使用 <c0>--preserve-merges</c0> 选项传递到 <c1>git rebase</c1> ，以便本地创建的合并提交将不会被 flattened 。
When showing "other" files, show only those matched by an exclude pattern.
显示 "其他" 文件时，只显示与排除模式匹配的文件。
When showing <c0>short</c0> or <c1>porcelain</c1> status output, print the filename verbatim and terminate the entries with NUL, instead of LF.
当显示 <c0>short</c0> 或 <c1>porcelain</c1> 状态输出时，逐字打印文件，并用 NUL 而不是 LF 终止条目。
When showing files in the index, print only those matched by an exclude pattern.
在索引中显示文件时，只打印排除模式匹配的文件。

When the <commit> argument is a branch name, the <c0>--detach</c0> option can be used to detach HEAD at the tip of the branch (<c1>git checkout <branch></c1> would check out that branch without detaching HEAD).
当<commit>参数是一个分支名称时，可以使用 <c0>--detach</c0> 选项分离头部的分支( <c1>git checkout <branch></c1> 将在不分离 HEAD 的情况下检出)。
When the color setting for <c4>name</c4> is undefined, the command uses <c5>color.ui</c5> as fallback.
当 <c4>name</c4> 的颜色设置未定义时，该命令将使用 <c5>color.ui</c5> 作为备用。
When the command enters the interactive mode, it shows the files and directories to be cleaned, and goes into its interactive command loop.
当命令进入交互模式时，它显示要清理的文件和目录，并进入其交互式命令循环。
When the command enters the interactive mode, it shows the output of the <e0>status</e0> subcommand, and then goes into its interactive command loop.
当命令进入交互模式时，它显示 <e0>status</e0> 子命令的输出，然后进入其交互式命令循环。

When the command line does not specify what to push with <c0><refspec>...</c0> arguments or <c1>--all</c1>, <c2>--mirror</c2>, <c3>--tags</c3> options, the command finds the default <c4><refspec></c4> by consulting <c5>remote.*.push</c5> configuration, and if it is not found, honors <c6>push.default</c6> configuration to decide what to push (See <a7>git-config[1]</a7> for the meaning of <c8>push.default</c8>).

当命令行没有使用 <c0><refspec>...</c0> 参数或 <c1>--all</c1> ， <c2>--mirror</c2> ，<c3>--tags</c3>选项指定要推送什么时，该命令通过咨询 <c5>remote.*.push</c5> 配置找到默认的 <c4><refspec></c4> ，如果没有找到，则考 <c6>push.default</c6> 虑配置来决定要推送的内容(参见 <a7>git-config[1]</a7> ，了解 <c8>push.default</c8> 的含义)。
When the command line does not specify where to push with the <c0><repository></c0> argument, <c1>branch.*.remote</c1> configuration for the current branch is consulted to determine where to push.
当命令行没有指定使用 <c0><repository></c0> 参数推送的位置时，将查询当前分支的 <c1>branch.*.remote</c1> 配置，以确定要推送的位置。
When the environment variable <c0>GIT_EXTERNAL_DIFF</c0> is set, the program named by it is called, instead of the diff invocation described above.
当设置环境变量 <c0>GIT_EXTERNAL_DIFF</c0> 时，调用由其命名的程序，而不是上述的 diff 调用。
When the git-rebase command is run, it will first execute a "pre-rebase" hook if one exists.
当 git-rebase 命令运行时，它将首先执行"pre-rebase"钩子（如果存在）。
When the pattern matches the path in question, the attributes listed on the line are given to the path.
当模式与所讨论的路径匹配时，行上列出的属性被赋予路径。
When the prompt ends with double <e0>>></e0> like this, you can make more than one selection, concatenated with whitespace or comma.
当提示以双重的 <e0>>></e0> 结束时，您可以进行多个选择，用空格或逗号连接。
When the prompt ends with double <e0>>></e0>, you can make more than one selection, concatenated with whitespace or comma.
当提示以双倍的 <e0>>></e0> 结束时，您可以进行多个选择，并用空格或逗号连接。

When the repository to clone from is on a local machine, this flag bypasses the normal "Git aware" transport mechanism and clones the repository by making a copy of HEAD and everything under objects and refs directories.
当克隆的存储库在本地机器上时，此标志绕过正常的"Git 感知"传输机制，并通过将 HEAD 的副本和对象和参考目录下的所有内容复制到存储库中。
When the repository to clone is on the local machine, instead of using hard links, automatically setup <c0>.git/objects/info/alternates</c0> to share the objects with the source repository.
当克隆的存储库在本地机器上时，而不是使用硬链接，自动设置 <c0>.git/objects/info/alternates</c0> 以与源存储库共享对象。
When this option is used, neither remote-tracking branches nor the related configuration variables are created.
使用此选项时，不会创建远程跟踪分支和相关配置变量。
When true, rebase the current branch on top of the upstream branch after fetching.
如果是，则在抓取之后，变基当前分支到上游分支顶部。
When used with -C/-c/--amend options, or when committing after a conflicting cherry-pick, declare that the authorship of the resulting commit now belongs to the committer.
当与 -C/-c/--amend 选项一起使用时，或在冲突的 cherry-pick 之后提交时，声明所生成的提交的作者身份现在属于提交者。
When using the <c1>--reference-if-able</c1>, a non existing directory is skipped with a warning instead of aborting the clone.
当使用 <c1>--reference-if-able</c1> 时，会跳过一个不存在的目录，而不是中止该克隆。

When writing, the new value is written to the repository local configuration file by default, and options <c0>--system</c0>, <c1>--global</c1>, <c2>--file <filename></c2> can be used to tell the command to write to that location (you can say <c3>--local</c3> but that is the default).
写入时，默认情况下将新值写入仓库本地配置文件，选项 <c0>--system</c0> ， <c1>--global</c1> ， <c2>--file <filename></c2> 可以用来告诉命令写入该位置(你可以说 <c3>--local</c3> ，但这是默认的)。
When you are done, run <c1>git commit</c1> to finally record the merge:
完成后，运行 <c1>git commit</c1> 以最终记录合并：
When you are in the middle of something, you learn that there are upstream changes that are possibly relevant to what you are doing.
当你处于某种状态的时候，你会发现上游的变化与你正在做的事情有关。
When you are satisfied with the filtered result, press ENTER (empty) back to the main menu.
当您对过滤后的结果感到满意时，按 ENTER (empty) 返回主菜单。
When your local changes do not conflict with the changes in the upstream, a simple <c0>git pull</c0> will let you move forward.
当您的本地更改与上游的更改不冲突时，简单的 <c0>git pull</c0> 将让您向前推进。
Whereas a "lightweight" tag is simply a name for an object (usually a commit object).
而"轻量级"标签只是一个对象的名称(通常是提交对象)。
Whether or not incremental imports are supported from a particular foreign source depends on the frontend program in use.
是否从特定的外部来源支持增量导入取决于正在使用的前端程序。
Whether to show a diffstat of what changed upstream since the last rebase.
是否显示自上次 rebase 之后上游变化的变化。
Whether to skip reading settings from the system-wide $(prefix)/etc/gitconfig file.
是否从系统范围的 $(prefix)/etc/gitconfig 文件中跳过阅读设置。
Whether to skip reading settings from the system-wide <c0>$(prefix)/etc/gitconfig</c0> file.
是否从系统范围的 <c0>$(prefix)/etc/gitconfig</c0> 文件中跳过阅读设置。
Which file to place a pattern in depends on how the pattern is meant to be used.
哪个文件用来放置模式，取决于模式要如何使用。
Why bisecting merge commits can be harder than bisecting linear history
为什么平分合并提交可能比平分线性历史更难
Wildcards in the pattern such as <c0>*</c0> or <c1>?</c1> are treated as literal characters.
格式中的通配符（例如 <c0>*</c0> 或 <c1>?</c1> 被视为 literal 字符。
With --no-commit perform the merge but pretend the merge failed and do not autocommit, to give the user a chance to inspect and further tweak the merge result before committing.
使用--no-commit 执行合并，但假装合并失败，并且不自动提交，以便给用户有机会在提交之前检查并进一步调整合并结果。

With <c0>--contains</c0>, shows only the branches that contain the named commit (in other words, the branches whose tip commits are descendants of the named commit), <c1>--no-contains</c1> inverts it.
使用 <c0>--contains</c0> ，只显示包含指定提交的分支(换句话说，分支尖端的提交是指定提交的后代)， <c1>--no-contains</c1> 反转它。
With <c0>--no-tags</c0> option, <c1>git fetch <name></c1> does not import tags from the remote repository.
使用 <c0>--no-tags</c0> 选项， <c1>git fetch <name></c1> 不会从远程仓储库导入标签。
With <c0>--tags</c0> option, <c1>git fetch <name></c1> imports every tag from the remote repository.
使用 <c0>--tags</c0> 选项， <c1>git fetch <name></c1> 从远程仓库导入每个标签。
With <c0>-f</c0> option, <c1>git fetch <name></c1> is run immediately after the remote information is set up.
使用 <c0>-f</c0> 选项，在设置远程信息后立即运行 <c1>git fetch <name></c1> 。
With <c2>--merged</c2>, only branches merged into the named commit (i.e. the branches whose tip commits are reachable from the named commit) will be listed.
通过 <c2>--merged</c2> ，只列出合并到指定提交中的分支(即分枝尖端的提交是从指定指交可达的)。
With <c3>--no-merged</c3> only branches not merged into the named commit will be listed.
使用<c3>--no-merged</c3> ，只有没有合并到指定提交中的分支将被列出，。
With <c3>--rebase</c3>, it runs <e4>git rebase</e4> instead of <e5>git merge</e5>.
使用 <c3>--rebase</c3> ，它运行 <e4>git rebase</e4> 而不是 <e5>git merge</e5> 。
With <c3>-m</c3>, changes made to the working tree file can be discarded to re-create the original conflicted merge result.
使用 <c3>-m</c3> ，可以丢弃对工作树文件所做的更改，以重新创建原始冲突的合并结果。
With a <c0>-d</c0> or <c1>-D</c1> option, <c2><branchname></c2> will be deleted.
使用 <c0>-d</c0> 或 <c1>-D</c1> 选项， <c2><branchname></c2> 将被删除。
With a <c0>-m</c0> or <c1>-M</c1> option, <oldbranch> will be renamed to <newbranch>.
使用 <c0>-m</c0> 或 <c1>-M</c1> 选项，<oldbranch>将被重命名为<newbranch>。
With no arguments, shows a list of existing remotes.
没有参数，显示现有远程的列表。
With no options and no COMMAND or GUIDE given, the synopsis of the <e0>git</e0> command and a list of the most commonly used Git commands are printed on the standard output.
没有选项，没有给出任何命令或指导， <e0>git</e0> 命令的概要和最常用的 Git 命令的列表将打印在标准输出上。
With optional <c0><pattern>...</c0>, e.g. <c1>git branch --list 'maint-*'</c1>, list only the branches that match the pattern(s).
使用可选的 <c0><pattern>...</c0> ，例如 <c1>git branch --list 'maint-*' </c1> 仅列出与模式匹配的分支。
With optional <c0><pattern>...</c0>, e.g. <c1>git tag --list 'v-*'</c1>, list only the tags that match the pattern(s).
使用可选的 <c0><pattern>...</c0> ，例如 <c1>git tag --list 'v-*' </c1> ，仅列出与模式匹配的标签。
With the <c0>--index</c0> option the patch is also applied to the index, and with the <c1>--cached</c1> option the patch is only applied to the index.
使用 <c0>--index</c0> 选项，补丁也应用于索引，使用 <c1>--cached</c1> 选项，补丁仅应用于索引。
With the latter, you can use the manual viewer of your choice; see <a0>git-help[1]</a0> for more information.
使用后者，您可以使用您选择的手册查看器;详见 <a0>git-help[1]</a0> 。
With this option, <e0>git gc</e0> checks whether any housekeeping is required; if not, it exits without performing any work.
使用此选项， <e0>git gc</e0> 可检查是否需要任何家政服务;如果没有，则退出而不执行任何工作。
Without <c0>-f</c0> <e1>git branch</e1> refuses to change an existing branch.
没有 <c0>-f</c0> <e1>git branch</e1> 拒绝更改现有的分支。

Without additional configuration, pushes the current branch to the configured upstream (<c0>remote.origin.merge</c0> configuration variable) if it has the same name as the current branch, and errors out without pushing otherwise.
没有其他配置，如果上游分支与当前分支具有相同的名称，将当前分支推送到配置的上游( <c0>remote.origin.merge</c0> 配置变量)，如果名称不相同则出错。
Without the <c3>-z</c3> option, filenames with "unusual" characters are quoted as explained for the configuration variable <c4>core.quotePath</c4> (see <a5>git-config[1]</a5>).
没有 <c3>-z</c3> 选项，引用了具有"异常"字符的文件名，如配置变量 <c4>core.quotePath</c4> 所述(参见<a5>git-config[1]</a5>)。
Without these options, the command applies the patch only to files, and does not require them to be in a Git repository.
没有这些选项，该命令将补丁仅应用于文件，并且不要求它们位于 Git 存储库中。
Without this option old data in <c1>.git/FETCH_HEAD</c1> will be overwritten.
没有这个选项， <c1>.git/FETCH_HEAD</c1> 中的旧数据将被覆盖。

Workflows
Working branch; defaults to HEAD.
工作分支；默认为 HEAD。
Working tree files, whether modified or not, will be left alone.
工作树文件（无论是否修改）将被留下。
Works like <c0>git push <remote></c0>, where <remote> is the current branch’s remote (or <c1>origin</c1>, if no remote is configured for the current branch).
像 <c0>git push <remote></c0> ，其中<remote>是当前分支的远程(或 <c1>origin</c1> ，如果没有为当前分支配置远程)。
Worktree-specific files such as HEAD or index are taken from $GIT_DIR.
Worktree 特定的文件，例如 HEAD 或索引取自 $GIT_DIR 。
You almost certainly want to direct into a file (e.g., <c0>GIT_TRACE_PACKFILE=/tmp/my.pack</c0>) rather than displaying it on the terminal or mixing it with other trace output.
您几乎肯定要直接进入文件(例如， <c0>GIT_TRACE_PACKFILE=/tmp/my.pack</c0> )，而不是将其显示在终端上或与其他跟踪输出进行混合。
You also could say <c0>c</c0> or <c1>clean</c1> above as long as the choice is unique.
只要选择是唯一的，您也可以说 <c0>c</c0> 或 <c1>clean</c1> 。
You also could say <c0>s</c0> or <c1>sta</c1> or <c2>status</c2> above as long as the choice is unique.
只要选择是唯一的，您也可以说 <c0>s</c0> 或 <c1>sta</c1> 或 <c2>status</c2> 。
You are free to make arbitrary changes to the patch, but note that some changes may have confusing results, or even result in a patch that cannot be applied.
您可以随意对修补程序进行任意更改，但请注意，某些更改可能会导致混乱的结果，甚至导致无法应用的修补程序。
You can also have a similar effect without committing by using <c3>git add -u</c3>.
您也可以使用 <c3>git add -u</c3> 来不提交就有相似的效果。
You can give the <c0>-m</c0> flag to the command, which would try a three-way merge:
您可以将 <c0>-m</c0> 标志指定给该命令，这将尝试三向合并：
You can input space-separated patterns to exclude files and directories from deletion.
您可以输入空格分隔的模式，以排除删除的文件和目录。
You can learn more about individual Git commands with "git help command".
您可以使用 “git help command” 了解有关单个 Git 命令的更多信息。
You can leave out at most one of <c3>A</c3> and <c4>B</c4>, in which case it defaults to <c5>HEAD</c5>.
您最多可以省略 <c3>A</c3> 和 <c4>B</c4> ，默认为 <c5>HEAD</c5> 。
You can leave out at most one of A and B, in which case it defaults to HEAD.
您最多可以省略 A 和 B 中的一个，在这种情况下，它默认为 HEAD。
You can make interesting things happen to a repository every time you push into it, by setting up <e0>hooks</e0> there.
你可以通过在这里设置 <e0>hooks</e0> ，在每次推送一个仓库时都执行有趣的事情。
You can omit any one of <commit>, which has the same effect as using HEAD instead.
您可以省略任何一个<commit>，这与使用 HEAD 有相同的效果。
You can omit having to type return here, by setting the configuration variable <c0>interactive.singleKey</c0> to <c1>true</c1>.
通过将配置变量 <c0>interactive.singleKey</c0> 设置为 <c1>true</c1> ，可以省略输入返回。

You can omit the <c0>--no-index</c0> option when running the command in a working tree controlled by Git and at least one of the paths points outside the working tree, or when running the command outside a working tree controlled by Git.
在由 Git 控制的工作树中运行命令时，可以省略 <c0>--no-index</c0> 选项，并且至少有一个路径指向工作树之外，或者在工作树之外运行命令时由 Git 控制。
You can override these rules either by command-line options or by environment variables.
您可以通过命令行选项或环境变量覆盖这些规则。
You can prevent staging any addition lines by deleting them.
删除它们可以防止暂存任何添加行。
You can prevent staging the modification by converting "-" lines to " ", and removing "+" lines.
您可以通过将“ - ”行转换为 " "，并删除“+”行来防止进行修改。
You can prevent staging their removal by converting the "-" to a " " (space).
您可以通过将 “-” 转为 " " (空格)来防止其移除。
You can query/set/replace/unset options with this command.
你可以使用此命令 查询/设置/更换/取消 选项。
You can reorder the commits, and you can remove them (weeding out bad or otherwise unwanted patches).
您可以重新排序提交，您可以移除它们(除去坏的或不需要的补丁)。
You can say <e1>*</e1> to choose everything.
您可以说 <e1>*</e1> 选择所有内容。
You can select one of the following options and type return:
您可以选择以下选项之一并键入 return：
You can stage context lines for removal by converting the space to a "-".
您可以通过将空格转换为"-"来排列要删除的上下文行。
You can stage these changes by using <a1>git-add[1]</a1>.
您可以使用 <a1>git-add[1]</a1> 来暂存这些更改。
You can use <e1>git diff</e1> to locate the markers (<<<<<<) and make edits to resolve the conflict.
您可以使用 <e1>git diff</e1> 找到标记(<<<<<<)并进行编辑以解决冲突。
You can use HEAD to compare it with the latest commit, or a branch name to compare with the tip of a different branch.
您可以使用 HEAD 将其与最新的提交进行比较，或分支名称以与不同分支的提示进行比较。
You can use the <e0>@</e0> construct with an empty ref part to get at a reflog entry of the current branch.
您可以使用具有空引用部分的 <e0>@</e0> 结构来获取当前分支的 reflog 条目。
You can use this hook to do sanity checks and reject the rebase if it isn’t appropriate.
您可以使用此钩子进行健全检查，如果不合适可拒绝 rebase。

You could omit <branch>, in which case the command degenerates to "check out the current branch", which is a glorified no-op with a rather expensive side-effects to show only the tracking information, if exists, for the current branch.
您可以省略<branch>，在这种情况下，命令退化为"检出当前分支"，这是一个有非常昂贵的副作用的 glorified no-op ，用于显示当前分支的跟踪信息（如果存在） 。
You could use this as a back-up method.
您可以将其用作备份方法。
You do not have to be subscribed to the list to send a message there.
您不必订阅该列表即可在那里发送消息。
You may also add new content that does not exist in the patch; simply add new lines, each starting with "+".
您还可以添加补丁中不存在的新内容;只需添加新行，每行以"+"开头。
You may also specify <c1>-</c1> which is synonymous with <c2>"@{-1}"</c2>.
You may override individual configuration parameters when running any git command by using the <c0>-c</c0> option.
使用 <c0>-c</c0> 选项运行任何 git 命令时，可以覆盖单个配置参数。
You may specify more than one branch for deletion.
您可以指定多个分支进行删除。
You might want this if you are feeding literal paths to Git (e.g., paths previously given to you by <c4>git ls-tree</c4>, <c5>--raw</c5> diff output, etc).
如果您正在向 Git 提供文字路径（如之前由 <c4>git ls-tree</c4> ，<c5>--raw </c5> diff 输出等提供给您的路径），您可能需要这样做。
You should instead write:
你应该写：
You should not need to set it yourself unless you want to be paranoid about making sure an operation has touched every ref (e.g., because you are cloning a repository to make a backup).
您不需要自己设置，除非您想要确保操作是否已触及每个引用(例如，因为您正在克隆仓库进行备份)。
You should refrain from abusing this option to sneak substantial changes into a merge commit.
您不应该滥用此选项来将大量更改潜入到合并提交中。
You should understand the implications of rewriting history if you amend a commit that has already been published.
如果您修改已发布的提交，您应该了解重写历史记录的含义。
You should understand the implications of using <e0>git rebase</e0> on a repository that you share.
您应该了解在您共享的仓库中使用 <e0>git rebase</e0> 的含义。
You use it by first telling it a "bad" commit that is known to contain the bug, and a "good" commit that is known to be before the bug was introduced.
要使用它，首先告诉它一个已知包含该错误的“bad”提交，以及在引入错误之前已知的“good”提交。
You will have to resolve any such merge failure and run <c0>git rebase --continue</c0>.
您将必须解决任何此类合并失败，然后运行 <c0>git rebase --continue</c0> 。
You would have to first check which paths are conflicting with <e2>git status</e2> and after fixing them manually in your working tree, you would stage the result as usual with <e3>git add</e3>:

by listing files as arguments to the <e0>commit</e0> command (without --interactive or --patch switch), in which case the commit will ignore changes staged in the index, and instead record the current content of the listed files (which must already be known to Git);
通过将文件作为参数列出到 <e0>commit</e0> 命令(不带--interactive 或-patch 开关)，在这种情况下，提交将忽略索引中暂存的更改，而是记录列出的当前内容文件(必须被 Git 已知);
by using <e0>git add</e0> to incrementally "add" changes to the index before using the <e1>commit</e1> command (Note: even modified files must be "added");
在使用 <e1>commit</e1> 命令之前，通过使用 <e0>git add</e0> 来增加索引中“添加”的更改(注意：修改后的文件也必须“添加”);
by using <e0>git rm</e0> to remove files from the working tree and the index, again before using the <e1>commit</e1> command;
在使用 <e1>commit</e1> 命令之前，使用 <e0>git rm</e0> 从工作树和索引中移除文件;

by using the --interactive or --patch switches with the <e0>commit</e0> command to decide one by one which files or hunks should be part of the commit in addition to contents in the index, before finalizing the operation.
通过使用带有 <e0>commit</e0> 命令的--interactive 或-patch 开关，在完成操作之前，除了索引中的内容之外，逐一决定哪些文件或 hunks 应该是提交的一部分。

by using the -a switch with the <e0>commit</e0> command to automatically "add" changes from all known files (i.e. all files that are already listed in the index) and to automatically "rm" files in the index that have been removed from the working tree, and then perform the actual commit;
通过使用带有 <e0>commit</e0> 命令的 -a 开关，可以自动从所有已知文件(即所有已经在索引中列出的文件)中添加更改，并在索引中自动 “rm” 已从工作树中删除，然后执行实际提交;

y - stage this hunk n - do not stage this hunk q - quit; do not stage this hunk or any of the remaining ones a - stage this hunk and all later hunks in the file d - do not stage this hunk or any of the later hunks in the file g - select a hunk to go to / - search for a hunk matching the given regex j - leave this hunk undecided, see next undecided hunk J - leave this hunk undecided, see next hunk k - leave this hunk undecided, see previous undecided hunk K - leave this hunk undecided, see previous hunk s - split the current hunk into smaller hunks e - manually edit the current hunk ?

y - 暂存该块 n - 不暂存该块 q - quit; 不暂存该块或任何剩下的 a - 暂存该块及文件中所有以后的 d - 不暂存该块或后续文件中的任何块 g - 选择一个块以继续 / - 搜索匹配给定正则表达式的一个块 j - 离开该块暂不决定，查看下一个未决定的块 J - 离开该块暂不决定，查看下一个块 k - 离开该块暂不决定，查看上一个未决定的块 K - 离开该块暂不决定，查看上一个块 s - 分割当前块为更小的块 e - 手动编辑当前块 ?
